tank.name: Champion
tank.desc: The Champion stands as a paragon of battle, a warrior whose very presence on the frontline inspires courage and strikes fear into enemies.

steps.name: Relentless
steps.description: You can make melee attacks as a Half-Action instead of an action

steps.name: Relentless II
steps.description: When you make a melee attack against an opponent, receive 1 healing

steps.name: Relentless III
steps.description: When you make a melee attack against an opponent, gain +1 to the check and damage with that weapon for the duration
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Defender
steps.description: Defend an ally, While they are in reach range you both take half damage
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Defender II
steps.description: When you use Defender, You and your ally gain +10 armor for the duration
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Defender III
steps.description: When you use Defender, You and your ally receive 5 healing

steps.name: Battlecry
steps.description: Once per day as an Off-Action, You and allies within reach range receive [[1d6]] healing

steps.name: Battlecry II
steps.description: When you use Battlecry, remove a Cognition condition from you and allies within reach range

steps.name: Overhealth
steps.description: When you are at full wounds and receive healing, repair your armor instead

steps.name: Last Stand
steps.description: Once per day, when you take the Injured condition, receive 10 healing

steps.name: Immortal
steps.description: You are immortal. Your injuries linger; bones bolted together, flesh falls away, until only a skeletal warrior remains.

tank.name: Child of Fenrir
tank.desc: The Child of Fenrir is a path shrouded in the ancient and formidable legacy of the legendary wolf Fenrir. Those who walk this path channel the untamed might and the deep-rooted spirituality of the wolf, embodying a force that is both awe-inspiring and fearsome. As a Child of Fenrir, you are not just a warrior; you are a symbol of primal power and freedom, a living testament to the wild spirit that Fenrir represents. Your presence on the battlefield is more than physical - it is a manifestation of the raw essence of nature’s most revered and mystical predator. This path is a calling for those who resonate with the strength, agility, and spiritual depth of the wolf, transcending species and form to tap into something ancient and powerful at the very core of existence.

steps.name: Wolf Bite
steps.description: You have a bite that deals damage equal to your Strength check. You can choose to heal for 3 healing per additional success

steps.name: Mana Sense
steps.description: Tap into the spiritual energy of Fenris to sense magic. This can be used to identify spellcasters, magical traps, or enchanted objects.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Lupine Agility
steps.description: Gain +2 Agility. You have advantage on checks for agility that involve movement, traversal, or speed

steps.name: Fenris' Whisper
steps.description: You can communicate telepathically with canines and wolf-like creatures within medium range. Additionally, you can sense the intentions of any beast, giving advantage on Mental checks against beasts.

steps.name: Howl
steps.description: Unleash a chilling Howl, choose up to 3 creatures within short range, they must make a Mental check or become enveloped in shadow chains causing the pinned condition
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Predator's Instinct
steps.description: You can track creatures by scent and have advantage on Survival checks to track living creatures. Additionally, while in shadow, gain advantage on Stealth checks, ideal for ambushes or evading detection

steps.name: Howl II
steps.description: When you Howl, you can choose up to 3 creatures, and deal eclipse damage equal to your Agility or Strength check as your shadows tear into them
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Howl III
steps.description: When you Howl, summon 3 PL3 Shadow Wolves that remain for 1 minute. They follow your commands and dissipate when they reach 0 wounds

steps.name: Dominance
steps.description: You have power over beasts. Make a Spirit check contested with a beast. If you succeed, the beast will follow commands for 1 minute, after which it will flee in fear.

steps.name: Territory
steps.description: Spend 1 month in a town to mark it as your Territory. you have advantage on Survival check in your territory. At the start of combat while in your territory gain +10 armor for 1 minute

steps.name: Howl IV
steps.description: When you Howl, Creatures that fail the Mental check take the stunned condition

tank.name: Elevant
tank.desc: The Elevant wields the raw power of the elements like a virtuoso commanding a symphony, blending artistry with destruction. Each movement is a calculated gesture, orchestrating fire, water, earth, and air in harmony to shield allies, inspire courage, and overwhelm enemies. As a conductor of elemental forces, the Elevant turns the battlefield into a dynamic stage where their every action resonates with power and precision.

steps.name: Melody
steps.description: Your presence radiates elemental energy. Cause enemies within reach range to take [[1d4]] elemental damage

steps.name: Symphony
steps.description: Your melee attacks deal an additional 3 elemental damage

steps.name: Melody II
steps.description: Melody now deals an additional 3 damage

steps.name: Symphony II
steps.description: Symphony now deals an additional 3 damage

steps.name: Overture
steps.description: Perform an elemental overture that inspires allies, granting them advantage on their next attack check and +3 damage
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Harmonic
steps.description: teleport in a line, leaving behind a line of elemental energy that deals 1 elemental damage to creatures that pass through it
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Cacophony
steps.description: when an ally within short range is about to be hit by an attack, you can impose disadvantage on the attack check

steps.name: Melody III
steps.description: Melody now has a Medium Range

steps.name: Overture II
steps.description: When you use Overture, give allies an additional 6 damage on their attacks (9 total)

steps.name: Rebirth
steps.description: When you are reduced to 0 wounds, instead of taking the injured condition, you can spend 2 Bolster to receive 10 healing and release a burst of elemental energy, dealing damage to enemies

steps.name: Melody IV
steps.description: Unleash a 'crescendo' by conducting an explosive symphony of elemental energy that pulses outward in rhythmic waves. Each wave deals elemental damage and disrupts nearby enemies' abilities to act (inflicts the Deafened or Confused condition). At the end of the duration, take the Exhaustion and Stunned conditions
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

tank.name: Conviction
tank.desc: The Conviction path represents an unshakable will, where the power of belief, whether in a god, an ideal, or oneself, becomes a force that shapes reality. Champions of Conviction channel this inner strength to protect, heal, and inspire, drawing on the tension between faith and self-reliance. Each action they take reflects their unwavering resolve and empowers them and their allies to stand firm against any threat.

steps.name: Shifting Resolve
steps.description: At the start of your day, make a choice between a +2 to checks either in combat or out of combat. This cannot be changed until a long rest.

steps.name: Emissary
steps.description: Once per day, Heal a creature equal to your Spirit check

steps.name: Beacon
steps.description: Illuminate yourself with divine light, radiating the brilliance of the heavens. Deal damage to creatures within range as radiant light sears their corruption.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Emissary II
steps.description: When you use Emissary, your target is cloaked in celestial protection, gaining +10 armor that glows with the mark of your god.

steps.name: Beacon II
steps.description: When you use Beacon, Vozian Origin is denied for the duration. Vozian creatures are bathed in divine light and take the Exposed condition as their shadowy essence is revealed.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Shifting Resolve II
steps.description: Shifting Resolve now provides a bonus to all checks. You are no longer torn between yourself and your god, your soul in perfect harmony with the celestial will.

steps.name: Insight
steps.description: Forcibly perceive celestial and Vozian influences, your senses filled with the chorus of the divine. Reveal hidden auras, detect lies shaped by dark powers, and sense the hand of providence at work.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Insight II
steps.description: When you use Insight, you and allies within reach are wrapped in radiant wards, gaining +10 armor that shines with a faint celestial glow for the duration.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Beacon III
steps.description: When you use Beacon, the area around you becomes consecrated ground. Allies gain +10 armor under the protection of the heavens. Enemies feel the weight of the divine and have disadvantage on attacks.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Ascendant
steps.description: Become a minor avatar of your god. You are shielded from Corpus conditions, and your strikes carry the favor of the heavens, granting advantage on Attack checks. After the duration take the Stunned Condition
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Avatar of God
steps.description: Channel the full power of your deity, transforming into an avatar of faith. In this form, you are untouchable by mortal harm. Your melee attacks deal extra Solar damage equal to your Spirit, your form blazing with divine power. Afterward, make a Spirit check at disadvantage. On a failure, your god claims your body and soul, and you ascend into the Celestial realm.

tank.name: Forsaken
tank.desc: The Forsaken was once a devout believer in the gods, but their faith was shattered when they were betrayed and abandoned by the very deities they worshiped. This deep betrayal has fueled their desire for revenge and a vow to end the tyranny of the gods. They have vowed to become more powerful than any god and bring justice to the world.

steps.name: Vow of Death
steps.description: If you take the death condition, make a Luck check. On a success, you will yourself back to life, removing the death condition. Reduce your Spirit check by 1.If you take the Death condition, make a Luck check. On success, will yourself back to life, removing the Death condition. Reduce your Luck check by 1.

steps.name: Twist of Fate
steps.description: When you fail a check, check a Luck check. On success, treat it as a success.

steps.name: Relentless
steps.description: You can make melee attacks as a Half-Action instead of an action

steps.name: Defiance
steps.description: After an hitting with a melee attack, spend a Bolster and gain the damage as armor for the duration

steps.name: Godslayer
steps.description: Mark a creature as the target of your retribution. The marked target takes an additional [[1d6]] damage from you.

steps.name: Unwavering Stance
steps.description: After taking this stance, you can negate any damage, but you take the Pinned and Stunned conditions
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Godslayer II
steps.description: When you Mark a creature, the mark allows you to track them while they are in the same Realm as you. Additionally you can read their surface thoughts while in short range

steps.name: Vow of Death II
steps.description: When you use Vow of Death, you regain wounds equal to your Spirit. Additionally, you can immediately take an action

steps.name: Unwavering Stance II
steps.description: When you take the Unwavering Stance, you and allies in range gain +10 armor for the duration
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Godslayer III
steps.description: When you Mark a creature, you can choose a damage type, that creature takes double damage from that damage type

steps.name: Avatar of Discord
steps.description: Transform into a being of pure chaos. You gain immunity to all non-major conditions, and all attacks have advantage. At the end of the minute, take Exhausted and Stunned conditions for 1 minute.

tank.name: Damnation
tank.desc: Bound by a pact with infernal forces, the Knight of Perdition channels dread power at great cost. Their Veil of Perdition cloaks them in shadows, granting strength drawn from the Abyss itself.

steps.name: Hel-Guard
steps.description: Your skin and armor temper with infernal flames, Gain +10 armor
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Presence
steps.description: Your eyes glow faintly and your voice carries a strange echo. You gain advantage on Influence checks when intimidating

steps.name: Hel-Guard II
steps.description: When you use Hel-Guard, gain an additional Off-Action

steps.name: Hel-Guard III
steps.description: When you use Hel-Guard, the granted armor lasts 1 minute

steps.name: Hel-Guard IV
steps.description: When you use Hel-Guard, Your next attack deals an additional [[1d6]] Vozian damage

steps.name: Hel-Guard V
steps.description: When you use Hel-Guard, your movement does not Provoke

steps.name: Hel-Guard VI
steps.description: When you use Hel-Guard, teleport up to short range to an unoccupied space you can see

steps.name: Hel-Guard VII
steps.description: When you use Hel-Guard, enemies within short range must succeed on a Spirit check or gain the Fear condition.

steps.name: Hel-Guard VIII
steps.description: When you use Hel-Guard, heal [[1d6]] wounds as infernal fire cauterizes your wounds

steps.name: Hel-Guard IX
steps.description: When you use Hel-Guard, gain invisibility

steps.name: Knighted
steps.description: You have additional wounds equal to a Physical check of your choice, when you make an attack check against a creature gain 1 healing.

tank.name: Tide Sentinel
tank.desc: The Tide Sentinel embodies the unyielding power and grace of the ocean, wielding water as both a shield and a weapon. They channel the boundless energy of the tides to heal allies, manipulate the battlefield, and summon aquatic allies to aid in combat. Whether calming the chaos or unleashing a torrent of destruction, the Tide Sentinel is a master of adaptability, making them an invaluable force both in battle and beyond.

steps.name: Ocean Spray
steps.description: When you hit an enemy with a melee weapon, a burst of saltwater lashes out, dealing Fluid damage to other creatures in range.

steps.name: Shore-Lorekeeper
steps.description: You have advantage on checks related to marine life, sea navigation, and identifying sea-related artifacts. You can speak the language of sea creatures, allowing you to seek guidance, information, or aid from dolphins, whales, and other aquatic beings.

steps.name: Coral Fortress
steps.description: When you take a Stance, gain spikes of coral that deal piercing damage to creatures that hit you with a melee attack
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Relentless
steps.description: You can make melee attacks as a Half-Action instead of an action

steps.name: Ocean Spray II
steps.description: When you use Ocean Spray, healing waters wash over your allies in range

steps.name: Call of the Deep
steps.description: Spend a Bolster. The sea answers your call, summoning a PL4 swarm of crabs, a giant octopus, or a sea creature of your choice that fights at your side.

steps.name: Hydro-Illusion
steps.description: While laying still in water that covers your whole form, you are invisible
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Relentless II
steps.description: When you make a melee attack against an opponent, repair 1 armor as the tide restores your strength.

steps.name: Ocean Spray III
steps.description: When you use Ocean Spray, creatures within range must make a Strength check or be knocked prone by the forceful wave.

steps.name: Shipshape
steps.description: You excel at ship maintenance and repairs. Gain advantage on Crafting checks to repair or maintain boats and ships, and you can temporarily boost ship speed with your knowledge of optimal rigging and sail adjustments

steps.name: Oceanic Dominion
steps.description: Once per day, you command the waters themselves. Waves churn and rise at your will. Creatures in water become Pinned. Those fully submerged are Pinned and Constrained as the ocean crushes them in its grip.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

tank.name: Titanblood
tank.desc: Titanblood warriors are the living embodiment of their colossal ancestry, channeling the raw might of ancient giants to dominate the battlefield. Their bodies adapt to their surroundings, becoming unyielding as stone or expanding to titanic proportions. Through sheer physical power, they unleash seismic destruction, shatter the ground beneath their foes, and reshape the battlefield to their will. Driven by a primal rage and boundless strength, Titanbloods leap into combat with apocalyptic force, creating devastating fissures and leaving entire landscapes scarred by their might. They are immovable forces, unstoppable powers, and avatars of their titanic lineage.

steps.name: Titan Slam
steps.description: Slam into the ground with a titans force, dealing damage equal to your Strength check to creatures within range

steps.name: Titan Slam II
steps.description: When you use Titan Slam, force all enemies within range to succeed on a Physical check or fall prone

steps.name: Colossus
steps.description: You become an indomitable force, unaffected by enemy interference. Gain immunity to the Pinned and Prone conditions if you chose

steps.name: Titan Slam III
steps.description: When you use Titanic Slam, you can use it in a line up to short range instead of an area of effect

steps.name: Colossus II
steps.description: When you hit with a melee attack, gain +1 damage with that attack. This bonus stacks if you hit with the same attack again before the end of your next turn. The bonus resets if you fail to hit before the duration ends.

steps.name: Bloodcalling
steps.description: Your body swells with power. Gain +2 Strength mod and increase your size by one category. You can still move through spaces sized for a medium creature
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Titan Slam IV
steps.description: When you use Titan Slam, you can use it in a line up to short range instead of an area of effect

steps.name: Titan Slam V
steps.description: When you use Titan Slam, you can leap up to half your movement and does not Provoke

steps.name: Relentless
steps.description: You can make melee attacks as a Half-Action instead of an action

steps.name: Relentless II
steps.description: When you make a melee attack, gain +1 strength mod. This bonus stacks if you hit with the same attack again before the end of your next turn. The bonus resets if you fail to hit before the duration ends.

steps.name: Titan Slam VI
steps.description: When you use Titan Slam, you can choose to create fissures in a line in any two directions you choose. Each fissure is 20 ft wide. Creatures in the line must make a Physical check or fall in and become wedged between the fissures. The fissures remain until the end of your next turn. While holding them open, you cannot move or act. At the end of your next turn, the fissures close, trapping any creature inside permanently.

tank.name: Plaguebringer
tank.desc: The Plaguebringer is a master of disease, decay, and the darker aspects of nature. They understand the delicate balance between life and death and can manipulate it to their advantage. This path is perfect for players who enjoy using cunning and strategy over brute force, affecting entire battlefields with debilitating diseases and wielding the fear of contagion as a weapon.

steps.name: Plagued One
steps.description: You are immune to disease. Your melee attacks cause a simple disease on failed Survival checks that allows you to track your foe while they are on the same plane as you. You have advantage on attack checks against creatures that have your disease. Your disease lasts for 1 week if left untreated

steps.name: Infectious
steps.description: When a creature is infected with your disease, they take the coughing condition until the end of their next turn.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Infectious II
steps.description: When a creature is infected with your disease, they take the Confused condition

steps.name: Infectious III
steps.description: When a creature is infected with your disease, they hallucinate their worst fears and must make a Survival check or take the fear condition

steps.name: Plague Burst
steps.description: Release a cloud of virulent pathogens that infect enemies within range. Creatures must make a Survival check or become infected with your disease

steps.name: Carrion Call
steps.description: summon a PL6 carrion bird, swarm insects, or swarm of rats as allies. These creatures listen to your commands, and can heal [[1d4]] to you by feasting on creatures that have your disease

steps.name: Infectious IV
steps.description: When a creature is infected with your disease, and they take the Death condition, they burst with a cloud of virulent pathogens within range. All creatures you choose within range must make Survival checks or contract your disease

steps.name: Infectious V
steps.description: When a creature is infected with your disease, they take toxic damage at the start of their turn

steps.name: Relentless
steps.description: You can make melee attacks as a Half-Action instead of an action

steps.name: Relentless II
steps.description: When you make a melee attack against a creature with your disease, receive healing

steps.name: Plague Burst II
steps.description: When you plague burst, allies within range receive healing

tank.name: Bannerlord
tank.desc: The Bannerlord is a flamboyant and charismatic warrior who wields different banners to grant various auras to themselves and their allies. They are known for their showmanship and flair in battle, using their performance, voice, and colorful banners to captivate their audience and sway the tides of combat

steps.name: Banner of Protection
steps.description: Any allied creatures that are within range of the banner gains 3 additional armor to a maximum of 3 from this feature at the start of their turn

steps.name: Banner
steps.description: Place a banner, this banner lasts for 1 minute. You have 2 banners per day. You can have more than one banner active at a time.

steps.name: Banner of Illusion
steps.description: This banner can create illusions, such as Doppelgangers, Illusory Terrain, Phantasmal Foes, or Concealing Fog, adding a layer of deception to your strategies. Creatures can attempt to see through these illusions with Intellect or Observation checks

steps.name: Banner of Invisibility
steps.description: Creatures within the banner's range become invisible, although the banner remains visible.

steps.name: Banner of Safety
steps.description: This banner, when placed, becomes a doorway to a cozy home of your design that can comfortably fit 6 medium-sized creatures. It remains for the duration or until the banner is removed or destroyed. The banner from the outside looks like any of your banners, but when a creature enters the range, they see the home.

steps.name: Banner of Swiftness
steps.description: This banner boosts you and your allies' combat effectiveness, allowing two attacks when taking the Attack action.

steps.name: Banner of the Undying
steps.description: This banner inspires allies and protects them from death. When reduced to 0 wounds, they automatically regain 1 wound. This feature can only be used once per creature

steps.name: Banner of Valor
steps.description: Upon deployment, allies within the range gain advantage on their next attack check, This feature can only be used once per creature

steps.name: Banner: Holding
steps.description: You can activate one banner while holding it in your off-hand, providing its effects within its range. Simultaneously, you have the option to deploy another banner

steps.name: Banner: Quickened
steps.description: You can place a banner as a off-action instead of a full action

steps.name: Banner: Range
steps.description: Increase the range of your banners to short range

steps.name: Bannerbound
steps.description: you can teleport to any active banner within range

tank.name: Cavalier
tank.desc: The Cavalier is a master of mounted combat and battlefield command. They wield reach weapons with deadly precision, coordinating seamlessly with their steed to dominate the field. Whether charging an enemy line or holding position, their presence inspires allies and breaks foes.

steps.name: Movement Synergy
steps.description: While mounted, you may combine your movement with your mount's

steps.name: Whispers of the Wild
steps.description: Communicate telepathically with any willing creature. Creatures are initially unaware of who is speaking, the first time you speak to a creature, it must make an Mental check or take the fear condition. Once a creature succeeds on this check, it's immune to this fear effect from you in the future.

steps.name: Reach Weapon Mastery
steps.description: Gain +1 damage and +1 check bonus with reach weapons while mounted.

steps.name: Cavalry Charge
steps.description: When you move at least 20 ft toward a target while mounted, your next melee attack with a reach weapon deals +[[2d6]] damage and forces the target to make a Strength check or be knocked prone.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Stalwart Rider
steps.description: You have advantage on checks to stay mounted or control your steed in difficult terrain or dangerous situations.

steps.name: Rider’s Rally
steps.description: Call out to inspire mounted allies. All mounted allies within range gain +10 armor
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Mounted Parry
steps.description: When hit by an attack while mounted, reduce the damage by your Agility.

steps.name: Hunter
steps.description: Mark a target with touch as your prey. You always know where they are if they are on this plane and slowly learn more about them, gaining more knowledge each day.

steps.name: Unbreakable Bond
steps.description: Your mount gains +10 armor and has advantage on checks to resist fear or mind-affecting effects.

steps.name: Pack Tactics
steps.description: When a creature hits an ally or your mount, gain advantage to hit that creature.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Presence
steps.description: Allies within range gain +1 to checks while you are mounted. Your presence rallies the pack.

tank.name: Detective
tank.desc: The Gritty Detective talent harnesses the hard-boiled, relentless determination of a detective, weaving an intricate balance between brawn and brains. As a Gritty Detective, you combine your muscular might with a sharp intellect to penetrate the murkiest mysteries and hold the frontline in any battle.

steps.name: Hard-Boiled
steps.description: Your keen eye for detail and deductive reasoning is a powerful asset. Reveal a potential clue or hidden information in your surroundings if there is any

steps.name: Interrogator
steps.description: You know how to get information out of people, You have advantage on Influence checks when trying to persuade someone to reveal information. This could help you get a confession from a suspect, persuade a witness to talk, or intimidate a thug into revealing his boss's plans.

steps.name: Quick Reflexes
steps.description: Your detective instincts allow you to react quickly to danger, you have advantage on Provoke attacks

steps.name: Master of Disguise
steps.description: You can blend into any crowd. You have advantage on Stealth Checks when trying to disguise yourself or blend into a crowd

steps.name: Tactical Analysis
steps.description: You can quickly assess a situation and devise a plan. Give all allies a +2 bonus on their next check or attack
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Unseen Strike
steps.description: You know how to hit where it hurts. Spend a Bolster to make an additional attack when you take the attack action

steps.name: Dirty Fighter
steps.description: You know how to fight dirty to gain the upper hand. Spend a Bolster to cause one of these Conditions on a creature in range: Bleeding, Coughing, Pinned, Prone, or Blind
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Knockout Punch
steps.description: You can deliver a powerful punch that can knock an enemy unconscious. Spend a Bolster and make a melee attack action that, on a hit, forces the target to succeed on a Strength or Survival check or take the Stunned condition until the end of their next turn
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Desperation Strike
steps.description: When the odds are against you, you get even. Gain +1 to checks and damage while without armor

steps.name: Evasive Mind
steps.description: You have advantage on checks to resist mind-altering effects or conditions caused by intimidation, fear, or manipulation.

steps.name: Street Reputation
steps.description: Your name carries weight, for better or worse. In urban areas, you gain advantage on Mental checks with criminals, informants, or city guards who’ve heard of your work.

tank.name: Ironclad
tank.desc: The Ironclad is a bastion of defense, a tank whose very presence on the battlefield is akin to a movable fortress. They are the embodiment of resilience, standing firm in the face of overwhelming odds and ensuring that their allies remain protected. Drawing upon the concept of divine protection seen in the Drifting Vicar, the Ironclad instead channels their conviction into an unwavering resolve to defend and protect.

steps.name: Heavily Armored
steps.description: You have sturdy armor, Your armor has +10 additional armor

steps.name: Impenetrable Defense
steps.description: You can bolster your defenses to withstand powerful attacks. Use a Bolster to double your Armor Points
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Iron Sanctuary
steps.description: Use a Bolster to create a sanctuary of around you that lasts for 1 minute. Allies while in the sanctuary gain +2 armor at the start of their turn to a maximum of 10 while in the sanctuary. The bonus armor remains while the sanctuary is active.

steps.name: Inspiring Command
steps.description: Radiating an aura of confidence and bravery, inspire allies to fight with greater ferocity. All allies within range receive a +1 bonus to attack checks and damage
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Iron Rest
steps.description: You are knowledgeable of your armor. On a Press On, make a Crafting check, on a success repair your armor to full

steps.name: Iron Resolve: Fear
steps.description: Fortify your mental and physical resolve, Immune to the fear condition.

steps.name: Iron Resolve: Confusion
steps.description: Fortify your mental and physical resolve, Immune to the confused condition.

steps.name: Dual Stance
steps.description: You can take 2 stances at a time, each requiring a half-action

steps.name: Iron Soul: Repair
steps.description: When you take damage against your armor, repair +1 armor

steps.name: Iron Soul: Resist
steps.description: When you take damage, Spend a Bolster to reduce it by half

steps.name: Iron Soul: Heavy
steps.description: Your armor is unmatched, Your armor has +10 additional armor

tank.name: Pugilist
tank.desc: The Pugilist is a seasoned fighter who has honed their body into the perfect weapon. These individuals combine physical prowess with a deep understanding of their inner energy, hailing from mysterious dojos or self-taught from scraps of ancient knowledge. Combining traditional pugilism with an understanding of energy flow within the body, these fighters are a force to be reckoned with on the battlefield and in the ring

steps.name: Pugilist's Pride
steps.description: Your unarmed attacks deal an additional [[1d6]] physical damage of your choice. Your unarmed attacks count as magical

steps.name: Relentless
steps.description: Your unarmed strikes gain reach range. Your body flows through combat, striking farther than any would expect.

steps.name: Endurance Fighter
steps.description: Combat fuels your resolve. When you hit with an unarmed attack, heal +1 wound.

steps.name: Iron Chin
steps.description: Reduce incoming melee damage by your Agility or Strength. You take the hit, and grin through the pain.

steps.name: Fast Striker
steps.description: When you make an unarmed strike, attack twice as part of the action.

steps.name: Toughen Up
steps.description: Gain +10 armor at the start of each combat

steps.name: Battle Instincts
steps.description: As an off-action, gain advantage on your next attack

steps.name: Battle Born: Slashing
steps.description: Your body is a wall of scars and hardened flesh. The flourish of blades no longer fazes you. Success+ effects from Slashing damage fail to touch you.

steps.name: Battle Born: Piercing
steps.description: Your frame is unshaken by the sting of arrows or the bite of spears. You shrug off precision strikes. Success+ effects from Piercing damage do not affect you.

steps.name: Battle Born: Impact
steps.description: You've been broken, rebuilt, and made unyielding. The force of hammers and mauls cannot shake your core. Success+ effects from Impact damage cannot harm you.

steps.name: Steady Stance
steps.description: You cannot be knocked prone by melee or ranged attacks unless the attacker has advantage.

tank.name: Resonant
tank.desc: Resonant Shadows are warriors attuned to the vibrations of reality, wielding sound and time as their weapons. They create spectral echoes of themselves that confuse enemies, amplify their strikes, and warp the battlefield. By splitting their presence, they become a relentless force, striking from multiple angles and manipulating their surroundings with sound and temporal power. Whether retracing the steps of the past, leaving lingering impressions, or shattering foes with thunderous energy, Resonant Shadows are masters of disorientation and control. Their abilities grow as they harness the power of echoes and vibrations, making them unpredictable and unstoppable

steps.name: Fractured Mirror
steps.description: Summon a PL3 crystal echo that mimics your movements. It lasts for 1 minute. You may have a number of echoes equal to half your Agility (rounded down).

steps.name: Echo Strike
steps.description: When you make a melee attack, make another at disadvantage

steps.name: Shatter Collapse
steps.description: Collapse all active echoes, causing each to explode in crystal shards. Each echo deals [[1d6]] force damage to all creatures within reach and forces a Strength check or knock Prone.

steps.name: Shard Shroud
steps.description: Wrap yourself in humming crystal dust. Until the end of your next turn, attacks against you are made with disadvantage.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Resonant Stride
steps.description: When you Dash, crystalline energy ripples outward. All creatures within reach at your starting point take [[1d4]] thunder damage.

steps.name: Overload
steps.description: Once per combat, act twice on your turn. Afterward, take Exhausted, Stunned, and Coughing conditions, removing one at the end of each of your turns for 3 turns.

steps.name: Resonant Howl
steps.description: You and your echoes release a piercing resonance. Each howl deals [[1d4]] thunder damage to a targets in range

steps.name: Crystal Double
steps.description: Leave behind a stationary crystal echo that can visually and audibly repeat a brief message or simple gesture for up to 24 hours.

steps.name: Shard Fists
steps.description: Your unarmed strikes are reinforced with jagged crystal growths. They deal [[1d6]] Physical damage

steps.name: Crystal Plating
steps.description: Your skin forms hardened crystal patches. Gain +5 armor.

steps.name: Jagged Grasp
steps.description: When you successfully grapple a creature, they take [[1d4]] Piercing damage each time they try to escape or at the start of your turn while the grapple holds

tank.name: Savage
tank.desc: The Savage is a primal force of nature, unshackled by civilization and driven by raw instinct. Whether forged in the untamed wilds or drawn to its feral ways, you embody the essence of the beast. Your combat style is relentless and chaotic, channeling the fury of the wilderness to overwhelm foes and protect what is yours. With every strike, roar, and pounce, the Savage unleashes unbridled power, leaving devastation in their wake

steps.name: Frenzy
steps.description: Go into a frenzy that lasts the duration. You gain 2 additional attacks. After your attacks, you take the Exhaustion condition
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Predator's Pounce
steps.description: Pounce on an enemy within reach range that is large size or smaller, knocking them prone on a contested Strength check.

steps.name: Savage Strike
steps.description: Deal additional damage equal to your Strength check on melee attacks

steps.name: Bloodlust
steps.description: Killing an enemy increases your damage by [[1d6]] until the end of your next turn.

steps.name: Hardened Body
steps.description: Gain +10 armor and +10 wounds.

steps.name: Unrelenting Spirit
steps.description: Your primal nature makes intimidation tactics useless. you are immune to the fear condition

steps.name: Primal: Fear
steps.description: Your primal nature gives you violent determination. you are immune to the confused condition

steps.name: Wild Protector
steps.description: You have advantage on Survival checks while in nature. While in nature, you can hunt for 1 hour and, with a successful Survival check, gather enough raw food for up to 10 people.

steps.name: Frenzy: Stubborn
steps.description: When you use Frenzy, you can choose to take the Pinned condition instead of Exhaustion.

steps.name: Primal Roar
steps.description: Unleash a roar affecting all creatures within range. They must make a Spirit check or take the Fear condition with you as the source. You have advantage on attack checks against creatures with the Fear condition with you as the source

steps.name: Endurance Fighter
steps.description: Combat fuels your resolve. When you hit with an unarmed attack, heal +1 wound.

tank.name: Skinwalker
tank.desc: The Horror Shifter taps into the dark and mysterious lore of the skinwalker, possessing the ability to take on aspects of various animals, as well as more terrifying, half-beast forms. This talent is for those who embrace the primal and often unsettling power of shape-shifting, using it to instill fear and leverage the strengths of different creatures. Horror Shifters are not only versatile in combat but also adept at psychological warfare, using their eerie transformations to unnerve and overwhelm opponents.

steps.name: Mimic Howl
steps.description: Emit a bone-chilling howl that can demoralize enemies, sounding like familiar voices. Creatures must make an Mental check or take the Fear condition. If they succeed on the check, they become immune to your Mimic Howl

steps.name: Creeping Form
steps.description: Partially shift into an agile creature to gain double movement speed and the ability to climb nearly anything
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Beastly Insight
steps.description: Gain the instincts of a predator, giving you advantage on Observation checks to notice hidden creatures, detect lies, or sense hostile intent. Additionally, you can speak Naech (Beast).
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Pack Instincts
steps.description: Coordinate with allies by growling or making signals that communicate tactics or warnings, giving one ally advantage on their next attack
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Night Terror
steps.description: When you are hit with a melee attack, briefly transform into the target's worst fear, causing them to make an Mental check or be Stunned
steps.duration: Until the end of their next turn

steps.name: Veil of Shadows
steps.description: Shift into the shadows, gain the Invisible condition

steps.name: Vermin Swarm
steps.description: Dissolve into a swarm of vermin with half your movement speed. This allows you to bypass small openings, avoid Provoke, and grants immunity to the Pinned condition.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Terrifying Transformation
steps.description: Transform part of your body into a monstrous form, adding [[1d6]] additional damage to melee attacks.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Shadowed Strike
steps.description: make a shadow attack against a creature with a Spirit check that deals [[1d6]] Eclipse damage. On a Success+, recover wounds equal to the damage dealt.

steps.name: Eerie Mimicry
steps.description: Once per day, you can mimic a creature’s mannerisms and voice perfectly for up to 1 minute, imitating sounds or speech patterns you've heard.

steps.name: Mark of the Beast
steps.description: Once per day, touch a creature and leave your mark, which remains until removed or until you decide to remove it. You always know the direction of this marked target while they are on the same realm as you

support.name: Boneclad
support.desc: As a Boneclad, you walk a delicate line between life and death, channeling the powers of the afterlife to heal and protect your allies while siphoning strength from the souls of the departed. Your role is to empower your comrades through both restorative necromancy and the tactical manipulation of life force. You bolster your party by weaving between the boundaries of the living and the dead, granting aid in unexpected ways and ensuring that even in death, there is utility. Unlike traditional necromancers, you serve as both a healer and a protector, turning the energies of decay into a force for good.

steps.name: Spirit Spellcaster
steps.description: Spirit is your Spellcasting check. You have Spell Points equal to your Spellcasting Check. You regain 1 spell point on Press On and all on a long rest.

steps.name: Wraithform
steps.description: shroud yourself and an ally in a ghostly aura, granting advantage on stealth checks
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Pale Resurrection
steps.description: spending 3 spell points temporarily raise a creature that has taken the Death condition as a wraith. They can't speak but retain their combat abilities. PL equal to half your Spirit Check
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Bone Spear
steps.description: Summon a spear of bone to pierce a creature in range

steps.name: Bone Spear II
steps.description: When you use Bone Spear, heal for half the total damage dealt

steps.name: Bone Legion
steps.description: As an action spending 3 spell points, summon a PL3 swarm of skeletal warriors numbering [[1d10+2]], you can only have 1 swarm at a time

steps.name: Pale Resurrection II
steps.description: When you use Pale Resurrection, your wraith has PL equal to your spirit, and remains for 1 minute. but you can only have 1 wraith at a time

steps.name: Bone Spear III
steps.description: Your Bone Spear deals damage equal to your Spirit Check and has a Medium Range

steps.name: Bone Legion II
steps.description: Your Bone Legion costs 2 spell points, the skeletons swarm is a PL6 numbering 12 skeletons

steps.name: Pale Resurrection III
steps.description: You can have a number of Wraiths equal to half your Spirit

steps.name: Flesh and Dust
steps.description: Convert one Wraith into a burst of necrotic energy: allies within Short range heal [[2d6]], enemies take [[2d6]] Eclipse damage

steps.name: Bone Crown
steps.description: Whenever you summon a Wraith or Legion, you gain a Bone Crown. While crowned, your healing is doubled and you ignore fear or mind effects. Lose the crown if all undead are gone.

support.name: Careward
support.desc: The Careward embodies the heart of compassion and ingenuity, serving as a lifeline for their allies and a bridge between realms. They wield a rare gift: the ability to conjure sanctuaries that transcend the physical plane. These sanctuaries are not merely safe havens but also spaces of creativity, collaboration, and possibility, where the party can regroup, heal, and prepare for the challenges ahead. The Careward’s sanctuaries are as versatile as they are personal. These demi-planes reflect the Careward’s imagination, ranging from serene gardens to arcane workshops or even bustling miniature cities. Within these sanctuaries, allies can rest in safety, collaborate on projects, and recover from the tolls of battle, while the Careward remains at the center of this dynamic haven, guiding and inspiring those who enter.

steps.name: Sanctuary
steps.description: Create a door to a sanctuary of your own design in a short-range area, lasting 1 minute. At the end of the duration, all creatures are ejected through the door and take the Prone condition. The door has 100 Armor; if destroyed, all creatures are immediately ejected and fall Prone.

steps.name: Intellect Spellcaster
steps.description: Intellect is your Spellcasting check. You have Spell Points equal to your Spellcasting Check. You regain 1 spell point on Press On and all on a long rest.

steps.name: Sanctuary II
steps.description: Your sanctuary now lasts 1 hour and contains basic comforts, including food, water, and rest spaces appropriate for your species.

steps.name: Banish
steps.description: Touch a creature not native to your plane and make an Intellect check. On a success, banish them to their home plane. If they are unwilling, they must contest with their Spirit.

steps.name: Sanctuary: Guardian
steps.description: A spectral guardian (PL 8) watches the door from outside and defends against intruders. It lasts as long as the sanctuary and cannot move beyond short range from the door.

steps.name: Sanctuary III
steps.description: Your sanctuary expands to a medium-range area. Once inside, the door becomes invisible to anyone not within short range or invited inside.

steps.name: Sanctuary IV
steps.description: Your sanctuary lasts 8 hours and includes obedient, silent servants (non-combatant). They cannot leave the sanctuary but maintain its interior and attend guests.

steps.name: Sanctuary V
steps.description: While inside, you may spend 1 spell point to instantly recall a willing ally into your sanctuary, regardless of distance. Allies in the sanctuary regain +1 Wound per minute.

steps.name: Sanctuary VI
steps.description: The sanctuary now lasts 1 day and gains 10 PL2 servant constructs. These magical beings can leave into the surrounding area to deliver items, scout, or perform basic errands.

steps.name: Sanctuary VII
steps.description: Your sanctuary becomes permanent. Only the door must be summoned. Creatures are no longer ejected. A magical core stabilizes this demiplane. If destroyed, the sanctuary collapses, ejecting all within and ending the effect.

steps.name: Sanctuary VIII
steps.description: You may create multiple doors in different locations, all linking to your sanctuary. Doors may only be active one at a time, but you may switch which is open as an action.

support.name: Dreamweaver
support.desc: As a Dreamweaver, you have unlocked the mysteries of dreams and nightmares. You are able to influence the dreamscapes of your allies and enemies, providing relief or inducing fear as needed. This unique power allows you to heal allies and harm foes in ways others cannot comprehend, but sometimes the price of delving into the dreamscape can be unpredictably high.

steps.name: Dreamlink
steps.description: Mark one ally within short range; they remain Dreamlinked until you mark another or they fall unconscious. While marked, they gain +1 to all checks and recover +1 additional Wound when they rest.

steps.name: Dreamrender
steps.description: Create a melee weapon forged from nightmare essence that deals elemental damage of your choice. You may use your Influence check to attack and damage with it. When you create the weapon, you can spend an additional spell point to increase its damage by +2 for the duration.

steps.name: Influence Spellcaster
steps.description: Influence is your Spellcasting check. You have Spell Points equal to your Spellcasting Check. You regain 1 spell point on Press On and all on a long rest.

steps.name: Dreamlink II
steps.description: You always know the location, current Wounds, and conditions of your Dreamlinked ally. When they would gain a Cognition condition, you may take it instead.

steps.name: Dreamrender II
steps.description: You can make melee attacks with your Dreamrender as a Half-Action instead of a full action.

steps.name: Dreamlink III
steps.description: You may maintain two Dreamlinks at once. You can use an off-action to reroll a check a Dreamlinked ally has made.

steps.name: Dreamrender III
steps.description: You may create a Dreamrender for an ally within short range. That ally may use your Influence check to attack or a their own.

steps.name: Dreamlink IV
steps.description: You may swap positions with a Dreamlinked ally

steps.name: Dreamrender IV
steps.description: Once per day, your Dreamrender may deal healing instead of damage

steps.name: Dreamlink V
steps.description: You may maintain up to three Dreamlinked allies. All Dreamlinked allies gain +2 to checks instead of +1.

steps.name: Fortified Mind
steps.description: Immune to Cognition conditions of your choice.

support.name: Pactmaker
support.desc: As a Pactmaker aligned with the dark energies of Ordealis, you've embraced the power lurking within its nine layers, each ordeal shaping your abilities and defining your role as a master of demonic pacts. Your journey through Ordealis has not only granted you unique insights into the realm of demons but also imbued your pacts with the essence of each layer, from the Fields of Desolation to the Temple of Asmodeus.

steps.name: Make a Deal
steps.description: As a half-action, give allies within reach range advantage on checks until the end of their next turn, but you have disadvantage on checks until the end of your next turn.

steps.name: Fields of Desolation Pact
steps.description: When you Make a Deal, you can invoke the weariness and desolation of the Fields to drain the will of your enemies, giving enemies within your Make a Deal range disadvantage on attack checks

steps.name: Iron Dominion Bond
steps.description: When you Make a Deal, channel the relentless fortitude and cursed iron of the Iron Dominion to forge pacts that give you and your allies +10 armor that lasts for 1 minute.

steps.name: Clockwork Abyss Accord
steps.description: When you Make a Deal, utilize the temporal anomalies of the Clockwork Abyss to manipulate the flow of time around your affected allies, granting them an additional off-action on their turn

steps.name: Library of Demons Covenant
steps.description: When you Make a Deal, draw upon the vast knowledge and arcane mysteries within the Library. Your allies have advantage on checks for and against spells and magical effects.

steps.name: Discordant Symphony Harmony
steps.description: When you Make a Deal, harness the chaotic energies of the Discordant Symphony, dealing [[2d6]] Thunder damage to enemy creatures within your Make a Deal range

steps.name: Silent Void Pact
steps.description: When you Make a Deal, your allies gain the Invisible condition, invoking the Silent Void's muffling silence to shield them

steps.name: River of Souls Bond
steps.description: When you Make a Deal, you can read the surface thoughts of a creature in range of your Make a Deal ability

steps.name: Fields of Torment Accord
steps.description: When you Make a Deal, bolster the spirits of your allies with the unyielding resolve of those who traverse the Fields of Torment, granting them immunity to Cognitive conditions

steps.name: Asmodeus’ Judgment
steps.description: Your Make a Deal range becomes Short range, an off-action, and you no longer have disadvantage when you use Make a Deal

steps.name: Silent Guardian
steps.description: When you Make a Deal, cloak your allies in the essence of the Infinite Abyss, giving them the Intangible condition. Attacks pass through them without causing harm, and they move with ghostly silence, unseen and unheard. However, the Pactmaker becomes Blind while they channel this ability; this is unable to be removed or prevented

support.name: Shepherd
support.desc: Shepherds of Souls are itinerant mystics who bridge the realms of the living and the dead. They guide lost spirits to their final rest, ward off malevolent entities, and provide solace to those who mourn. Through rituals and spectral tools, they manipulate the fragile boundary between life and death, balancing mercy and might.

steps.name: Soul Lantern
steps.description: A large lantern made with Mournesteel that gives power over souls. Check of your choice, Deals Solar damage and deals an additional [[1d4]] Eclipse

steps.name: Soul Lantern II
steps.description: Your lantern can emit a blinding flash. As an off-action, impose disadvantage on the next attack of a creature within short range
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Spectral Ward
steps.description: As an action, create a protective aura. Allies within short range gain immunity to Psychic damage and advantage on Spirit checks until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Soul Lantern III
steps.description: Add a binding effect to your Soul Lantern. Creatures damaged by your lantern must succeed on a Spirit check or take the Slowed condition until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Soul Lantern IV
steps.description: Your Soul Lantern becomes a short range attack, now on a chain made of ethereal light

steps.name: Ethereal Chains
steps.description: As a half-action, launch chains of light from your lantern. A creature within short range must succeed on a Spirit check or be pinned until the end of their next turn
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Ethereal Step
steps.description: Spend 1 spell point, take the Intangible condition until the end of your turn. Ending your turn inside an object deals [[1d6]] Psychic damage to you

steps.name: Guiding Light
steps.description: mark a spirit or undead creature. Allies gain advantage on attacks against the marked target
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Banishing Light
steps.description: unleash a burst of light from your lantern. All spirits, demons, and undead within short range must make a Spirit check or be banished to their original plane of existence
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Passage
steps.description: Create a shining portal that links the material plane to the afterlife. Spirits, ghosts, and soul-bound undead can choose to pass on peacefully. During this ritual, all allies in a short range area heal +2 per round and are immune to fear
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Soul Lantern V
steps.description: When a creature takes the death condition while in range of your Soul Lantern, you can either gain +1 Spirit mod until you take a long rest or prevent the death with an Inspiration

support.name: Siphon
support.desc: In the dim twilight of the Eclipse, a realm that whispers of the secrets held between life and death, the Siphons walk a precarious path. These adept practitioners of shadow and light do not merely manipulate the energies of life; they commune with the very essence of existence, drawing upon the Eclipse's enigmatic powers to control the fate of souls. With one hand reaching into the pulsating heart of life and the other ensnared in the cold grip of death, Siphons are the arbiters of a delicate equilibrium, capable of tipping the scales in favor of creation or oblivion.

steps.name: Soul Harvest
steps.description: Gain a Soul Harvest Resource, this resource starts at 0 with a maximum capacity of 20. As an action, you can touch a living creature and deal Eclipse damage, and the amount of damage dealt is then added to your Soul Harvest, or touch an ally and heal them for up to the current amount stored in the Soul Harvest

steps.name: Soul Harvest II
steps.description: When you use Soul Harvest, heal an ally for half the damage and gain +1 armor

steps.name: Shroud of Shadows
steps.description: spend 1 Inspiration to cloak yourself and one ally in shadows, granting invisibility
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Soul Harvest III
steps.description: Deal an additional 1d6 damage with Soul Harvest, increase the Maximum capacity to 25

steps.name: Harvest Sacrifice
steps.description: You can spend your Soul Harvest to increase the check or damage on an attack or the attack of an ally within short range. Every 3 points spent is +1.

steps.name: Shroud of Shadows II
steps.description: When you use Shroud of Shadows, become intangible as well
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Soul Harvest IV
steps.description: Deal an additional 1d6 damage with Soul Harvest, additionally can be used as a Half-Action

steps.name: Grasp of the Eclipse
steps.description: All enemies within short range are restrained by spectral hands (Spirit check to resist) and take [[2d6]] Eclipse damage

steps.name: Shroud of Shadows II
steps.description: You can't target allies within short range when you use Shroud of Shadows

steps.name: Soul Harvest V
steps.description: Deal an additional 1d6 damage with Soul Harvest, increase the Maximum capacity to 35

steps.name: Zuinmuir’s Covenant
steps.description: become an avatar of death until the end of your next turn. You can choose any creature within medium range to take the Death condition. Make a Spirit check with -5 per creature you choose; on a failure, your body is taken by the god of death, Zuinmuir, and you die instead

support.name: Tactician
support.desc: The Tactician is a master of battlefield strategy, precision strikes, and adaptability. With sharp instincts and an intimate understanding of combat dynamics, they analyze their enemies' weaknesses, exploit vulnerabilities, and provide critical support to allies. Whether leading the charge or operating independently, the Tactician turns the tide of battle with calculated precision and tactical brilliance

steps.name: Exploit Weakness
steps.description: As an off-action spending 1 Inspiration, when you hit with a weapon attack, deal +5 additional damage.

steps.name: Tactical Evasion
steps.description: You anticipate damage and roll to prevent it, As off-action when an attack is hitting you, reduce the damage by half

steps.name: Commanding Shout
steps.description: Choose one ally within range. That ally may move up to their movement or make one attack

steps.name: Assault
steps.description: After successfully hitting an enemy, your next attack against them has advantage

steps.name: Cloaked Medic
steps.description: When you heal an ally, grant them the Invisible condition until the end of their next turn
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Exploit Weakness II
steps.description: Exploit Weakness no longer costs Inspiration

steps.name: Tactical Evasion II
steps.description: You may fully reduce an incoming attack’s damage to 0. If you do, you fall Prone immediately after.

steps.name: Assault II
steps.description: When you hit a creature, all allies have advantage on their next attack against that creature until the end of your next turn.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Coordinated Strike
steps.description: when you hit a creature, one ally within range may make a weapon attack against the same target as an off-action with +2 to the check and damage

steps.name: Repositioning
steps.description: Choose up to two allies within short range. Move them each up to half their movement without Provoking

steps.name: Authority
steps.description: Allies within range have an additional Off-Action

support.name: Alchemystic
support.desc: Whether brewing elixirs that heal wounds and fortify spirits, crafting scents that alter moods and perceptions, or rigging arcane devices that protect and devastate, the Alchemystic is a versatile force on the battlefield and beyond. Their knowledge is their weapon, and their ingenuity is their shield. Through their mastery of mystical concoctions, they navigate the complex interplay of light and shadow, substance and spirit, crafting a legacy that echoes through the ages.

steps.name: Quickbrew
steps.description: Create a volatile Quickbrew with any damage type, including healing. It lasts 1 minute. Once used or if unused, it becomes inert and can be stored as a Stable Ingredient.

steps.name: Crafting Spellcaster
steps.description: Crafting is your Spellcasting check. You have Spell Points equal to your Spellcasting Check. You regain 1 spell point on Press On and all on a long rest.

steps.name: Jury-Rigged
steps.description: Once per day, you may make a Crafting check on armor. Restore +10 Armor per success.

steps.name: Quickbrew: Ferrus Oil
steps.description: Your Quickbrew also repairs armor when used on allies, or deals +1d6 additional damage to armor when used on enemies.

steps.name: Quickbrew: Fleetfoot
steps.description: Your Quickbrew grants +10 movement speed to allies, or applies the Slowed condition to enemies until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Stable Ingredient
steps.description: You may expend a Stable Ingredient to gain 1d4 Spell Points until the end of your next turn.

steps.name: Quickbrew: Divine Shield
steps.description: Your Quickbrew can prevent the next source of damage to an ally, or applies the Exposed condition to an enemy until they take damage

steps.name: Quickbrew: Felix Felicis
steps.description: Your quickbrew potion gives advantage or disadvantage until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Quickbrew: Injectable
steps.description: You may use Quickbrew as an Off-Action

steps.name: Stable Ingredient: Condition
steps.description: Mix a potion using 1 Stable Ingredient to apply a non major-condition (e.g., Fear, Confusion, Coughing) to a creature. The potion is active until the end of your next turn. Once used, the effect can last up 1 minute.

steps.name: Jack's Potion
steps.description: Once per day, create Jack’s Potion. When consumed, the drinker gains +10 to their next check. Afterward, they suffer Blind, Stunned, and Exhaustion for 1 round.

support.name: Barber
support.desc: The Barber is a refined instrument of charm and cruelty. Guided by infernal whispers and perfected rituals, they mend flesh, manipulate appearance, and spill blood with grace. A blade in one hand and a mirror in the other, they blur the line between healer and executioner.

steps.name: Bloodletting
steps.description: Touch a creature and make an Influence check. On an ally, heal them. On an enemy, deal damage. You must declare the intent before the roll.

steps.name: Razor’s Charm
steps.description: You may use your Influence check when attacking with slashing weapons. Once per day, you may choose to gain advantage on one attack check.

steps.name: Influence Spellcaster
steps.description: Influence is your Spellcasting check. You have Spell Points equal to your spellcasting check. You regain 1 Spell Point on Press On and all on a Long Rest

steps.name: Disguise
steps.description: Alter a creature’s appearance using your Barber techniques spending 1 Inspiration. The disguise lasts 1 hour and grants advantage on checks to impersonate or avoid recognition

steps.name: Bloodletting: Bloodmark
steps.description: When you deal damage with Bloodletting, the target gains the Bleeding condition. If they are already Bleeding, deal an additional [[1d6]] damage.

steps.name: Confession
steps.description: After healing or grooming a creature, you may ask one question. The target must succeed a Spirit check or be compelled to answer truthfully.

steps.name: Razor’s Charm: Spellbreak
steps.description: When you succeed with an attack using a slashing weapon, gain +1 temporary Spell Point. It lasts until the end of your next turn.

steps.name: Bloodletting: Regen
steps.description: When you heal a creature using Bloodletting, remove one non-major condition or apply a +[[1d6]] bonus to their next physical check.

steps.name: Bloodletting: Infernal Force
steps.description: When you use Bloodletting, you can deal Vozian damage instead.

steps.name: Riftblade
steps.description: Your razors flicker with unstable rift energy. Once per turn when you deal damage with Bloodletting, summon a spectral PL [[1d6]] demon beside the target. The demon attacks randomly, including the caster if no enemies are nearby.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Bloodletting: Bloodlink
steps.description: When you heal an ally with Bloodletting, you may tether their blood to an enemy within short range. The next time that enemy takes damage, your ally takes 2 healing. The tether fades after 1 minute or if either target dies.

support.name: Flapper
support.desc: The Flapper is a vivacious force of nature, seamlessly blending charm and charisma with elemental powers that reflect their dazzling personality and volatile spirit. Whether in the urbane settings of high society or the raw wilderness, they manipulate fire, water, air, or earth to enhance their movements, deceive foes, and captivate allies with elemental flair

steps.name: Flourish
steps.description: You are the master of Influence. When you succeed on an Influence check, give a creature +1 Influence bonus per success as an off-action
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Flash Step
steps.description: When a creature moves within range or targets you, roll an Influence check. On success, leap a short distance

steps.name: Gossip Network
steps.description: Spend 1 inspiration and you may declare that you know a person, scandal, or rumor that gives you an edge in a social situation. You gain Advantage on your next Influence check related to that topic

steps.name: Social Butterfly
steps.description: When you succeed on an Influence check against a creature, you may apply the Charmed condition until the end of your next turn.

steps.name: Flourish: Influential
steps.description: When you use Flourish, gain +2 Armor per Influence bonus granted. This lasts until the end of your next turn.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Flash Step: Blink
steps.description: When you use Flash Step, you can teleport up to a short range

steps.name: Flourish: Conversationalist
steps.description: When you use Flourish, you gain advantage on your next Influence check.

steps.name: Social Butterfly: Charmancer
steps.description: When you charm a creature with Social Butterfly, they remain charmed for 1 minute

steps.name: Heartbreak
steps.description: End the Charmed condition on a creature you affected. The target becomes Stunned until the end of their next turn and takes [[1d6]] psychic damage.

steps.name: Flash Step: Fade
steps.description: When you use Flash Step, you become invisible until the end of your next turn.

steps.name: Smoke Break
steps.description: Light a smoke, twirl, or otherwise assert yourself. Until the end of your next turn, all Humanoid creatures within short range are unable to take hostile actions toward you. Ends early if you attack or cast a harmful spell.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

support.name: Harmonizer
support.desc: Harmonizers are gifted individuals who draw upon the ancient wisdom of the stars and the subtle energies of celestial bodies to support their allies. With a deep understanding of astrological alignments and cosmic forces, they navigate the battlefield with an otherworldly grace, channeling the universe's vast energies to heal, protect, and empower their companions. Through their connection to the cosmos, they bring about auspicious events, realign energies for optimal outcomes, and provide insights that transcend ordinary understanding

steps.name: Attunement
steps.description: You touch a creature to attune to them, linking your rhythm to theirs. They gain advantage on their next check, and while attuned, you may spend Inspiration on them from medium range. The link lasts for 1 minute or until you end it.

steps.name: Attunement: Shielding
steps.description: When you attune to a creature, they are wrapped in momentary potential shielding. They gain +10 Armor while attuned

steps.name: Attunement: Extend
steps.description: You no longer need to touch a creature to attune. You may attune to any creature within short range

steps.name: Attunement: Dual Link
steps.description: You may maintain attunement with up to 2 creatures simultaneously. You feel their movements in parallel, as if each heartbeat echoes twice.

steps.name: Attunement: Fleetstep
steps.description: Attuned creatures no longer provoke opportunity attacks when moving. The steps they take fall between seconds.

steps.name: Attunement: Backstep
steps.description: When an attuned creature takes damage, you may end their attunement to intercept fate. Prevent the damage, but you take half of it instead.

steps.name: Attunement: Critical
steps.description: When an attuned creature lands a critical hit, they deal triple damage instead of double. Their strike lands at the perfect moment in time.

steps.name: Attunement: Skillset
steps.description: Attuned creatures gain +1 to all checks while attuned.

steps.name: Attunement: Overdrive
steps.description: Attuned creatures gain an additional Off-Action each round. Their thoughts move in harmony with yours, anticipating the flow of time.

steps.name: Anchor
steps.description: Place a temporal anchor on a location. For 1 minute, you may use an Off-Action to teleport one attuned creature back to that point. The space remembers.

steps.name: Synchrony
steps.description: All attuned creatures immediately take an Action in unison. All attunements end, and you become Pinned until the end of your next turn

support.name: Lifeweaver
support.desc: With hands that can both heal and harm, Lifeweavers are revered for their unique ability to manipulate the very essence of life. Drawing upon the interconnectedness of all beings, they redistribute health, siphon vigor from foes to fortify friends, and bind adversaries in shared fates of suffering. Their presence is a balm to allies and a bane to enemies, embodying the duality of creation and destruction.

steps.name: Conduit
steps.description: touch 2 creatures and transfer up to 10 wounds from one to the other. If a creature is unwilling, you must make a contested Spirit check against them

steps.name: Spirit Spellcaster
steps.description: Spirit is your Spellcasting check. You have Spell Points equal to your Spellcasting Check. You regain 1 spell point on Press On and all on a long rest.

steps.name: Conduit: Bodylink
steps.description: When you use Conduit, you can choose to transfer conditions instead.

steps.name: Fleshmeld
steps.description: Touch a creature and fuse a mutation into them for 1 hour. Choose one minor mutation: +5 Armor, +10 Movement, or +1 to Physical checks. Only one mutation may be active at a time per creature.

steps.name: Conduit: Domineer
steps.description: When you use Conduit, if a creature is unwilling, you can make a Spirit check instead of a contested Spirit check

steps.name: Conduit: Network
steps.description: When you use the Conduit, you may do so at a short range

steps.name: Biofeedback
steps.description: Link two creatures. Until your next turn, when one takes damage, the other gains +2 Armor
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Conduit: Spellhack
steps.description: When you use Conduit and each creature has spell points, you can choose to transfer up to 5 spell points from one creature to the other.

steps.name: Conduit: Disease
steps.description: When you use Conduit and spend 1 Inspiration, you can choose to transfer a disease in its current state from one creature to another

steps.name: Conduit: Curse
steps.description: When you use Conduit and spend 1 Inspiration, you can choose to transfer a curse in its current state from one creature to another

steps.name: Neural Misfire
steps.description: Target a creature within short range. Make a contested Spirit check. On success, the creature must immediately move up to their full movement in a random direction (1d4 cardinal directions), the creature then becomes immune to this effect

support.name: Medic
support.desc: The Medic is a versatile class that seamlessly blends the healing prowess of a traditional medic with the martial skills of a warrior. They excel at rapidly treating wounds and injuries during combat, ensuring their allies remain in fighting shape. In addition to their potent healing capabilities, Medics are well-trained in combat. They can skillfully wield weapons and armor, holding their own against formidable opponents

steps.name: Frontline
steps.description: Your time on the battlefield has steeled your nerves. Gain advantage on checks against Fear or Intimidation effects.

steps.name: Resilience
steps.description: When you use Inspiration on a creature, they are immune to non-major conditions until the end of your next turn.

steps.name: Fast Hands
steps.description: You can use Inspiration as a Half-Action instead of a Action.

steps.name: Fast Hands: Network
steps.description: When you use an Inspiration, you can do so at short range

steps.name: Precision
steps.description: You can make a called shot at -6 instead of -10.

steps.name: Wide-Swing
steps.description: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can heal another creature for +1 healing within the same action within range

steps.name: Rapid Response
steps.description: When an ally gains the Injured condition, you may immediately move your full movement toward them and heal them for [[1d6]] on touch.

steps.name: Shielded Recovery
steps.description: When you heal a creature, both you and the target gain +3 Armor until the start of your next turn.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Wide-Swing: Enmasse
steps.description: When you use Wide-Swing, the healing increases to [[1d6]] and you may heal a target within short range.

steps.name: Commander
steps.description: Grant an ally within medium range an immediate Off-Action.

steps.name: Shielded Recovery: Harden
steps.description: When you use Shielded Recovery, all allies within short range gain +5 armor
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

support.name: Mossheart
support.desc: Mosshearts are living embodiments of nature's boundless power, blending the resilience of the earth with the regenerative properties of flora and fungi. These guardians of the wild harness the essence of the natural world to protect, heal, and fortify, creating a symbiotic bond between themselves and the life around them. A Mossheart's presence brings a sense of balance and harmony, offering allies not only support but also a connection to the untamed beauty of nature. The Mossheart’s abilities go beyond simple healing or protection; they shape the battlefield into an extension of the natural world. Thorny barriers, regenerative blooms, and animated guardians form an arsenal as versatile as it is effective. They create opportunities to halt enemy advances, protect allies, or even transform the tide of combat through their deep connection to nature

steps.name: Verdant Renewal
steps.description: Spend 1 Inspiration to release a burst of pollen in a short range. All allies in range are healed for +3 Wounds, and their armor is repaired for +3.

steps.name: Survival Spellcaster
steps.description: Survival is your Spellcasting check. You have Spell Points equal to your Spellcasting Check. You regain 1 spell point on Press On and all on a long rest.

steps.name: Thornskin
steps.description: Your skin sprouts hardened thorns. When a creature hits you with a melee attack, they take 3 piercing damage.

steps.name: Home Turf
steps.description: While in a natural environment (forests, swamps, caves, or anywhere away from civilization), you gain +2 maximum Spell Points and +1 to all checks.

steps.name: Verdant Renewal: Humeur
steps.description: When you use Verdant Renewal, you may remove one Cognition condition from a creature within range.

steps.name: Thornskin: Epines
steps.description: Your bark like skin thickens. You gain +10 armor that can be healed or repaired normally. This armor fully restores on a long rest.

steps.name: Verdant Renewal: Gamme
steps.description: Your Verdant Renewal range is increased to medium range

steps.name: Rootrun
steps.description: Merge into any organic material (wood, stone, plant) as if it were mud. While merged, you cannot breathe. You may exit through any surface of the same material. If the material is connected, you may move through it at your movement speed.

steps.name: Verdant Renewal: Douleur
steps.description: When you use Verdant Renewal, all enemy creatures in range must make a Survival check or take [[1d6]] nature damage.

steps.name: Rootrun: Déplacer
steps.description: When you use Rootrun, you may teleport from one tree or organic object to another within line of sight up to medium range

steps.name: Verdant Form
steps.description: Transform into a massive moss-and-bark creature for 1 minute. Gain +15 armor, immunity to Bleeding and Cognition conditions, and deal [[1d6]] piercing damage to any creature that starts its turn adjacent to you

support.name: Puppeteer
support.desc: The Puppeteer is a master of creativity and strategy, wielding their crafted puppets to dominate the battlefield and shape the narrative of any encounter. These animated constructs are more than tools of war; they are extensions of the Puppeteer’s will, forged from imagination and brought to life through skill and determination. Whether commanding a horde of shadowy marionettes or a single, intricately designed masterpiece, the Puppeteer is a force to be reckoned with. Each puppet offers endless possibilities for customization and utility. From fearsome warriors with elemental-infused strikes to agile scouts capable of navigating terrain others cannot, the Puppeteer adapts their creations to suit the challenges at hand. Their puppets can defend allies, disrupt enemies, or even perform tasks that require precision or ingenuity, acting as both tools and companions in the journey.

steps.name: Puppet
steps.description: As an action, spend 1 Inspiration to summon a PL3 puppet of your design within a short range that lasts for 1 hour. Directing your puppet requires no action, but maintaining control requires focus; because of this, you can only have 2 puppets active at a time. It has a [[1d4]] weapon of your choice. Your puppets have limited range and can only move up to short range from you

steps.name: Combat Refinement
steps.description: Your puppet gains combat proficiency, giving it a +2 attack bonus and damage. Your puppets can also remain once created until you take a long rest.

steps.name: Aegis Framework
