steps.description: Increase the puppet's durability by reinforcing its structure. It has +1 PL and an additional +5 armor

steps.name: Swift Ambulator
steps.description: As your action, enhance the puppet's mobility momentarily, granting it additional movement options such as flying, swimming, or burrowing at a speed equal to your speed until the end of your next turn.

steps.name: Elemental Embodiment
steps.description: Infuse your puppets with an elemental damage type (fire, ice, lightning, etc.), allowing it to deal that damage with its weapon attacks for 1 minute

steps.name: Reactive Adaptation
steps.description: The puppet can now react to incoming attacks, gaining the ability to use your Off-Action (reaction) to impose disadvantage on attack rolls against it once per round.

steps.name: Sentience Spark
steps.description: As an action spending 1 Inspiration, grant a puppet a limited form of sentience, allowing it to perform simple tasks, make basic decisions, move without limited range, and communicate simple concepts to you without direct control for 1 hour

steps.name: Puppet Master
steps.description: You can have up to 3 puppets at one time. Your puppets are PL5 and can move up to a medium range from you

steps.name: Puppeteer's Veil
steps.description: As an action, your puppets emit a veil of shadows that grants allies within reach range Stealth advantage until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Puppet Reinforcement
steps.description: Your puppet gains +10 armor and can be equipped with Standard Weapons

steps.name: Ethereal Strings
steps.description: As an action spending 1 Inspiration, one of your puppets can gain the Intangible or Invisible condition until the end of your next turn

professional.name: Demonologist
professional.desc: The Demonologist has delved deep into the ancient lore of demonic entities, becoming a Professional on their history, methods, and magic. However, this knowledge comes with a cost; they have learned to infuse themselves with the very essence of the demonic entities they study. When they do so, they can tap into incredible power, but it may leave them physically and emotionally drained. This transformation has made them a formidable presence on the battlefield, capable of standing against even the toughest adversaries. Yet, they always walk a thin line between control and madness.

steps.name: Infernal Infusion
steps.description: Invoke a demonic essence within you, spending 5 Demonic Essence and transforming yourself into a demonic form for a limited time. In this state, you gain +2 to all attack rolls, armor equal to double your Intellect, and deal an extra [[1d4]] Vozian damage with your attacks. This transformation lasts for 1 minute. When the transformation ends, you take the Blind, Confused, and Exhausted conditions for 1 minute due to the immense strain on your body and soul

steps.name: Demon Scholar
steps.description: Your study of demonic lore and history gives you advantage on Intellect and Observation checks related to demons and other infernal entities. Gain a Class Resource of 5 Demonic Essence that recharges after a long rest or by drinking the blood of the innocent.

steps.name: Resilience
steps.description: The demonic essence within you makes you tough and hard to kill. Spend 1 Demonic Essence to heal for [[1d6]] or remove 1 condition

steps.name: Ritual Leader
steps.description: You are proficient in conducting and creating infernal rituals. A ritual takes 10 minutes. You can perform rituals for various purposes, such as summoning lesser demons for information, creating wards against demonic forces, finding lost information, talking to otherworldly beings, empowering another’s spells or magic, unlocking a door, or binding demonic entities.

steps.name: Infernal Pact
steps.description: You have made a pact with a lesser demon, who serves you in exchange for occasional services. Spend 1 Demonic Essence to summon this demon at PL3. They can perform simple tasks or fight for you

steps.name: Insight
steps.description: You can tap into the surface thoughts of creatures. Spend 1 Demonic Essence and make an Intellect check targeting a creature within range. On a success, you understand the basic thoughts and emotions of the creature for up to 1 minute, but they can sense you with an Observation check.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Demon Scholar II
steps.description: Your maximum Demonic Essence is 10, you are immune to Vozian magic but take double damage and effects from Celestial Origin magic.

steps.name: Demonic Speed
steps.description: The demonic essence within you can make you move with supernatural speed. Spend 1 Demonic Essence to double your movement speed and gain an additional off-action
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Rebuke
steps.description: You can call upon the power of Hell to punish those who you choose. Spend 1 Demonic Essence to deal Vozian damage

steps.name: Infernal Pact II
steps.description: If you summon a demon with Infernal Pact, you can increase its PL by +1 per Demonic Essence used.

steps.name: Emissary
steps.description: Spend 1 Demonic Essence and create a portal to any of the 9 layers of the Ordealis or back to the Prime Material if you are in another plane.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Infernal Infusion II
steps.description: Channel the full might of your demonic claim. Spend 9 Demonic Essence. Become a greater demon for 1 minute. Gain immunity to Corpus and Cognition conditions. Your attacks deal +[[2d6]] Vozian damage.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

professional.name: Chimeric Monk
professional.desc: The Chimeric Monk walks the path of ultimate understanding, blending traits from myriad sources such as demons, angels, elementals, dragons, and more. Through deep enlightenment, they transcend the limits of a singular form, drawing on the strengths of all life and energies. Each battle or meditation brings new insights, fusing the physical, spiritual, and arcane. They are masters of transformation and adaptation, seeing the world as an interconnected whole. Their journey leads toward the ultimate realization of becoming an avatar of true balance and harmony, embodying the essence of all things

steps.name: Unarmed Striker
steps.description: When you make an unarmed attack (fist, claw, tentacle, etc.) as an Attack Action, you may make one additional unarmed attack immediately after

steps.name: Demon’s Frenzy
steps.description: Tap into demonic rage, increasing your attack speed; gain an extra attack when you make an attack action but take [[1d4]] stress damage.

steps.name: Angelic Grace
steps.description: As a half-action, take an Angelic Stance. While in this stance, any creature targeting you with an attack must succeed on a Spirit check before they attack or they choose not to attack
steps.duration: Until the start of your next turn

steps.name: Elemental Shift
steps.description: As a half-action, choose an elemental damage type to become immune to until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Dreamsea Step
steps.description: Become intangible as you slip partway into the dreamsea
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Nature’s Grace
steps.description: Become gifted with the power of Nature, gain advantage on your next check
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Dragon’s Roar
steps.description: Unleash a terrifying roar. Creatures within range must succeed on a Mental check or take the Fear condition

steps.name: Construct Endurance
steps.description: Reinforce your body with the resilience of a construct; gain +10 Armor
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Titan’s Stomp
steps.description: Slam the ground with the force of a giant, creating shockwaves; knock prone all creatures within short range and deal damage equal to your strength check as impact damage

steps.name: Soul Mirror
steps.description: when you take damage, reflect the damage back at your attacker for the exact amount

steps.name: True Understanding
steps.description: You reach true enlightenment and become an avatar of chaos and unity. Gain +20 armor, Advantage on Unarmed Attacks, Additional +5 damage on unarmed attacks, and +2 to attack checks. After the duration you take the Exhausted, Stunned, Blind, and Confused conditions for 1 minute as you recover from the effects of entering this powerful state.

professional.name: Luminary
professional.desc: The Luminary is a living beacon of bioluminescent power and reactive evolution, embodying the raw potential of life itself. Whether inspiring allies with radiant energy, shielding them with adaptive defenses, or disorienting foes with dazzling transformations, the Luminary thrives as a dynamic force on the battlefield. Their ever-changing abilities reflect their connection to the primal forces of nature, adapting to challenges in real-time. Beyond combat, their glowing presence captivates and influences, making them both a formidable protector and an awe-inspiring figure. The Luminary doesn't just survive—they evolve, illuminating the path for others while reshaping the world around them

steps.name: Catalyst
steps.description: Channel life energy into an ally, granting +3 on their next attack check or +10 armor as bioluminescent plates form to shield them.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Hyper-Reactive
steps.description: When an ally is attacked, lash out with dazzling speed. Make an attack at disadvantage against the attacker.

steps.name: Catalyst II
steps.description: When you use Catalyst, your energy restores [[1d4]] wounds to the target as your light mends their flesh.

steps.name: Catalyst III
steps.description: When you grant armor with Catalyst, crystalline spikes form. Melee attackers take 2 Piercing damage.

steps.name: Prismatic
steps.description: Shift your skin tone or emit a soft, shimmering glow. Gain advantage on Influence checks in a social interaction. Usable once per day.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Catalyst IV
steps.description: When you grant +3 on an attack check with Catalyst, that creature’s next attack deals +3 damage.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Elastic Limbs
steps.description: Your limbs extend with luminous tendrils. Your melee attacks have reach.

steps.name: Layering
steps.description: You grow a layer of chitinous spiked armor (+10 armor). Creatures take 2 Piercing damage when they hit you with a melee attack. Your armor can be healed or repaired.

steps.name: Catalyst V
steps.description: When you use Catalyst, grant both effects at once (+3 on next attack check and +10 armor).

steps.name: Dual Hearts
steps.description: Your evolved body hosts a second heart. Gain an additional Half-Action each turn.

steps.name: Catalyst VI
steps.description: Your body pulses with perfected bioluminescent energy, a living conduit of primal life-force. You can now unleash your Catalyst as a Half-Action, your adaptations flowing instinctively to shield or empower allies in the blink of an eye.

professional.name: Mentalist
professional.desc: Your cognitive prowess transcends the boundaries of mundane thought, touching the ethereal edges of arcane realms. While some argue that the origin of your abilities is rooted in traditional magic, others see it as a testament to the uncharted territories of the human psyche. With an unwavering will that almost seems to shimmer with its own enchantment, you wield this cerebral power both on the battlefield and off. Your heightened perceptual abilities not only give you an edge in understanding the world but also let you tap into latent energies, often overlooked by others.

steps.name: Crystal Origin
steps.description: You wear or have embed a crystal focus to align with the flow of energy. You can cast Crystal, Nature, and Chaos spells, other spell Origins are cast at Disadvantage

steps.name: Intellect Spellcaster
steps.description: Intellect is your Spellcasting check. You have Spell Points equal to your Spellcasting Check. You regain 1 spell point on Press On and all on a long rest.

steps.name: Illusionist
steps.description: Create a simple illusion within range, fooling one sense (sight, sound, or scent) for 1 minute. The illusion is static and fades if interacted with. if the creature succeeds an Observation check they see through the illusion.

steps.name: Telepathic Relay
steps.description: Communicate with creatures you can see within range telepathically, if they understand language

steps.name: Thoughtgrip
steps.description: You always have an invisible psychic hand that acts at your will within Short range. The Thoughtgrip can carry objects of 1 bulk or less, open doors, administer potions, trigger simple mechanisms, or perform similar minor tasks. The hand can apply up to 10 lbs of force. It cannot attack or manipulate complex devices.

steps.name: Mental Push
steps.description: Unleash a wave of psychic energy. Creatures within a range that you choose must make an Intellect check and be pushed back 10 ft, reducing the amount by 5ft per success.

steps.name: Illusionist II
steps.description: Create a dynamic illusion within Short range that fools sight, sound, scent, and touch for 1 minute. The illusion can interact with objects (e.g. apply minor force, support small items). Creatures interacting with it must succeed on an Observation check or remain fooled. Extend 1 minute per additional spell point. If you spend 3 spell points, you can make real-seeming objects or terrain that last 1 hour and can withstand casual interaction. These objects impose disadvantage on attack checks that pass through them.

steps.name: Thoughtgrip II
steps.description:
Your invisible hand gains precision and strength, becoming a true extension of your will. The Thoughtgrip can now:
- Wield a light weapon and make its own attack on your turn (using your Mentalist’s attack check, applies your check bonus but not damage bonus).
- Apply up to 30 lbs of force, manipulate complex objects (like triggers, levers, locks).
- As an action, grapple a Tiny or Small creature within Short range. The creature must succeed a Strength or Agility check to escape at the end of their turn. While grappled, they suffer Disadvantage on attacks or checks involving physical actions.

steps.name: Mental Push II
steps.description: Release a forceful blast of psychic energy in range. Creatures you choose must make an Intellect check. On failure, they are pushed back 15 ft, fall prone, and take [[1d6]] psychic damage. Each success reduces the push distance by 5 ft and avoids being knocked prone. Spending 2 or more spell points also imposes Disadvantage on the target’s next attack or check until the end of their next turn.

steps.name: Illusionist III
steps.description: Create a master illusion within Short range that fools all senses (sight, sound, scent, touch, taste). The illusion can apply minor force, provide cover, and distract foes, imposing disadvantage on attacks and checks within its space for 1 minute. Extend by 1 minute per additional spell point. If you spend 3 spell points, create illusory objects or terrain that last 1 hour, can hold weight up to 50 lbs, and can only be seen through by magic detection or a success+ on an Observation check.

steps.name: Mental Push III
steps.description: Unleash a devastating psychic wave in Medium range. Creatures you choose must make an Intellect check. On failure, they are pushed back 20 ft, fall prone, take [[2d6]] mental damage, and suffer Disadvantage on their next action. Each success reduces the push distance by 5 ft and avoids prone. Spend 3+ spell points to create a lasting psychic echo in the area, forcing creatures that re-enter the space within 1 minute to succeed an Intellect check or take [[1d4]] mental damage and be pushed 5 ft.

steps.name: Shatter the Mind
steps.description:
Focus your will into a devastating mental strike against a creature within range. The target must make a Mental check; on a failure, they are Stunned until the end of their next turn and take psychic damage equal to your Intellect Check.
On a success they take half damage and suffer Disadvantage on their next check. If the target’s Intellect is lower than your spellcasting check, they also drop any held item.

professional.name: Strider
professional.desc: Striders are enigmatic agents of balance, embodying the profound dichotomy of night and day, life and death. They are not mere spies or skirmishers; they are custodians of the equilibrium between light and darkness. In their hands, the powers of solar radiance and eclipse shadows are more than just tools for espionage or combat; they are symbols of the eternal cycle of creation and destruction. Shadow Striders move through the world as avatars of this duality, their actions guided by a deeper understanding of the interconnectedness of all things.

steps.name: Eclipse Dash
steps.description: Meld through shadows and move between them. As a half-action in dim light or darkness, teleport a short range.

steps.name: Solar Flare
steps.description: As a half-action, target a creature within range with a burst of light. They must make an Observation check or take the Blind condition
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Hardlight
steps.description: Give a creature +10 armor
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Solar Flare II
steps.description: When you use Solar Flare, deal solar damage if they fail their Observation Check

steps.name: Duality Strike
steps.description: Your melee attacks deal either Eclipse or Solar damage. As a half-action, swap a weapon’s damage type to its normal damage, Eclipse, or Solar.

steps.name: Eclipse Dash II
steps.description: When you use Eclipse Dash, leave behind a shadow illusion of yourself that remains for thr duration.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Eclipse Dash III
steps.description: When you use Eclipse Dash and teleport to a creature, you can use an attack as a Half-Action

steps.name: Telepathic Understanding
steps.description: If a creature speaks to another telepathically, you can also hear it and you know where the creature is, no matter if they have tried to hide themselves.

steps.name: Solar Flare III
steps.description: When you use Solar Flare, the targeted creature glows with light and creatures have advantage to hit the creature
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Hardlight II
steps.description: When you use hardlight, give allies within range the +10 armor
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Resurgence
steps.description: You can use Eclipse Dash or Solar flare as an off-action once per day

professional.name: Witch Hunter
professional.desc: The Witch Hunter, or Inquisitor, is a guardian against the misuse of magic. They are the shadow that haunts rogue spellcasters, the unseen fear that grips the hearts of those who dare to corrupt the arcane. Their path is one of relentless pursuit, armed with the knowledge and tools to dismantle any magical threat. A successful mission for a Witch Hunter is a whisper in the night, a sign that magic's dark tide has been stemmed once more, without fanfare or recognition.

steps.name: Witch Hunter's Arsenal
steps.description: You gain +3 damage against spellcasters and magically enhanced creatures. Once per turn as a half-action, you may apply a poison to your weapon that adds +3 Toxic damage to your next attack
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Spell Disruptor
steps.description: Create a field that interrupts spellcasting. spells cast in this range have a -2 to the checks. Creatures powered by magic must make a Survival check or take the Confused condition
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Ethereal Chains
steps.description: Make a Spirit check. On a success, the target takes the Pinned condition, binding a creature within range with ethereal chains
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Intangible Hunter
steps.description: You can attack intangible creatures, dealing full damage. Additionally, as an action, you can pull an intangible creature into the physical plane, removing the intangible condition

steps.name: Banishing Strike
steps.description: Once per day, When you hit with an attack, you can make a Spirit check. If it is a success and the creature is not native to your current plane, they are sent to their home plane of existence.

steps.name: Tactical Retreat
steps.description: Use your off-action to halve the damage of an attack from a creature and move up to half your speed away without provoking opportunity attacks.

steps.name: Bloodhound
steps.description: Gain advantage on checks to track, interrogate, or identify supernatural threats. Once per long rest, you can smell out a cursed object or entity within short range.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Spell Disruptor II
steps.description: When you use the Spell Disruptor, allies gain +1 to spellcasting checks while in range

steps.name: Ethereal Chains II
steps.description: When you pin a creature with the Ethereal Chains, they take Eclipse Damage

steps.name: Tactical Retreat II
steps.description: When you use Tactical Retreat, make an attack at disadvantage

steps.name: Soul Chain
steps.description: Bind your soul to an enemy within Medium range. You take half damage from everything and the target takes the other half. If either of you dies, both make a contested Spirit check. The one with the lower check is dragged to the Eclipse by ghostly chains

professional.name: Ghostborn
professional.desc: As a Ghostborn, you exist between the mortal and ethereal planes. You have the ability to phase through objects, move unseen and unheard, and are practically a ghost to those around you. However, you are haunted by phantom pains of a body that is no longer yours, making it difficult to fully embrace your ethereal nature

steps.name: Ethereal Travel
steps.description: gain the Intangible condition. If you pass through a creature while in this condition, the creature takes [[1d4]] Thunder damage.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Spectral Agility
steps.description: When you take the Dash action, you become Invisible until the end of your next turn unless you make another action of any type

steps.name: Ghost Touch
steps.description: Your weapons deal an additional +3 Psychic damage

steps.name: Shadowborn
steps.description: You no longer suffer half movement from the Intangible condition, and you can deal half damage to creatures that aren't Intangible

steps.name: Spectral Grasp
steps.description: You can interact with objects and cast spells while Intangible. In addition, your spells have full effect on other intangible creatures

steps.name: Ethereal Evasion
steps.description: become partially Intangible, taking half damage from a single attack

steps.name: Revenant Recovery
steps.description: When you gain the Intangible condition, you take [[1d4]] healing

steps.name: Haunting Translocation
steps.description: You are permanently between planes. You gain +5 Armor and are semi-translucent, but you cast more shadows than normal. The souls of the Umbral Eclipse whisper and distract you.

steps.name: Ghostly Veil
steps.description: bring up to 6 allies partway into the Eclipse giving them advantage on Stealth checks
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Revenant Ascension
steps.description: Embrace your ghostly heritage. Gain a hover speed equal to half your movement
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Veil of the Whispers
steps.description: become empowered by the Eclipse, preventing the next Corpus or Cognition condition applied to you until the end of your next turn.

professional.name: Dragonkeeper
professional.desc: The Dragonkeeper is a rare and revered master of elemental pseudo-dragons, forming bonds with these scaled companions to unleash their latent power. As a Dragonkeeper, you nurture and train your draconic ally, transforming it into a loyal and versatile companion. Whether commanding their elemental breath in the heat of battle or relying on their keen senses and unique abilities to overcome challenges, the Dragonkeeper wields the raw force of nature embodied in their dragon. Together, you become an unstoppable duo, blending strategy, power, and the unbreakable bond of dragon and keeper

steps.name: Chroma Dragon
steps.description: Your Chroma Dragon is a loyal companion, As an action, you can switch its elemental affinity to adapt to the battlefield, a PL2 pseudo-dragon capable of shifting between elemental affinities. It has a reach range line Breath attack dealing [[1d6]] elemental damage and flight equal to half its movement. It can act independently on your turn.

steps.name: Chroma Dragon: Ravager
steps.description: Your Chroma Dragon's elemental attacks deal an additional [[1d6]] damage.

steps.name: Chroma Dragon: Flight
steps.description: Your Chroma Dragon gains a fly speed equal to its movement speed and can carry any non hefty small objects or provide aerial reconnaissance.

steps.name: Chroma Dragon: Senses
steps.description: As an off-action, you can see and hear through your dragon’s senses until the end of your next turn, gaining advantage on Observation checks during this time

steps.name: Chroma Dragon: Breath
steps.description: Your Chroma Dragon's breath attack now has up to a short range

steps.name: Chroma Dragon: Power
steps.description: Your Chroma Dragon's PL becomes equal to your Influence check

steps.name: Elemental Synergy
steps.description: While within short range of your Chroma Dragon, your melee or ranged attacks deal an additional +2 damage of your dragon’s current elemental type.

steps.name: Chroma Dragon: Tail
steps.description: As an off-action, your Chroma Dragon can make a [[1d4]] tail attack

steps.name: Chroma Dragon: Ally
steps.description: Your Chroma Dragon can shield an ally within range. That creature gains +5 armor and immunity to the dragon’s current elemental type
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Bonded Fury
steps.description: when your Dragon takes damage, give your dragon advantage on attack checks until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Elder Dragon Form
steps.description: Your Chroma Dragon transforms into an elder pseudo-dragon for 1 minute. It gains doubles in size, and damage. It has medium range attacks, and immunity to its current elemental type. Once this ability is used, it cannot be used again until after a long rest.

professional.name: Gunslinger
professional.desc: As a Gunslinger, you are a master of firearms and have honed your skills in the art of shooting to perfection. You possess an extensive knowledge of guns and are always equipped with the necessary ammunition to carry out your job effectively. With your steady aim and quick reflexes, you are a force to be reckoned with on the battlefield.

steps.name: Sharpshooter
steps.description: When you make a called shot to cause a condition, it is a -6 instead of -10.

steps.name: Burst Fire
steps.description: You have trained extensively to improve your rate of fire. As part of an attack action, when you make an attack with a firearm, make another attack but at disadvantage.

steps.name: Marked for Death
steps.description: When you do Tactical Assessment on a creature, gain +3 to attack checks and damage against that creature

steps.name: Quickdraw Showdown
steps.description: You've mastered the art of the quickdraw, a staple in any gunslinger's toolkit. As an action, you can challenge an enemy to a quickdraw duel as an immediate action. Each of you makes an attack; whoever makes the lower check takes the Charmed or Fear condition with the other as the source.

steps.name: Deft Reload
steps.description: You've become exceptionally quick at reloading your firearms. You can now reload as a free action. You can also impress creatures with your reloading; make an Influence check to impress or intimidate a creature in or out of combat

steps.name: Tough as Nails
steps.description: This rough life has toughened you up. You gain a +1 to all checks

steps.name: Armored Shooter
steps.description: Your extensive training has taught you how to fire your weapons while wearing armor effectively. You can now wear any armor and not take any penalties

steps.name: Shot on the Run
steps.description: After years of being a Gunslinger, you've mastered the ability to fire accurately while fleeing from danger. When you take the Dash action, you can make an attack at disadvantage with a firearm.

steps.name: Lead Storm
steps.description: You've learned to unleash a torrent of bullets upon your enemies. You make 2 attack actions with firearms. After that, you take the Deaf condition for 1 hour.

steps.name: Powerful Gunslinger
steps.description: You've reached the pinnacle of gunslinging. Your critical hit range with firearms is 18.

steps.name: High Noon
steps.description: You know when to make your move for the most impact. As an action, you can declare it's 'High Noon.' Your next ranged attack is an automatic critical hit

professional.name: Trapper
professional.desc: As a Tricky Trapper, you specialize in setting traps and creating diversions to give your team the upper hand in combat. You are a master of deception and misdirection, always looking for ways to outsmart your opponents. With your expertise in disarming and stealing traps, you can turn the tables on your enemies in the blink of an eye.

steps.name: Trap Types
steps.description: Choose trap effect: Snare (Pinned), Explosive ([[2d4]] fire), Poison ([[1d6]] + Coughing), Alarm (loud), Healing ([[2d6]]).

steps.name: Trapper Points
steps.description: As an action, set a trap within reach range. The trap remains until triggered or disarmed. Traps have a range of (5 ft) trigger radius and can be spotted with an Observation check.

steps.name: Quick Setup
steps.description: Set traps as half-action. +5 ft trigger range.

steps.name: Snare Trap II
steps.description: Snare Trap also causes the Bleeding condition.

steps.name: Trap Engineer
steps.description: All traps gain +5 ft trigger range and +2 damage.

steps.name: Silent Setup
steps.description: Traps are hidden and trap setup cannot be seen.

steps.name: Explosive Trap II
steps.description: Explosive Trap now hits all creatures in a 20 ft area.

steps.name: Trap Persistence
steps.description: Your traps can move to a new location and set themselves. You can command your traps on your turn. Your traps have a chance to be spotted when they move.

steps.name: Autonomous Traps
steps.description: Traps can move and reposition. Can be spotted while moving.

steps.name: Unparalleled Trapper
steps.description: (Prerequisite: Quick Setup) Set traps as an off-action.

steps.name: Healing Trap II
steps.description: Healing Trap also removes one Corpus condition.

steps.name: Calamity Trap
steps.description: Takes 1 hour to place. On trigger, terrain-altering battlefield effect for 1 minute (fog, quake, storm, etc.).

professional.name: Thornweaver
professional.desc: As a Thornweaver, you have an unparalleled connection to the world of plants, particularly those with defensive and offensive capabilities. Your ability to manipulate thorns, vines, and other flora allows you to protect your allies, control the battlefield, and strike fear into the hearts of your enemies

steps.name: Thorn Lash
steps.description: make a Strength or Agility check targeting up to three enemies within short range, dealing [[1d4]] piercing or slashing damage to each on a success

steps.name: Thorn Stance
steps.description: take the Thorn Stance. When a creature hits you with a melee attack, deal half the damage back to them as piercing damage
steps.duration: Until the start of your next turn

steps.name: Thornshot
steps.description: make a ranged attack within medium range, dealing [[2d6]] Piercing damage and causing the Bleeding condition

steps.name: Living Thorn Armor
steps.description: give yourself and an ally within reach range root armor that provides +5 armor.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Poison Thorns
steps.description: enhance your attacks to deal an additional [[3]] toxic damage and inflict the Coughing condition on enemies
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Thorn Lash II
steps.description: Your Thorn Lash can target up to 6 enemies and deals an additional 3 damage

steps.name: Thorned Ground
steps.description: Transform a short range around you into difficult terrain that remains for 1 minute. Enemies moving through it take [[1d6]] piercing damage each time they enter your Thorned Ground.

steps.name: Speak with Plants
steps.description: Gain the ability to speak Naech (Plants), allowing you to gather information about the surrounding area or ask plants to perform simple tasks

steps.name: Floral Ward
steps.description: Bloom with flowers as an action. Allies within reach range are immune to the Charmed and Confused conditions. This aura lasts for 1 minute or until you dismiss it.

steps.name: Camouflage
steps.description: gain advantage on Stealth checks until the end of your next turn. If in a natural environment, become Invisible

steps.name: Herbal Remedy
steps.description: heal an ally within reach range for [[1d6]] healing or remove one non-major condition. If in a natural environment, heal an additional [[1d6]] wounds.

professional.name: Steadfast
professional.desc: Walk the path where honor is your shield and resolve your sword. Embody the unyielding spirit of the warrior, standing resolute against all odds. In the tumult of war, you are the calm within the storm. Your talent as a soldier is not just a skill; it is an intrinsic part of who you are. You read the battlefield as a maestro reads a symphony, each movement a note, each strategy a chord. Your instincts, honed by countless skirmishes, allow you to anticipate enemy tactics, turning their maneuvers to your advantage with uncanny precision.

steps.name: Awareness Stance
steps.description: When you take this stance as a half-action, you can use your off-action to make an opportunity attack at advantage against any creature that enters your melee weapon range.

steps.name: Steadfast Resolve
steps.description: While in the Awareness Stance, you are immune to the Fear condition

steps.name: Battlefield Tactician
steps.description: Your tactical acumen allows you to exploit enemy weaknesses. When you use Tactical Assessment on an enemy, you and your allies gain a +2 to their attack checks against that enemy
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Silent
steps.description: Learn to blend stealth and speed, striking unexpectedly and with deadly efficiency. You can take the Hide action while you Disengage

steps.name: Defensive Harmony
steps.description: When you take the Awareness Stance, gain 5 armor. Additionally, you can hold 2 stances at once
steps.duration: Until the start of your next turn

steps.name: Zenith Focus
steps.description: Achieve a heightened state of focus. When you take the Awareness Stance, you can hear invisible creatures and treat them as not being invisible

steps.name: Awareness II
steps.description: When you take the Awareness Stance, give enemies Disadvantage to hit you

steps.name: Awareness III
steps.description: When you take the Awareness Stance, you are immune to Corpus Conditions until the start of your next turn

steps.name: Awareness IV
steps.description: You can take the Awareness Stance as an off-action. When you take the stance, gain advantage on your next attack check
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Step of the Wind
steps.description: You are wind incarnate. You can Dash as a half-action

steps.name: Gambit
steps.description: Unleash the full extent of your training and inner power in a single, decisive action. As an action, you become a blur to all creatures, dealing [[1d6]] thunder damage to all creatures in range

professional.name: Soulblade
professional.desc: As a Soulblade, you possess the rare ability to summon weapons from within yourself. You are a master of harnessing the power of your soul to create weapons of incredible strength and durability. Your weapons are a reflection of your innermost self and are imbued with your unique energy.

steps.name: Soul Weapon
steps.description: Summon a powerful melee weapon made entirely of your soul energy that requires an Agility, Strength, or Spirit check to wield. The weapon deals [[1d8]] physical damage and lasts for 1 minute. If you stop touching the weapon, it dissipates immediately

steps.name: Soul Reflection
steps.description: When you attack with your Soul Blade, you can make an additional attack and disadvantage

steps.name: Soul Guard
steps.description: You have +5 additional armor, this is regenerated on a Press On or Long Rest

steps.name: Resonance: Elemental
steps.description: you can change your soul weapon’s damage type to any Elemental type

steps.name: Resonance: Realm
steps.description: you can change your soul weapon’s damage type to any Realm type, except Healing

steps.name: Soul Reach
steps.description: Your soul weapon can become a ranged weapon instead of melee

steps.name: Soul Aegis
steps.description: your soul energy can now coalesce into a protective shield around an ally, granting them +10 armor for 1 minute

steps.name: Soul Echo
steps.description: you create a duplicate of yourself that can take a turn on your next turn in combat
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Soul Empowerment
steps.description: The bond between you and your soul weapon grows stronger. Your soul weapon deals damage equal to your Agility, Strength, or Spirit check

steps.name: Soul Bond
steps.description: You can always communicate with your close allies if they are in the same Realm as you

steps.name: Reflexive
steps.description: When attacked, reduce the damage by half

professional.name: Investigator
professional.desc: The Noir Detective is a sharp-eyed investigator and master of urban intrigue, skilled in navigating shadowy alleys, uncovering hidden truths, and outwitting opponents. Using a mix of deductive prowess, quirky gadgets, and street smarts, they uncover mysteries and manipulate the odds in their favor

steps.name: Mystic Deduction
steps.description: Observation is your Spellcasting check. You have spell Points equal to your Spellcasting Check. You regain 1 spell point on Press On and all on a long rest.

steps.name: Instinctive Insight
steps.description: Spend 1 spell point, gain advantage on checks to detect lies, uncover clues, or sense hidden motives

steps.name: Interrogation
steps.description: Spend 1 spell point targeting a creature within short range, make a contested Observation check. If you succeed, they must reveal 1 piece of information and suffer disadvantage on Influence checks until the end of their next turn

steps.name: Flash Disruptor
steps.description: Use a gadget to blind a target. They must make an Observation check or take the Blind condition until the end of their next turn

steps.name: Identify
steps.description: Spend 1 spell point to analyze an object and learn a key fact about its history, such as its last user, origin, any curses it may contain, or a hidden property about the object

steps.name: Smoke Bomb
steps.description: Spend 1 spell point to create dense fog in a short-range area at a point within short range, granting disadvantage to attacks for all creatures in the fog until the end of your next turn
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Hidden Whisper
steps.description: Whisper a message to a creature within range that only they can hear. If the creature is hostile, they must make a Spirit check or become distracted, granting you or an ally advantage on your next attack action targeting them
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Deciphering Lens
steps.description: Spending 1 spell point, automatically succeed on a check to decode messages, read faded text, briefly understand a dead language, or identify obscure symbols

steps.name: Wiretap
steps.description: Spending 1 spell point, place a discreet listening device on a surface or object. You can hear any conversations or noises near the object as long as you remain within medium range.

steps.name: Reflexive
steps.description: When attacked, reduce the damage by half

steps.name: License & Badge
steps.description: Spend 1 spell point to Flash credentials or a forged warrant to gain short-term access or cooperation.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

professional.name: Runebinder
professional.desc: Runebinders are mystical artisans who harnessed the ancient and arcane art of rune crafting. They are scholars and warriors, blending intellect with martial prowess. Through their deep understanding of magical runes, they imbue objects with powerful effects, altering the very essence of their gear for both offensive and defensive purposes.

steps.name: Runic Inscription
steps.description: Runes are applied as an action costing 1 Spell point, and activated as an Off-Action. You have Spell Points equal to your Intellect Check, you recover your Spell Points on a Long rest

steps.name: Wind Rune
steps.description: When activated, this rune grants you or an ally a burst of speed, increasing movement by 20 ft
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Mending Rune
steps.description: When activated, remove a Corpus or Cognition condition

steps.name: Shielding Rune
steps.description: When activated, grants +20 armor
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Exploding Rune
steps.description: When activated, the rune explodes dealing fire damage to creatures within range

steps.name: Elemental Rune
steps.description: When activated, Change a weapon’s type to an elemental type

steps.name: Rune of Clarity
steps.description: When activated, grant advantage on the next check
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Enhanced Inscriptions
steps.description: When activated, give a weapon +3 damage
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Healing Rune
steps.description: When activated, heal target for 2 healing

steps.name: Rune of the Phoenix
steps.description: When the wearer is reduced to 0 wounds, the rune activates, giving 2 healing before the injured condition is applied

steps.name: Master Runebinder
steps.description: You can activate 2 runes at once

steps.name: Reaper's Breath
steps.description: If it’s your first turn in combat or the target is unaware of your position, gain [[2d6]] to the attack check and damage

steps.name: Death’s Armor
steps.description: Summon a shroud of Eclipse armor as off-action when an attack is hitting you, reducing the damage by half

steps.name: Stealth
steps.description: When you get a Success+ on a Stealth check, gain the Invisible condition until the start of your next turn.

steps.name: Precision Strike
steps.description: You can choose to do a called shot at disadvantage instead of -10

steps.name: Soul Siphon
steps.description: Drain vitality from enemies to heal yourself or weaken them. As an off-action, when you make a successful attack on a creature, heal yourself for half the damage dealt

steps.name: Harbinger of Zuinmuir
steps.description: Gain the guidance from an angel of death. As an off-action, gain advantage on a check

steps.name: Reaper’s Awareness
steps.description: You have an additional Off-Action per turn in combat

steps.name: Soul Siphon II
steps.description: When you use Soul Siphon, heal for the full damage dealt instead of half. If the target is reduced to 0 wounds by the attack, gain +10 armor for 1 minute

steps.name: Reaper’s Breath II
steps.description: You always have +[[1d6]] to attack checks and damage

steps.name: Stealth II
steps.description: When you get a Success++ on a stealth check, gain the Intangible condition until the end of your next turn.

steps.name: Death’s Armor II
steps.description: When you use Death's Armor, negate all damage

merchant.name: Bio-Brewer
merchant.desc: The Bio-Brewer delves into the mysteries of life and mutation, using alchemical concoctions to reshape the bodies of allies, enemies, and even themselves. They walk the line between genius and monstrosity, balancing utility, raw power, and the unpredictable nature of mutation

steps.name: Mutagen
steps.description: Administer a Mutagen to an ally as an action. The target gains a temporary mutation for 1 minute. A creature can only have one mutagen at a time. Your mutagen gives the creature +1 bonus to all checks and +5 movement speed

steps.name: Local Reputation
steps.description: When crafting or selling items in the same town or region more than once, you gain Advantage on Influence checks with vendors, collectors, or alchemist Unions there. After 3 positive transactions, you gain a minor favor or rumor.

steps.name: Refinement Union Access
steps.description: Gain access to a Refinement Union. You immediately select one Merchant Feature from that Union. You may now visit the Union to request Information and access its unique goods or services.

steps.name: Alchemical Workbench
steps.description: You have an Alchemical Workbench where you can craft [[1d6]] potions and brews during a long rest or downtime. Choose assistants to help you using specialized stations: Distillation Rack (Crafting or Intellect), Infusion Vat (Survival or Influence), and Cooling Spiral (Luck or Observation). Each participant makes a check; total successes determine quality: 1 success: Poor (1 gp), 2-3 Successes: Good (20 gp), 3-5: Great (100 gp), 6+ or Exceptional (200 gp).

steps.name: Mutagen II
steps.description: You mutagen gives the creature quills or spikes that deal 3 damage to melee attackers. Your mutagen also gives the creature gills allowing for underwater breathing

steps.name: Caustic Brew
steps.description: You may now craft [[1d6]] Caustic Brews using your Alchemical Workbench as a 1 hour action. When thrown (short Range) a Caustic Brew bursts in a reach range, dealing [[1d6]] damage per brew quality tier and inflicting the Coughing condition on a failed Survival check. These can also be sold for 10 gp per die of damage

steps.name: Potion Identification
steps.description: Gain Advantage on Observation or Crafting checks to identify unknown potions or alchemical substances. Once per day, you may name-drop an obscure ingredient or brew for dramatic effect or to gain leverage in conversation

steps.name: Mutagen III
steps.description: Your mutagen gives creatures unreasonable beauty, giving them advantage on Influence checks. Additionally that have claws that deal an additional [[1d6]] slashing damage

steps.name: Mutagen IV
steps.description: When you apply a Mutagen, the creature takes [[1d6]] healing

steps.name: Caustic Brew II
steps.description: You can craft double the amount of Caustic Brews at a time. Additionally your Caustic Brews also cause the Slowed condition on a failed Survival check

steps.name: Mutagen V
steps.description: When you apply a Mutagen, You also take the Mutagen

merchant.name: Gambler
merchant.desc: You're a broker of fortune, navigating the invisible currents of trade, contracts, and coin. Wealth is not just a means to an end; it is your weapon, your shield, and your spellbook. You understand that true power lies in who controls access, who dictates the terms, and who profits when the dust settles. Gold flows where you command it, bending laws, shaping outcomes, and granting influence that cannot be matched by force alone. Every transaction carries risk, every contract is a battlefield, and every coin spent or earned is a calculated move

steps.name: Luck Spellcaster
steps.description: Luck is your Spellcasting check. You have Spell Points equal to your Spellcasting Check. You regain 1 spell point on Press On and all on a long rest.

steps.name: Commerce Union Access
steps.description: Gain access to a Commerce Union. You immediately select one Merchant Feature from that Union. You may now visit the Union to request Information and access its unique goods or services.

steps.name: High Roller
steps.description: When making a Luck check in a gambling situation, you can reroll the check and must take the new result. Additionally, when winning a bet or gamble, you gain a temporary boost of confidence, granting you a spell point

steps.name: Point of Sale
steps.description: you can create fake GP using a spell point. When you use a spell point to create GP, you create 1d100 gold that lasts for [[2d4]] days. It holds up to all inspection, magical or otherwise, until the end of the duration when it turns to rot.

steps.name: Risk Dividend
steps.description: When you cast a spell with your last spell point, roll 1d6. On a 6, regain 1 spell point.

steps.name: Gamble Your Life
steps.description: you can make a high-stakes bet with a willing creature (could be determined with a free action social check). You both roll a d100, and the loser takes damage equal to the difference between the rolls. This damage can't be reduced or prevented in any way

steps.name: Gamble Your Life II
steps.description: you can challenge an enemy to a game of chance. You both make contested Luck checks. The loser takes [[1d6]] psychic damage.

steps.name: Gamble Your Life III
steps.description: Whenever you win a Gamble Your Life roll, gain advantage on your next Influence or Spellcasting check

steps.name: Point of Sale II
steps.description: Spend 1 spell point to conjure a single-use mundane item worth up to 50 gp (weapon, tool, disguise, key, etc). Lasts for 1 hour or until used. Looks and functions like the real thing.

steps.name: Risk Dividend II
steps.description: When you use Risk Dividend, when you roll a 3-6, regain 1 spell point

steps.name: Market Collapse
steps.description: Once per day, choose a single item, creature, or spell effect within range. Declare its value has been voided. The target loses all magical bonuses, item benefits, or effect potency for 1 minute (narrator’s discretion on legendary effects). Enemies in the area take [[2d6]] psychic damage from economic shockwaves if they have magical or enchanted equipment.

merchant.name: Incantatore
merchant.desc: In the shadows of grandeur and the limelight of intrigue, you've navigated the treacherous waters of ambition and desire. Known to many as the Incantatore, your journey has been one of cunning and allure, a path carved by the sheer force of your presence and the magnetic charm you wield like a blade. Yet, beneath the surface of calculated smiles and strategic flirtations lies a soul weary of the facade, a spirit yearning for authenticity beyond the roles you've played. Your expertise in the art of seduction has always been your weapon and your shield, guiding you through the complexities of human desires, twisting intentions to your will with a mere glance, a whisper

steps.name: Enthrall
steps.description: Once per day, choose a target. They become Enthralled for 1 minute. You have advantage on Influence checks against them, and any Charm effects you apply last twice as long.

steps.name: Influence Spellcaster
steps.description: Influence is your Spellcasting check. You have Spell Points equal to your Spellcasting Check. You regain 1 spell point on Press On and all on a long rest.

steps.name: Culture Union Access
steps.description: Gain access to a Culture Union. You immediately select one Merchant Feature from that Union. You may now visit the Union to request Information and access its unique goods or services.

steps.name: Charming
steps.description: Target a humanoid within short range. Make contested Influence checks. For each success, they gain the Charmed condition for 1 minute.

steps.name: Enthrall II
steps.description: You may choose to end your Enthrall. When you do, the target takes [[2d6]] psychic damage and gains the Confused condition.

steps.name: Enthrall III
steps.description: When you use Enthrall, the target must make a contested Influence check or immediately become Charmed (you as the source).

steps.name: Enthrall IV
steps.description: You may now use Enthrall freely. Charmed targets via this effect will offer more information, and assist you to the best of their ability so long as it doesn't harm them.

steps.name: Velvet Blade
steps.description: You may now deal Psychic damage to Charmed targets without breaking the charm effect.

steps.name: Presence
steps.description: Your allure can be so potent it captivates all around you. As an action, humanoid creatures within short range must make an Observation check or become charmed by you for 1 minute

steps.name: Fascination
steps.description: When a target is Charmed by you, you may designate up to 3 allies to also count as the source of that charm.

steps.name: Charming II
steps.description: Psychic damage dealt to Charmed targets is doubled.

merchant.name: Nightshade
merchant.desc: Masters of fear and toxic beauty, the Nightshade blends deadly flora and subconscious manipulation into a powerful toolkit. With their mastery of Spirit and alchemical craft, they weave fearsome illusions and deadly toxins, crafting items and artifacts that carry their lethal artistry. These merchants of terror understand both the psychology of dread and the tangible allure of the items they sell

steps.name: Bloom
steps.description: Summon a flower within short range that deals [[1d6]] toxic damage to creatures within reach.

steps.name: Survival Spellcaster
steps.description: Survival is your Spellcasting check. You have Spell Points equal to your Spellcasting Check. You regain 1 spell point on Press On and all on a long rest.

steps.name: Harvest Union Access
steps.description: Gain access to a Harvest Union. You immediately select one Merchant Feature from that Union. You may now visit the Union to request Information and access its unique goods or services.

steps.name: Fearcaster
steps.description: When a creature that has the Fear condition with you as the source dies, flees, or submits you regain +1 spell point

steps.name: Bloomling
steps.description: Summon a PL 3 Bloomling, a flower with your Bloom feature when it attacks.

steps.name: Bloom II
steps.description: Creatures hit with Bloom must make a Survival check or take the Fear condition

steps.name: Fearmonger
steps.description: When a target gains the fear condition with you as the source, the fear lasts 1 additional round

steps.name: Bloom III
steps.description: Creatures hit with Bloom and fail the survival check also take the Exposed condition

steps.name: Fearmonger II
steps.description: You and your allies have advantage on attacks against a target with Fear

steps.name: Bloom IV
steps.description: Your Bloom deals damage equal to your Survival check

steps.name: Bloomling II
steps.description: You can summon 3 Bloomlings or one PL 10 Bloomlord

merchant.name: Bureaucrat
merchant.desc: The Power Player is a master manipulator and strategist, operating from the shadows or stepping into the spotlight to shape the world around them. With an extensive network of government agents, criminal operatives, and influential figures, you pull strings that others can barely see, let alone touch. Your connections open doors to opportunities, resources, and information that can turn the tide of any situation. Your influence extends far beyond the battlefield. Whether negotiating a delicate truce between warring factions, orchestrating the downfall of a rival organization, or securing high-value resources, you leverage your network to weave intricate plots and achieve your goals. Every conversation, deal, and favor becomes a piece of your larger strategy, building a web of alliances and obligations that stretches across the world.

steps.name: Authority
steps.description: You are always carrying the correct documentation. Whenever a creature challenges your authority or attempts to deny access, you may immediately make an Influence check to override, bypass, or stall their objection. On a success, you proceed as if permitted.

steps.name: Politics Union Access
steps.description: Gain access to a Politics Union. You immediately select one Merchant Feature from that Union. You may now visit the Union to request Information and access its unique goods or services.

steps.name: Authority II
steps.description: You may issue a Temporary Permit that grants access to a restricted area, exempts one action from legal consequence, or compels minor officials to comply. Once used it cannot be used again for 1 week

steps.name: Denial Notice
steps.description: Once per day, you may serve a Denial Notice to give a creature the Pinned and Confused conditions as they’re overwhelmed by forms and procedural panic.

steps.name: Whisper Network
steps.description: Upon entering any city or Union-held location, you immediately learn the name of a minor official who owes you a favor, the most recently passed ordinance, and the current policy being enforced.

steps.name: Bureaucratic Snare
steps.description: Once per day, as an off-action, quote a technicality or clause mid-conflict. On a successful contested Influence check, the target becomes Confused and takes [[2d6]] psychic damage from bureaucratic overload.

steps.name: Authority III
steps.description: Your presence is legally binding. While speaking, creatures of lower rank or social standing suffer disadvantage on attempts to oppose or ignore your commands. Guards, clerks, and bureaucrats treat you as a superior unless given proof otherwise.

steps.name: Denial Notice II
steps.description: When you serve a Denial Notice, all of the creature’s allies within short range must succeed an Observation check or also become Confused for 1 round.

steps.name: Whisper Network II
steps.description: You also learn the location of one guarded file, sealed contract, or hidden directive relevant to your current objective, and how to access it.

steps.name: Bureaucratic Snare II
steps.description: If the target is already Confused, they are also Slowed for 1 round and take an additional [[1d6]] damage from spiraling procedural panic.

steps.name: Administrative Lockdown
steps.description: Spending a Merchant Token during a long rest sets up an Administrative Lockdown in a long range area. No creature may enter or leave the current area without your permission. Enemies who attempt to disobey must succeed a Intellect check or become Pinned and Confused. Allies gain advantage on checks within the zone due to “supporting documentation.”

merchant.name: Sovereign
merchant.desc: Legends are whispered about you in hushed tones, and tales of your exploits circulate through every corner of the realm. Your reputation has grown into a powerful yet perilous asset, turning you into a figure of both awe and unease. While your renown opens doors to alliances and favors, it also draws the watchful eyes of foes, rivals, and those who envy or resent your fame. People of influence know your name, and even those who’ve only heard rumors feel compelled to treat you with deference or wariness. Yet, such reverence is a double-edged sword. Allies will offer you unprompted assistance and exclusive opportunities, but enemies and opportunists, too, are never far behind, hoping to gain from your downfall or catch a glimpse of vulnerability

steps.name: Crowdblend
steps.description: While in low light, tunnels, crowds, or mechanical cover, you may become Invisible until the end of your next turn as an action. You may pass through guards or conflict zones without being targeted.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Stewardship Union Access
steps.description: Gain access to a Stewardship Union. You immediately select one Merchant Feature from that Union. You may now visit the Union to request Information and access its unique goods or services.

steps.name: Substructure
steps.description: Once per day, if you are within a tunnel, sewer, or undercity corridor, you may cause the infrastructure to shift violently. Choose one zone within short range; all enemies inside must make a Physical check or take [[2d6]] impact damage and gain the Pinned condition for 1 round as the walls close in.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Civic Authority
steps.description: You can identify infrastructure layouts and hidden access points on sight. As an action, you can bypass, unlock, or reroute a non-magical system like power, water, ventilation, or transit if it’s present in the scene.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Field Reinforcement
steps.description: As an action, you can quickly deploy or reinforce a structure by blocking a hallway, stabilizing a platform, or repairing a wall. Choose one: create full cover, clear a passage, or stop a collapse. The reinforcement lasts for 1 minute

steps.name: Modular Construction
steps.description: Once per day, You can deploy one modular structure: a barricade, power node, purification unit, or airlock chamber. These last 1 hour or until destroyed, granting allies a tactical advantage based on type.

steps.name: Infrastructure Override
steps.description: Once per rest, you can hijack a city's system. Choose one system (power, water, transport, security). For 1 minute, you control it completely: reroute power, trigger sprinklers, lock doors, or flood a section.

steps.name: Civic Authority II
steps.description: You may now perform Civic Authority as an Off-Action to prevent a triggered hazard or system failure. If a trap, collapse, or lockdown would occur, you may stop or redirect it instantly.

steps.name: Field Reinforcement II
steps.description: Your reinforcements may now include mechanical components such as: auto-lifting arms, spike barriers, or pressure plates. You may also fortify an existing structure, doubling its durability

steps.name: Substructure II
steps.description: summon the Wyrm of Substructure, a titanic manifestation of living pipeline, sewage coils, and steel bones. It bursts from the ground, reshaping the battlefield. It deals [[2d6]] impact damage to all creatures you choose in a medium range. It then coils around a zone, forming impenetrable cover and granting Full Cover to allies inside. After 1 minute, the wyrm disassembles cleanly, returning the infrastructure to full function without lasting damage.

steps.name: Structure
steps.description: Spend 1 Merchant Token to cast the Structure spell at Cataclysm level. When you do so it connects to a megastructure demiplane of your design and theme.

steps.name: Fast Fabrication I
steps.description: As an action, repair armor for [[1d6]] or increase a weapon’s damage by +1 for 1 minute

steps.name: Fabrication Union Access
steps.description: Gain access to a Fabrication Union. You immediately select one Merchant Feature from that Union. You may now visit the Union to request Information and access its unique goods or services.

steps.name: Engineer I
steps.description: Make a crafting check to create a useful item for the current situation like a lockpicking wrench, grappling hook launcher, or alarm clock crab. These items don't need specific description and can do minor things, like deal 2 damage, unlock a mundane door, or cause a Corpus condition until the end of the target's next turn

steps.name: Vehicle I
steps.description: During a long rest, make a Crafting check to build a simple cart or crank-powered hauler. Its PL is 2 per success (max PL 6), and it can carry up to three passengers or modest cargo over flat terrain. You may attempt to upgrade it during another long rest using a new Crafting check, but you must take the new result. You may only have one vehicle constructed in this way at a time. If you begin building another, the previous one is considered decommissioned or lost to upkeep.

steps.name: Fast Fabrication II
steps.description: You may now apply both effects at once (repair + empower) to the same target. When used on a construct or automaton, they also gain +1 to attack rolls for 1 round.

steps.name: Engineer II
steps.description: You can create a clockwork companion using a Crafting check. It has a PL of 3 per success and is powered until your next long rest. You can recharge or improve the same companion with another Crafting check, setting its PL for the day.

steps.name: Vehicle II
steps.description: You can now improve your vehicle to a scout car, small crawler, or motor hauler during a long rest. Make a Crafting check; its PL is 3 per success (max PL 9). This vehicle can handle moderate terrain and supports up to eight passengers. You may only have one vehicle constructed in this way at a time. If you begin building another, the previous one is considered decommissioned or lost to upkeep.

steps.name: Fast Fabrication III
steps.description: You may now use Fast Fabrication as an off-action. In addition, the weapon bonus becomes +2, and the armor repair increases to [[2d6]].

steps.name: Engineer III
steps.description: You may now deploy up to 2 companions at once. When a companion hits 0 HP, it detonates, forcing nearby enemies in reach range to make an Agility check or take [[3d6]] impact damage and become Confused for 1 round. Additionally, your companions may now use off-actions to aid an ally, activate levers, or trigger items during your turn.

steps.name: Vehicle III
steps.description: You can now improve your vehicle to a threaded tank, rail hauler, or armored carrier. During a long rest, make a Crafting check; its PL is 4 per success (max PL 12). The vehicle can include mounted weapons, sealed compartments, or internal modules like a mobile forge or command core. You may only have one vehicle constructed in this way at a time. If you begin building another, the previous one is considered decommissioned or lost to upkeep.

steps.name: Investment
steps.description: You may spend 2 Merchant Tokens at your Union to purchase a factory or warehouse. When you do, choose the type of facility (e.g., vehicle yard, weapons shop, golem forge) and set the primary item or service it produces. This location becomes part of your trade empire. Once per in-game month, when you visit or check in, the facility provides 1d100 × 10 gp and 1 Merchant Token as income, contract returns, or supply credit. You may only operate one investment of this type at a time.

merchant.name: Warlord
merchant.desc: Profitable Warlords are merchants of violence, who understand that the clashing of steel is just another form of negotiation. They bring a keen business acumen to the battlefield, turning a profit on their victories and using their wealth to bolster their strength. They are shrewd tacticians and capable fighters, able to broker deals and break bones with equal skill. Their unique understanding of both warfare and commerce makes them formidable adversaries, capable of turning even the direst of situations into opportunities for profit.

steps.name: Warswarm
steps.description: You have a loyal group of five hirelings (PL5 swarm, counts as Large). They obey your commands and can be split up to run simple errands, reducing the swarm’s PL by 1 for each member sent off. If reduced to 0 HP, the swarm loses 1 PL and disbands. It returns on a Press On or Long Rest, and recovers +1 PL after each Long Rest, up to a maximum of 5. They follow orders but aren't suited for nuanced plans or independent thinking.

steps.name: Martial Union Access
steps.description: Gain access to a Martial Union. You immediately select one Merchant Feature from that Union. You may now visit the Union to request Information and access its unique goods or services.

steps.name: Warlord's Armor
steps.description: You suffer no penalties from wearing armor, and all armor you wear gains +5 Armor

steps.name: Warlord's Weapon
steps.description: Choose a signature weapon. You gain +1 to Checks and Damage with this weapon. When you draw it, allies who can see you gain +1 to their next check

steps.name: Reposition
steps.description: At the start of combat, You and allies within reach range may move up to half their movement.

steps.name: Warswarm II
steps.description: Your swarm becomes PL8 and is trained in combat formations. They gain +1 to attack checks and you can split them into two Medium PL4 units instead of one Large PL8, giving them more tactical flexibility.

steps.name: Reposition II
steps.description: At the start of combat, Allies within reach gain +5 armor for 1 minute and +10 movement speed

steps.name: Warlord's Weapon II
steps.description: Your weapon gains +2 to Checks and Damage. It cannot be disarmed and When you strike a creature with it, you may issue a free command to an ally within short range giving them +2 on their next check

steps.name: Warswarm III
steps.description:
Choose a specialty for your Warswarm. This is a permanent change; to select a new specialty, you must spend a Merchant Token and complete a Long Rest.
- Shieldbearers gain +5 Armor and can form cover for allies.
- Healers can use an action to heal an ally within reach for [[1d6]] HP.
- Mystics gain basic spellcasting with an Origin of your choice and have Spell Points equal to the Warswarm’s current PL.

steps.name: Warlord's Weapon III
steps.description: Each time you reduce a creature to 0 HP or force a combat submission, it gains +1 to Checks and Damage until your next Long Rest. It whispers in your mind, urging violence or conquest.

steps.name: Investment
steps.description: You may spend 2 Merchant Tokens at your Union to purchase a factory or warehouse. When you do, choose the type of facility (e.g., vehicle yard, weapons shop, golem forge) and set the primary item or service it produces. This location becomes part of your trade empire. Once per in-game month, when you visit or check in, the facility provides 1d100 × 10 gp and 1 Merchant Token as income, contract returns, or supply credit. You may only operate one investment of this type at a time.

merchant.name: Instructor
merchant.desc: You are the mind that shapes the future, the guiding hand behind the breakthroughs and victories of others. The Instructor is a scholar, a strategist, and a speaker whose knowledge becomes a weapon in the hands of their allies. Your lessons do not end in the classroom. They echo across battlefields, research halls, and negotiation tables. You uplift those around you, transforming raw potential into precision and power. With every plan shared, every whispered correction, and every hard-earned insight, you build something stronger than reputation. You build legacy

steps.name: Lesson Plan
steps.description: Choose one ally within short range. They gain +2 to all checks until the end of their next turn.

steps.name: Scholarship Union Access
steps.description: Gain access to a Scholarship Union. You immediately select one Merchant Feature from that Union. You may now visit the Union to request Information and access its unique goods or services.

steps.name: Intellect Spellcaster
steps.description: Intellect is your Spellcasting check. You have Spell Points equal to your Spellcasting Check. You regain 1 spell point on Press On and all on a long rest.

steps.name: Study Partner
steps.description: After you hit an enemy, allies within short range have advantage to hit them.

steps.name: Academic
steps.description: Once per round, when an ally within short range makes a check, you may grant them +2 by using your Off-Action to assist with logic, tactics, or a mnemonic tip.

steps.name: Vault Reader
steps.description: You can read and interpret dead, obscure, or magical languages with an Intellect check. On success, treat the text as a live conversation for 1 minute, allowing you to ask questions and receive thematic, metaphorical answers.

steps.name: Lesson Plan II
steps.description: Lesson plan affects up to 3 allies within short range

steps.name: Study Partner II
steps.description: After an ally hits an enemy with advantage, they repair +1 armor

steps.name: Lesson Plan III
steps.description: Lesson plan effects up all allies within medium range

steps.name: Academic Investment
steps.description: Spend 2 Merchant Tokens to establish or claim a position at a school, guildhall, or institute. You do not gain GP from this investment. Instead, once per month when you check in, you gain +1 bonus to all checks that lasts for 1 week. Additionally gain 1 merchant token

steps.name: Academic Investment II
steps.description: Your Investment now pays off in knowledge. You gain +5 spell point maximum and once per month you can get an item enchanted with a simple enchantment

merchant.name: Kingpin
merchant.desc: You are not a thug or a brute. You are the architect of fear, the shadow behind every locked door and whispered deal. The Kingpin commands more than just muscle, relying on loyalty, influence, and infernal leverage to maintain control. With a single word, you can unravel reputations, silence rivals, or bind demons to your service. Your presence distorts the balance of power in every room you enter, twisting rules and bending loyalties without ever raising your voice. Each redmarked target is another piece in your carefully constructed game, every factory or racket another thread in your growing empire. You do not rule through brute force alone. You rule through control, manipulation, and the ever-present threat of what happens when someone stops playing by your rules

steps.name: Redmark
steps.description: Choose a creature within short range to Redmark. When you succeed an Influence (Intimidation) check against them, gain +5 Armor until the end of your next turn. If the creature attempts to flee, you gain +10 movement speed until the end of your turn. You may have one creature Redmarked at a time, it lasts for 1 minute

steps.name: Subversion Union Access
steps.description: Gain access to a Subversion Union. You immediately select one Merchant Feature from that Union. You may now visit the Union to request Information and access its unique goods or services.

steps.name: Legal Shield
steps.description: You've wrapped yourself in legitimate business and political connections. Once per city, you may completely nullify legal or official consequences of your actions unless someone has undeniable proof.

steps.name: Redmark II
steps.description: When you hit a creature marked by Redmark, gain +1 to all checks and +1 damage against that target

steps.name: Binding
steps.description: When you see a demon or Vozian creature, you may make a contested Influence check. On a success, you bind the creature with the Charm condition. While charmed this way, it has Disadvantage on attacks against your allies and will obey simple, non-harmful tasks for 1 minute. You may only have one creature bound in this way at a time.

steps.name: Redmark III
steps.description: Your Redmark remains for 1 hour, and you always know the general direction and location of your Redmarked target. You have Advantage on Observation, Influence, and Spirit checks against them. When you make an Influence check against them, they gain the Fear condition

steps.name: Interdict
steps.description: You may deny Vozian magic within short range for 1 minute, forcing all spells with the Vozian Origin to be at disadvantage

steps.name: Redmark IV
steps.description: You may now Redmark up to two creatures at once. For each Remarked creature you can see, you gain +10 to your Armor maximum

steps.name: Binding II
steps.description: Your bindings last 1 hour and no longer require line of sight to maintain. Bound demons gain +1 PL while serving you. Once per long rest, you may force a demon to permanently accept your sigil, making it bound until dismissed, defeated, or exorcised.

steps.name: Redmark V
steps.description: Your Redmarks remain for 1 week, and you may now Redmark up to 4 creatures at once. For each Redmarked creature gain +1 Influence. When you cause the fear condition, all your Redmarked creatures must make a Survival check or take the Fear condition as well

steps.name: Investment
steps.description: You may spend 2 Merchant Tokens at your Union to purchase a factory or warehouse. When you do, choose the type of facility (e.g., vehicle yard, weapons shop, golem forge) and set the primary item or service it produces. This location becomes part of your trade empire. Once per in-game month, when you visit or check in, the facility provides 1d100 × 10 gp and 1 Merchant Token as income, contract returns, or supply credit. You may only operate one investment of this type at a time.

merchant.name: Chef
merchant.desc: In a world where might often prevails, you've honed an art that captivates both heart and palate. Your culinary prowess transcends mere sustenance, turning every dish into an experience. With a knife as your wand and ingredients as your spells, you weave magic on plates, eliciting joy, nostalgia, or even healing with every bite. As a Culinary Maestro, you not only feed bodies but also souls, creating moments that linger long after the last morsel is savored.

steps.name: Main Dish
steps.description: As an action, you throw a prepared meal at a creature within short range. If the target is an ally, they heal 1 wound. If the target is an enemy, they take [[1d6]] physical damage.

steps.name: Main Dish: Spices
steps.description: When you use Main Dish, add [[1d4]] fire damage to enemy targets

steps.name: Main Dish: Crust
steps.description: When you use Main Dish on an ally, they also gain +5 armor until the end of their next turn
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Main Dish: Flavor Burst
steps.description: When you use Main Dish, it deals half damage to enemy creatures within reach

steps.name: Main Dish: Garlic Powder
steps.description: When you use Main Dish on an enemy, they must pass a Survival check or gain the Coughing condition.

steps.name: Main Dish: Greasy
steps.description: When you use Main Dish, enemy targets must pass an Agility check or become Prone.

steps.name: Main Dish: Brain Freeze
steps.description: When you use Main Dish, the target must pass a Survival check or become Slowed until the end of their next turn.

steps.name: Main Dish: Vampire Dust
steps.description: When you use Main Dish on an ally, they gain Invisibility until the end of their next turn
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Evening Feast
steps.description: During a Long Rest, your meal restores all armor fully (not just to half) for all allies who partake.

steps.name: Taster’s Tongue
steps.description: You can identify potions, poisons, or unknown ingredients by tasting them, without suffering harmful effects.

steps.name: Harvest Union Access
steps.description: Gain access to a Harvest Union. You immediately select one Merchant Feature from that Union. You may now visit the Union to request Information and access its unique goods or services.

merchant.name: Caravan Leader
merchant.desc: Caravan Leaders are the grand strategists of commerce, who understand that every journey is a venture fraught with both risk and opportunity. With a blend of keen business sense and logistical acumen, they orchestrate the movement of goods across treacherous landscapes, turning each successful delivery into profit. They are adept negotiators, capable organizers, and have a deep understanding of the intricate dance between supply and demand.
