Their leadership ensures the prosperity of their ventures through both peaceful trade and, when necessary, the strategic use of force to protect their interests.

steps.name: Mobilize
steps.description: Allies within short range have +5 movement speed at the start of their turn.

steps.name: Mobilize: Packlight
steps.description: Allies affected by Mobilize also ignore terrain penalties

steps.name: Mobilize: Swiftstart
steps.description: Allies affected by Mobilize may move immediately at the start of combat, before initiative is rolled.

steps.name: Mobilize: Unpinned
steps.description: Allies affected by Mobilize are immune to the Pinned condition

steps.name: Mobilize: Fleetfoot
steps.description: Allies affected by Mobilize Gain an additional +10 movement speed

steps.name: Mobilize: Untethered
steps.description: Allies affected by Mobilize are immune to the Slowed condition

steps.name: Fast Lane
steps.description: You can always find cheap, reliable transport in any settlement. Travel and cargo costs are halved. Additionally Your time on the road has honed your survival skills. Gain advantage on Survival checks related to navigation, finding food and water, and assessing environmental threats. Additionally, you can identify the best place to camp to avoid danger

steps.name: Instant Break
steps.description: During a Press On or Long Rest, all allies regain +3 armor and +1 additional resource (class or spell point)

steps.name: Waypoint
steps.description: Once Per day, Teleport a willing creature you touch to any location within long range that you can see or have recently visited

steps.name: Investment: Transport
steps.description: You may spend 1 Merchant Token to establish a caravan office, stables, or transit hub in a city you've visited. This location joins your personal transport network. Once per in-game month, when you visit or check in with any node in your network, you gain [[1d20 × 5]] gp and receive one lead, rumor, or useful travel detail from your network. You may expand the network to a new city by spending another Merchant Token, increasing the multiple by +1 per city (×6 for 2 cities, ×7 for 3, etc.)

steps.name: Transport Union Access
steps.description: Gain access to a Transport Union. You immediately select one Merchant Feature from that Union. You may now visit the Union to request Information and access its unique goods or services.

merchant.name: Showman
merchant.desc: Radiating charisma and charm, the Gregarious Showman is an unforgettable figure. They not only excel in the art of commerce but also stand as a shining beacon of entertainment, amassing a cavalcade of allies and friends. Their irresistible charm and engaging performances captivate hearts, forging bonds that transcend mere business. As masters of ceremonies, their events and galas are the talk of towns and cities. They are at the center of every circle, knowing just how to navigate the social and economic dynamics of each gathering. Equipped with a sharp business acumen and an enchanting personality, the Gregarious Showman turns each transaction into a spectacle, each negotiation into an event, and each market into a stage. With every town they enter, their network expands, their reputation soars, and their influence deepens. A Gregarious Showman is not just a merchant; they are a symbol of unity, celebration, and camaraderie

steps.name: Stage of Commerce
steps.description:
Set up a portable venue (stage, lounge, cart, etc.) that lasts for 1 hour. This stage must be set in a populated area, you must be at the venue the entire time, and you may only have one active at a time. Once during this time, you may perform or engage the crowd. Make an Influence check:
- 1 success: Gain [[2d20]] gp from tips, wagers, or business.
- 2+ successes: Attract a notable NPC or faction interest.

steps.name: Stage of Commerce: Timestance
steps.description: Your Stage of Commerce now lasts 8 hours instead of 1.

steps.name: Stage of Commerce: Spectral Staff
steps.description: While Stage of Commerce is active, you have 6 spectral servants (PL2) that assist with entertainment, serving, setup, or crowd control

steps.name: Stage of Commerce: Hired Blades
steps.description: While Stage of Commerce is active, you 2 friendly mercenaries (PL6) who guard the stage and can assist if things turn violent

steps.name: Stage of Commerce: Stage manager
steps.description: While Stage of Commerce is active, you summon a Stage Manager (PL5) that handles the crowd and works the booth, you no longer need to be at the venue the entire time

steps.name: Stage of Commerce: Profit Margin
steps.description: When you make the Influence Check, gain a Merchant Token on 3+ successes.

steps.name: Performance of Distraction
steps.description: Create a stunning display that hides you and your allies, allowing you a quick exit to a nearby location away from immediate danger
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Dramatic Entrance
steps.description: you can make a grand entrance that captures everyone's attention. Make an Influence Check. For every success, you can impose a Cognition condition of your choice on one enemy within short range. This could be distracting them, disorienting them, or even causing them to underestimate you.

steps.name: Encore Performance
steps.description: After you fail a check, spend a Merchant Token to immediately reroll it with a +10 bonus

steps.name: Investment: Networking
steps.description: You may spend 1 Merchant Token to establish a fan club, press office, or event promoter in a city you've performed in. This location joins your growing fame network. Once per in-game month, when you visit or check in with any node in your network, gain [[1d10 × 5]] gp in appearance fees, endorsements, or donations. Additionally, you receive one rumor, contact, or invitation tied to local social events. Each new city added increases the payout multiplier by +1 (×6 for 2 cities, ×7 for 3, etc.)

steps.name: Culture Union Access
steps.description: Gain access to a Culture Union. You immediately select one Merchant Feature from that Union. You may now visit the Union to request Information and access its unique goods or services.

merchant.name: Witch
merchant.desc: The Witch is a mysterious figure bound to the ancient, untamed forces of nature. Known for brewing potent concoctions and wielding thorned charms, they embody the wild wisdom of the woods, drawing power from plants, animals, and spirits. Whether concocting remedies, commanding vines, or summoning protective spirits, the Witch thrives on their connection to nature and its secrets. Often misunderstood, their magic is one of harmony and preservation, harnessing both beauty and danger to protect and empower

steps.name: Briar Charm
steps.description: Touch a creature within reach, wrapping them in enchanted thorns until the end of your next turn. If an ally then they gain +5 armor. Melee attackers take [[1d4]] piercing damage. If an enemy then make a Spirit check, on a success they take [[1d6]] piercing damage
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Briar Charm: Rootbind
steps.description: When Briar Charm is used on an enemy, they must also pass a Strength check or become Pinned

steps.name: Briar Charm: Crown of Thorns
steps.description: When Briar Charm is used on an ally, they gain advantage on Intimidation checks and melee attackers have disadvantage on their first melee attack against the ally

steps.name: Briar Charm: Nightshade
steps.description: When Briar Charm is used on an enemy, they must pass a Survival check or gain the Coughing condition

steps.name: Briar Charm: Bloodroot Spike
steps.description: When Briar Charm is used on an enemy, increase the thorn damage to [[2d6]] and you can choose to do Toxic damage

steps.name: Briar Charm: Druid’s Reprieve
steps.description: When Briar Charm is used on an ally, make a Spirit check to also remove 1 Corpus condition.

steps.name: Fog Breath
steps.description: As an action, create a poisonous fog within short range that deals [[1d6]] toxic damage to all creatures that breathe. They must make a Survival check or take the Coughing condition.

steps.name: Forest Cloak
steps.description: Create a cloak of enchanted leaves and bark for you and your allies, giving advantage to Stealth checks. Alternatively, create one Forest Cloak of Shadows that gives a creature invisibility until the end of their next turn
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Spirit Guide
steps.description: As an action, summon a PL3 nature spirit as a companion. They remain as long as you choose, but you can only have one spirit at a time. This spirit can scout ahead, providing you with basic information about the environment

steps.name: Investment: Grovetender
steps.description: You may spend 1 Merchant Token to establish a sacred grove, herbal hut, or forest shrine near a settlement you've visited. This place becomes a point of power, superstition, or healing in your name. Once per in-game month, when you visit or check in with any grove, gain [[1d10 × 5]] gp in herbal offerings, spiritual donations, or charm sales. You also receive a local omen, whispered secret, or wilderness lead tied to the area. Each additional grove increases the multiplier by +1 (×6 for 2 groves, ×7 for 3, etc.)

steps.name: Mysticism Union Access
steps.description: Gain access to a Mysticism Union. You immediately select one Merchant Feature from that Union. You may now visit the Union to request Information and access its unique goods or services.

merchant.name: Undertaker
merchant.desc: The Undertaker is a master of tragic relics and supernatural connections, trading not only in goods but also in memories, spirits, and stories that linger beyond the grave. Their abilities allow them to profit from their unique connection to the afterlife, assisting others in achieving closure or using spectral influence to gather secrets and sway the living.

steps.name: Reliquary
steps.description:
You may channel a spirit into an item for 1 minute, creating a Reliquary. The item glows faintly and whispers with ghostly insight. Once per minute, it can be used to reveal a secret, uncover hidden memories, or relay messages from the dead.
Alternatively, it can be thrown as a weapon to deal [[1d4]] Impact and [[1d4]] Eclipse damage.
You may have a number of active Reliquaries equal to your Spirit check.

steps.name: Reliquary: Weapon
steps.description: You may create a Reliquary using a weapon. For 1 minute, it gains +[[1d4]] Eclipse damage. This effect ends early if the weapon is dropped or disarmed.

steps.name: Reliquary: Armor
steps.description: You may create a Reliquary using armor. For 1 minute, attacks made against the wearer suffer -1 to the attack check. This may be applied up to 3 times per suit of armor (stacking to a max of -3).

steps.name: Reliquary: Value
steps.description: You may create a permanent Reliquary from a valuable item. This increases the item's sale value by 50% and may draw attention from collectors or cursed item hunters.

steps.name: Reliquary: Fear
steps.description: When you use a Reliquary as a weapon, the first time a creature is hit by that weapon they must make a Spirit check or take the Fear condition

steps.name: Reliquary: Compass
steps.description: The reliquary subtly pulls toward a person, location, or object tied to the spirit within. While held, it gently tugs in the direction of the target. Choose a focus (e.g., lost heirloom, buried corpse, murderer, etc.) when you create it. Lasts 1 hour or until fulfilled

steps.name: Reliquary: Anchor
steps.description: Place the reliquary at a location. Spirits and undead cannot cross a within reach range unless they succeed a Spirit check. Lasts 1 minute

steps.name: Revenant Contract
steps.description: As an action, summon a PL[[1d6]] Spirit Revenant for 1 minute to complete a specific task, such as guarding, scouting, or attacking. You can only have 1 revenant at a time. The revenant serves you loyally within this time frame and disappears upon completing its mission.

steps.name: Profane Mark
steps.description: You place a Profane Mark on a creature as a action. You can use it to gain advantage on a check and deal an additional [[1d4]] Eclipse damage. The mark remains for 1 hour and you know the general direction of marked targets Once used, the mark dissipates in a subtle puff of ghostly smoke

steps.name: Investment: Memorial
steps.description: You may spend 1 Merchant Token to establish a memorial site, spirit shrine, or burial marker tied to a death you've witnessed or honored. These quiet places draw the grieving, the curious, and the cursed. Once per in-game month, when you visit or send offerings to any of your memorials, gain [[1d10 × 5]] gp in gifts, mementos, or payment for services rendered in your name. You also receive a request from the dead like a haunting, dream, or message asking you to intervene, retrieve, or resolve something unfinished nearby.

steps.name: Stewardship Union Access
steps.description: Gain access to a Stewardship Union. You immediately select one Merchant Feature from that Union. You may now visit the Union to request Information and access its unique goods or services.

merchant.name: Smith
merchant.desc: The Smith is a class that specializes in the art of crafting weapons and armor. You are highly skilled in the use of tools and materials, able to fix armor quickly and efficiently—even in combat. As a traveling smith, you can craft weapons and armor on the go, repair damage swiftly, and forge unique armors and weapons from the remains of defeated monsters, incorporating their unique abilities into your craft.

steps.name: Benchcrafted
steps.description: Once per day, improve a weapon (+1 damage) or armor (+2 armor) as a permanent upgrade. Effects stack up to a max of +10 for weapons and +20 for armor.

steps.name: Benchcrafted: Quickslap
steps.description: You can use Benchcrafted once per item, per day

steps.name: Benchcrafted: Rigging
steps.description: When you use Benchcrafted on a weapon, you may change its damage type (e.g., to fire, piercing, impact).

steps.name: Benchcrafted: Smokecoat
steps.description: When you Benchcraft armor, the wearer gains the Invisible condition until the end of their next turn. Usable once per Benchcraft.

steps.name: Benchcrafted: Recoil Repair
steps.description: When you benchcraft armor, the armor when it reached 0 will repair [[1d6]] armor

steps.name: Forgemaster
steps.description: When crafting an item from scratch or with a blueprint, all creatures involved have advantage on checks during the crafting process

steps.name: Fuel Line
steps.description: You can imbue a weapon or armor with a potion that can be activated up to 3 times before its fully consumed using a specific trigger such as on hit, when struck, when broken, when dropped and so on.

steps.name: Enchanting
steps.description: When you discover an item with an enchantment, you can move the enchantment to another item, if the item is similar and the item you are moving it to doesn't already have an enchantment.

steps.name: Rapid Repair
steps.description: When you long rest, you and your party’s armor is repaired to full as you labor through the night. When you Press On, everyone can repair their armor for +5 more as you patch them up for the next fight

steps.name: Investment: Forgefront
steps.description:
You may spend 1 Merchant Token to establish a small smithy, workshop, or parts depot in a settlement you've visited. Choose a specialty (e.g., armor repair, bladework, mechanical fittings). Once per in-game month, when you visit or check in with your Forgefront, gain [[1d100 × 5]] gp in local commissions, repair fees, or special orders. You also receive one of the following (chosen each time): A damaged item you can restore for value, A local order request (sidequest or contract), A blueprint or rare part (ingredient or story hook)
You may operate 1 Forgefront at a time

steps.name: Fabrication Union Access
steps.description: Gain access to a Fabrication Union. You immediately select one Merchant Feature from that Union. You may now visit the Union to request Information and access its unique goods or services.

merchant.name: Bibliotaph
merchant.desc: The Bibliotaph is a scholar, hoarder, and quiet manipulator of fate. Obsessively collecting knowledge, they record moments as they happen and use those notes to alter the flow of time, uncover secrets, or influence the outcome of future events. Their enchanted ledger captures more than history, it predicts, rewrites, and remembers what others forget. Some act as advisors or archivists, while others use their knowledge for leverage, blackmail, or personal gain. In the hands of a Bibliotaph, even a simple observation becomes a weapon or a shield.

steps.name: Ledger of Time
steps.description: You carry an enchanted ledger that captures moments in time. As an action, choose one: Now – grant an ally within short range advantage on their next check as you whisper timely insight from your notes. Then – immediately make a single d20 dice roll and record the result. Once before your next Long Rest, you may use an Off-Action to replace any roll you witness (yours or an ally’s within short range) with your recorded result. You may only store one recorded roll at a time.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Ledger of Time: Dual Script
steps.description: When you use Ledger of Time – Then, you may store up to two recorded rolls instead of one

steps.name: Ledger of Time: Margin Notes
steps.description: When you use Ledger of Time – Now, the target also gains +10 armor until the start of their next turn.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Ledger of Time: Red Ink
steps.description: When you use Ledger of Time – Now, the target also gains +2 to their next check

steps.name: Ledger of Time: Burn the Page
steps.description: You can expend a stored dice roll from Ledger of Time – Then and deal that much damage to a creature within short range

steps.name: Paper Armor
steps.description: Fold enchanted sheets into armor plating. As a action, create Paper Armor for a creature, giving +5 temporary armor that crumbles when reduced to 0. You can only maintain one Paper Armor at a time.

steps.name: Book Bash
steps.description: You may use a heavy tome as a melee weapon. On hit, deal [[1d4]] impact damage and push the target 5 ft back. On a critical hit, knock the target Prone as the weight of knowledge overwhelms them.

steps.name: Papercut
steps.description: As an action, send a flurry of razor-sharp loose pages at a creature within short range. Deal [[1d6]] slashing damage and force a Survival check. On failure, the target gains the Bleeding condition.

steps.name: Bookplate Seal
steps.description: When you sell or give a written item (scroll, book, map, pamphlet), mark it with your personal seal. If that item resurfaces in the world, you may learn who has it and where.

steps.name: Investment: Archive
steps.description: You may spend 1 Merchant Token to establish a small archive, reading room, or research scriptorium in a settlement you've visited. Choose a focus (e.g., historical records, arcane theory, local folklore). Once per in-game month, when you visit or check in with your Archive Branch, gain [[1d100 × 5]] gp in research stipends, transcription fees, or scholar donations. You also receive one of the following (choose each time): a lost page, forbidden rumor, or a minor research request (quest hook). You may operate 1 Archive Branch at a time.

steps.name: Scholarship Union Access
steps.description: Gain access to a Scholarship Union. You immediately select one Merchant Feature from that Union. You may now visit the Union to request Information and access its unique goods or services.

merchant.name: Forger
merchant.desc: The Forger is a master of falsehood, crafting arcane seals, altered documents, and hidden truths to manipulate the world around them. They specialize in making the unreal appear official, binding lies in magical ink and concealing evidence behind enchanted signatures. Whether silencing enemies, smuggling contraband, or rewriting the past with a well-placed stamp, the Forger turns paperwork into power. In shadows and backrooms, their name carries the weight of forged empires and sealed fates.

steps.name: Arcane Seal
steps.description: As an action, you conjure a magical seal onto an object or creature within short range. You may have one Arcane Seal active at a time. Your Arcane Seal can be broken as an Off-Action. Choose one effect: Seal of Silence (Ally/Object): The target cannot be detected by magical or investigative means for 1 minute. This includes divination, scrying, and written record scans. If placed on an object, the object is considered unremarkable. Seal of Silence (Enemy): The target must pass a Spirit check or be Silenced (unable to speak or cast spells) for 1 minute. or until broken with an Off-Action

steps.name: Arcane Seal: Psychic Ink
steps.description: On a failed Spirit check, the enemy also takes [[1d6]] psychic damage.

steps.name: Arcane Seal: Linked
steps.description: You can have up to 3 Arcane Seals active at ta time

steps.name: Arcane Seal: Tripwire
steps.description: When a sealed object is tampered with, it releases a silent psychic pulse. The tampering creature must pass a Spirit check or gain the Confused and Pinned conditions until the end of their next turn.

steps.name: Arcane Seal: Trapbreak
steps.description: When an Arcane Seal ends or is broken, you may trigger a secondary effect: either deal [[1d6]] Eclipse damage to the breaker or cause a brief flash that Blinds them until the end of their next turn.

steps.name: Arcane Seal: Hidden Signature
steps.description: When you Seal an object, you may inscribe a hidden rune only you can perceive. At any time, you may find its exact location, even across great distances, as long as it remains sealed.

steps.name: Arcane Seal: Courier
steps.description: When you use an Arcane Seal on an object, you can choose to have the object become invisible except to you for the duration

steps.name: Counterfeit Contract
steps.description: As an action, forge a magical contract that binds two parties. Once signed (willingly or not), both parties must follow the primary clause or suffer -2 to all checks for 1 day. Only one such contract may be active at a time.

steps.name: Forgery Kit
steps.description: You can replicate any written document or signature after studying it for 1 minute. For the next hour, your forged version counts as legitimate to anyone without magical verification. Gain advantage on Influence when using forged documents.

steps.name: Arcane Seal: Courier
steps.description: Your Arcane Seals when placed on object remain until broken

steps.name: Subversion Union Access
steps.description: Gain access to a Subversion Union. You immediately select one Merchant Feature from that Union. You may now visit the Union to request Information and access its unique goods or services.

mage.name: Basic
mage.desc: Basic magic is earned through patience, discipline, and harmony of spirit. It is not granted by any higher power but cultivated over years of dedication. Casters of this path often carry a focus stone or simple staff, carved or found during their long journey of mastery.

steps.name: Innate Spellcaster
steps.description: Spirit is your Spellcasting check. You have trained or been naturally gifted with magic. Gain an additional +3 Spell Points

steps.name: Visual Signature
steps.description: Your spells manifest with a unique color, visible to all. This color provides a +1 bonus to spellcasting checks.

steps.name: Spell Shielding
steps.description: When you cast a spell, gain 3 armor
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Chrono Incompatibility
steps.description: When you sense a Chrono Origin spell being cast, you may deny its effect on yourself for the duration. If you do, you gain the Confused condition.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Visual Signature II
steps.description: Your unique spellcasting color and power strengthen. Your spellcasting bonus increases to +3.

steps.name: Spell Shielding II
steps.description: Armor gained from Spell Shielding remains for 1 minute.

steps.name: Chrono Incompatibility II
steps.description: When you use Chrono Incompatibility, you no longer gain the Confused condition. You may also choose an ally within reach range to gain the protection.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Efficient Casting: Basic
steps.description: Basic Origin spells cost 1 less to cast

steps.name: Efficient Casting: Basic II
steps.description: When you cast a basic spell and get a success+, regain +1 spell point.

steps.name: Chrono Incompatibility III
steps.description: When you use Chrono Incompatibility, you may deny a Chrono Origin spell for all targets within short range.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Cataclysmic Power
steps.description: You can cast a Cataclysmic spell intent once per day for half the Spell Points, but immediately take the Confused and Exhausted conditions for 1 minute

mage.name: Tech
mage.desc: Tech magic draws power from engineered devices that convert energy into arcane force, blending invention with magic through precision and design. Casters of this path wield crafted tools like power gauntlets, core devices, or solar shards to channel their power.

steps.name: Artifex Spellcaster
steps.description: Crafting is your spellcasting check. You have a Tech Device (power gauntlet, arm, visor) as your spell focus. When using it for spellcasting or crafting, gain +1 to the check.

steps.name: Portable Forge
steps.description: You have a Forge Workbench that can be summoned and set as an action. You can perform crafting actions on the go, without the need for a physical workshop. This mobile smithy allows for the repair and creation of items anywhere

steps.name: Disruptor
steps.description: As a 1-hour crafting check, create a device capable of emitting a pulse that temporarily disables magical traps, constructs, or barriers within a reach range. Usable once per long rest

steps.name: Transportation Nodes
steps.description: As a 1-hour crafting check, craft teleportation nodes that are within 1 mile of one another. You can have a number of nodes equal to half your Crafting check, and they last for 1 year before they need to be maintained. These nodes cannot teleport creatures of an opposite magic from your magic path and can drive these creatures insane.

steps.name: Whispers of the Blade
steps.description: As a 1-hour crafting check, bestow sentience upon a crafted weapon. This weapon gains the ability to communicate telepathically with their wielder and provide advantage on one attack roll per long rest due to their tactical guidance. you may have only 1 active Sentient weapon at a time.

steps.name: Artifex Inspiration
steps.description: Regain 1 spell point by crafting or repairing something significant.

steps.name: Engineer
steps.description: Once per long rest, you can craft a temporary magical item without the need for materials. This magical item is imbued with a spell you craft with your words of power that has a feature you design. This item lasts for 24 hours and is a standard weapon unless otherwise specified

steps.name: Storage
steps.description: The Impossible Pocket is a weightless, extra-dimensional pouch that holds up to 10 bulk of items, each no larger than 2 bulk individually. Items are automatically sorted for quick retrieval. Storing or retrieving an item takes an Off-Action. It can also hold a single Tiny creature (1 bulk or less) for up to 1 hour with breathable air, though discomfort begins after 5 minutes.

steps.name: Rapid Recharge
steps.description: As an action, you can choose to Overclock your tech to rapidly regain [[1d6]] spell points that last until the end of your next turn.

steps.name: Fabricator
steps.description: Your device and body work in tandem. Gain additional wounds equal to your Crafting check. When you get a success+ with a crafting check in combat, regain +1 spell point.

steps.name: Quantum Calibration
steps.description: Calibrate your tech to tap into quantum energies, allowing you to reroll any failed spellcasting check or have a creature reroll a successful check against your spells once

mage.name: Arcane
mage.desc: Arcane magic flows through knowledge, study, and the careful shaping of energy by runes and symbols. It is controlled through a spellbook of treated pages and etched sigils, crafted or acquired through great effort.

steps.name: Arcane Spellcaster
steps.description: Intellect is your Spellcasting check. You cast your spells through a book of spells. When you cast a spell that fails, you regain half the spent spell points

steps.name: Spellbound
steps.description: Your Arcane spellbook is a living entity and can be sent on simple tasks or scout an area. It is a PL3, when brought to 0 hp it returns to book form

steps.name: Repel Chaos
steps.description: You can make a spellcasting check as an off-action to resist or dispel Chaos origin magic.

steps.name: Spellbound II
steps.description: Your spellbook becomes a PL6 familiar that is soulbound to you. they take a form of your choosing and can never be unsummoned. When they reach 0 hp they become intangible and float near you until they return to full health, regaining 1 hp per hour

steps.name: Arcane Spellcaster II
steps.description: When you cast spells, regardless of Origin they count as Arcane origin spells.

steps.name: Anchored Impact
steps.description: When you deal damage with a spell, the target must make a Physical check or gain the Pinned condition until the end of their next turn.

steps.name: Repel Chaos II
steps.description: When you successfully use Repel Chaos, the target spell is reflected at a target of your choice within short range.

steps.name: Spellbound III
steps.description: Your spellbook becomes a PL9 creature. When they reach 0 hp they teleport into your inventory as your spellbout for 1 hour. They can cast spells up to a Surge intent, and have 3 spell points total.

steps.name: Spell Channeling
steps.description: Once per long rest, immediately after casting a spell, you can choose to cast the same spell again on your next turn without spending additional spell points

steps.name: Anchored Impact II
steps.description: Once per rest, when you hit a creature with a Surge or higher spell, they gain the Constrained condition for 1 round. On a success+, the effect lasts 2 rounds.

steps.name: Cataclysmic Power
steps.description: You can cast a Cataclysmic spell intent once per day for half the Spell Points, but immediately take the Confused and Exhausted conditions for 1 minute

mage.name: Crystal
mage.desc: You use, break, and wear crystals of all kinds and colors. They give you the power to cast powerful spells and abilities. You have power over crystals that grant you unique abilities over resonance and structure.

steps.name: Crystalline Spellcaster
steps.description: Observation is your Spellcasting check. Your magic refracts through crystalline mediums. Once per day, when you deal spell damage, you may split it to hit a second target within short range for half damage.

steps.name: Refraction Field
steps.description: When you cast a spell, Gain +2 crystal armor (temporary), up to +10 above your max. Replaces older instances. Lasts 1 minute or until you Press On

steps.name: Resonance Trap
steps.description: As an off-action, when a creature within short range casts a spell, you may make a Spellcasting check. On success, they are Slowed for 1 round.

steps.name: Crystallize
steps.description: Once per day, you may encase a creature you can see in crystal. They must make a Physical check to break free, on a failure they are pinned, on a Fail+ they are constrained

steps.name: Reverberate
steps.description: When you cast a spell and get a success+, gain +1 spell point. If the spell hits multiple targets, this becomes +2.

steps.name: Crystalline Spellcaster II
steps.description: Once per turn, when you deal spell damage, you may split it to hit a second target within short range.

steps.name: Vibrational Therapy
steps.description: Develop therapeutic techniques using crystal vibrations to treat psychological or emotional distress. You can remove any Cognitive Conditions on allies as a half-action

steps.name: Refraction Field II
steps.description: When you gain armor with Refraction Field, you can choose to repair your armor for +1 instead of gaining temporary armor.

steps.name: Elemental Reflection
steps.description: Once per day, when you take elemental damage (fire, frost, lightning, etc), you may crystallize part of the energy. Roll a Spellcasting check; on success, reduce the damage by half and deal [[1d6]] of the same type to the attacker.

steps.name: Crystallize II
steps.description: Crystallized enemies who fail their Physical check now also take [[1d6]] piercing damage from shard growth at the start of their turn.

steps.name: Fractal Cataclysm
steps.description: Once per day, cast a Cataclysmic spell for half cost. When you do, it fractures into light and shards. All creatures in a short-range radius take [[2d6]] additional piercing or radiant damage (your choice). You become Blinded until the end of your next turn.

mage.name: Nature
mage.desc: You were probably born under an old willow tree that planted a seed in your belly when you took your first breath. The tree died, and now you have the magic within you. When you pass, you will become the tree and pass your power on to another

steps.name: Verdant Spellcaster
steps.description: Influence is your Spellcasting check. When you are in natural terrain (forest, grassland, jungle), you and your allies regain +1 spell point per hour

steps.name: Tree Speech
steps.description: You can speak Naech, the natural tongue. Plants and animals respond with one-word answers

steps.name: Wild Shape
steps.description: Once per rest as an action, transform into a beast of your size or smaller. Gain its physical traits and movement, and +20 armor. When this armor is depleted, you revert to your true form. You may hold the form indefinitely, but must make a Mental check each hour to maintain control. On a failed check, become Feral for 1 minute. On each subsequent failure, the feral state lasts 1 day, then 1 year per failure. While Feral, you lose control, cannot communicate, and act based on instinct and aggression.

steps.name: Thornskin
steps.description: You leave no tracks on natural ground and move silently in vegetation. When a creature hits you with a melee attack, they take [[1d4]] piercing damage.

steps.name: Root the Tyrant
steps.description: Once per day, target a Dragon, Dragon Origin caster, or magic source. Until the end of your next turn, it is pinned, cannot fly, speak, or use Spellcasting. Must be within short range.

steps.name: Wild Shape II
steps.description: You may now transform into larger beasts (up to one size larger). Gain +40 armor instead of +20.

steps.name: Thornskin II
steps.description: As an action, become invisible while motionless in natural cover (plants, shadows, foliage). Lasts until you move or act

steps.name: Tree Speech II
steps.description: Once per day as an action, You can call and command small plants and beasts. They act as a PL3 Verdant Swarm, and will remain for one minute

steps.name: Flourishing Terrain
steps.description: As an action once per day, turn a short-range area into vibrant terrain for 1 minute. It becomes difficult terrain to enemies and grants +1 spell point per round to allies within. It also contains drinkable water and ambient food.

steps.name: Wild Shape III
steps.description: You gain advantage on Mental checks to retain control. You can now become Mythic beasts up to a Giant size. Gain +80 armor instead of 40

steps.name: Verdant Reckoning
steps.description: You snap your root heart or crush your sprig, unleashing the wild’s answer to steel and smoke. Cracks split the earth beneath your enemies as thorny vines burst upward, twisting through concrete, steel, and flesh. All creatures in medium range must make a Physical check or take [[4d6]] nature damage and gain the Constrained condition for 1 round. Even on a success, they take half damage and are Slowed. Windows shatter. Streetlamps short. The city remembers the forest it buried

mage.name: Vozian
mage.desc: You choose to draw on the most evil energy you can. Ash falls from you wherever you step, your skin is dry and cracked, the skin underneath is dark and tar-like. Demons speak to you as casual friends would, and bright lights feel like whips to your skin

steps.name: Vozian Spellcaster
steps.description: Influence is your Spellcasting check. When you Stress Push a failed spell, gain +10 armor instead of taking damage

steps.name: Pactmark
steps.description: Burn a target with the mark of the Ordealis. Mark one creature within reach. For 1 minute, when you deal spell damage to them, they take +[[1d4]] Vozian damage.

steps.name: Pactmark II
steps.description: You may now have 2 creatures marked at once. If both are within short range of each other, they take [[1d6]] fire damage at the start of their turn.

steps.name: Pactmark III
steps.description: Marked creatures have Disadvantage on saving throws against your spells.

steps.name: Pactmark IV
steps.description: Creatures who die while marked are reduced to ash, leaving no soul or body behind. You gain +1 spell point permanently when this happens to a PL10 or higher creature

steps.name: Pactmark V
steps.description: Your marked creatures cannot teleport, plane shift, or become invisible while marked.

steps.name: Infernal Knowledge
steps.description: Unlock knowledge of demonic lore and the ability to communicate with all demons telepathically, gaining insights and potentially persuading them to share truths or aid

steps.name: Duskwalker
steps.description: As an action, embrace the shadows to become invisible until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Frostwalker
steps.description: Immune to Ice damage and you have the ability to traverse icy terrains effortlessly. Your presence may quell blizzards or summon frost to hinder foes

steps.name: Judgment’s Insight
steps.description: Gain a deep understanding of moral and ethical dilemmas, giving you advantage on Influence checks, allowing you to navigate complex social interactions and detect lies or hidden motives with uncanny accuracy

steps.name: Ordealis Descendant
steps.description: Achieve a profound connection with Ordealis itself, All your spells deal Vozian damage if you choose. As an action, summon greater demons at PL10 without spell points, although they will not be under your command

mage.name: Chrono
mage.desc: You've seen what happens next, and you are trying your best to change the events of the future from the past. Your magic often appears as clocks, sundials, or something similar. The power of Chronus flows through you

steps.name: Speedster Spellcaster
steps.description: Agility is your Spellcasting check. When you roll a Success+ on a spell, regain 1 spell point.

steps.name: Premonition
steps.description: You glimpse the immediate future. Make a Spellcasting check. On success, gain Advantage on your next attack or defense against one creature this turn.

steps.name: Flickercast
steps.description: Your movement no longer provokes reactions if you cast a spell this turn.

steps.name: Premonition II
steps.description: After a successful Premonition, you may teleport to a location within short range as part of your next action.

steps.name: Delay Harm
steps.description: When taking damage, delay it until the start of your next turn. If the source is dead or incapacitated by then, the damage is negated.

steps.name: Premonition III
steps.description: Premonition now lasts until the end of your next turn, applying to all checks against the target.

steps.name: Chrono Reflex
steps.description: Your perception runs ahead of the fight. When initiative is rolled, you may instantly shift to any position within short range, even through occupied spaces.

steps.name: Premonition IV
steps.description: You may grant the effects of Premonition to an ally within short range instead of yourself.

steps.name: Premonition V
steps.description: You may now use Premonition once per turn.

steps.name: Chrono Reflex II
steps.description: You've already moved before they even blink. When rolling initiative, you always act first. If multiple creatures have this effect, compare Agility checks.

steps.name: Time Unbound
steps.description: Once per day Take two consecutive turns. Afterward, gain exhaustion and you lose your next turn as time snaps back into place.

mage.name: Chaos
mage.desc: Embarking on the Chaos Path is akin to striding into a tempest of arcane unpredictability, where the very essence of magic ebbs and flows with the caprice of the unknown. Those who wield Chaos magic do not do so by the conventional study or lineage but through an innate, often bewildering connection to the arcane. This connection is as volatile as it is powerful, manifesting in bursts of uncontrolled magic that can as easily aid as imperil

steps.name: Chaos Spellcaster
steps.description: Luck is your Spellcasting check. When you cast a spell, if the final result is even, you regain 1 Spell Point. If Odd, gain or remove the Pinned condition

steps.name: Mad Belief
steps.description: You reject reality and substitute your own. Choose a personal delusion (e.g. "Fire can't hurt me," "I was never born," "The stars obey my commands") and roleplay it with conviction. While doing so, you gain +1 to all spellcasting checks. If your delusion is broken (e.g. proven wrong), you lose this bonus until your next Long rest.

steps.name: Discordant
steps.description: When you cast a spell, if the result is even, the spell's damage or healing is increased by +[[1d6]]. If the result is odd, you take [[1d6]] Acid damage. After this triggers once, you must choose a different damage type for future uses.

steps.name: Chaos Correction
steps.description: Order is an insult. Once per day, as an action, you may shatter an Arcane origin effect with a burst of chaotic energy. If the target is a mage, they are silenced and cannot cast spells until the end of their next turn. Structures, barriers, or ongoing effects of Arcane origin are unraveled.

steps.name: Discordant II
steps.description: After casting a spell, if the result is even, you may teleport 10 ft in any direction. If odd, an enemy within short range teleports to you instead.

steps.name: Discordant III
steps.description: After casting a spell, if the result is even, you may apply a non-major condition to the target. If the result is odd, you gain a random condition.

steps.name: Eyes of the Unreal
steps.description: Your vision fractures across timelines and lies. You can see illusions, glamours, and invisible creatures at all times. Once per rest, you may declare a hidden truth (such as "He’s already dead" or "This isn't real"). All creatures within reach must make a Mental check or gain the Confused condition as reality shudders around them.

steps.name: Discordant IV
steps.description: If the result of a spell is even, gain +9 temporary Armor until the start of your next turn. If odd, your Armor is reduced by -3 instead (minimum 0).

steps.name: Warp Fuel
steps.description: Cast a spell as an off-Action, if the result is even you can do this again. If the result is Odd then you cannot use Warp Fuel again until the end of a Long Rest

steps.name: Discordant V
steps.description: When you succeed on a damaging spell and the result is even, the spell also affects one additional enemy within reach. If odd, it also affects an ally in reach instead

steps.name: Chaos Control
steps.description: You don't leave chaos to chance. Once per rest, you may deny any Odd result from your chaos features or spellcasting and treat it as Even instead. Doing so causes a random minor mutation until your next rest, such as glowing eyes, reversed speech, or smoking skin.

mage.name: Life
mage.desc: Whether it be your life or another’s, you wield it as a power of your own. This can be your blood or the plants and animals around you. After you cast spells, you and things around you have a little less brightness to them

steps.name: Life Spellcaster
steps.description: Survival is your Spellcasting check. When you cast a spell that applies Healing, heal for double.

steps.name: Shared Vitality
steps.description: As an action, link your life force with 1 willing creature within reach. Once linked, you may transfer Wounds between you and them at will during your turn. The link lasts 1 minute or until either creature drops to 0 Wounds. you cannot link with another creature until the end of the minute.

steps.name: Not Yet
steps.description: If you would gain the Death condition, make a Spellcasting check. On a success, you remain alive with 1 Wound instead. This cannot be used again for 1 month. Each time you succeed, you appear more withered or spectral.

steps.name: Shared Vitality I
steps.description: You may now link with up to two willing creatures at once. When transferring Wounds, divide them freely between linked targets. The link ends for all if any one creature drops to 0 Wounds.

steps.name: Aura of Decay
steps.description: As an action, release a necrotic bloom in reach range. All enemies take [[2d6]] Eclipse damage, and you heal for half the total. Nearby plants wilt, insects fall, and the very air seems drained of warmth and motion.

steps.name: Not Yet II
steps.description: Over the course of a long rest, you may create a Soul Container. This is a object that can be worn, carried, or placed anywhere on the same plane. You can have only one Soul Container at a time. If you would gain the Death condition, your body perishes and your soul is drawn to the Soul Container, which is destroyed in the process. Your body is reborn in [[1d6]] days near where the container was placed

steps.name: Shared Vitality II
steps.description: You may also transfer armor and spell points between linked creatures during your turn. Transferring armor or SP causes faint glowing veins to pulse between the connected bodies.

steps.name: Loyal Guard
steps.description: You have a number of minions equal to your Survival check, each at PL2. When grouped, they act as a swarm with total PL equal to twice your Survival. These minions are bound to your life force and will only defend you or your Soul Container without question.

steps.name: Shared Vitality III
steps.description: Once per link, you may transfer one non-major condition (such as Bleeding, Burning, or Slowed) from a linked creature to yourself as an Off-Action.

steps.name: Not Yet III
steps.description: You no longer age and are considered Immortal. You can have up to 7 Soul Containers hidden throughout the world, but they give off powerful life magic aura that creatures are drawn to.

steps.name: Loyal Guard II
steps.description: You maintain an unseen army stationed in a location of your choosing. Their total number is unknown even to you. They may be bound spirits, living cultists, creatures of nature, or creations of life magic. When you arrive, they stir to readiness. You are also guarded by 2 personal companions at PL10 who remain nearby at all times unless commanded otherwise.

mage.name: Elemental
mage.desc: You are a conduit of elemental power. Through you, the elements unite and empower your spells. The solidity of stone, the fervor of fire, the fluidity of water, and the whisper of air all combine to form a tapestry of elemental mastery.

steps.name: Elemental Spellcaster
steps.description: Agility is your Spellcasting check. Once per day, when you are hit by elemental damage, you may absorb it and gain armor equal to the damage instead of taking it.

steps.name: Fire Affinity
steps.description: Your command over flame empowers you. All your spells can deal an additional +2 fire damage.

steps.name: Lightning Affinity
steps.description: As an action, dash in a short-range line as a lightning bolt. You do not Provoke and deal [[1d4]] lightning damage to each creature in your path.

steps.name: Ice Affinity
steps.description: The cold empowers you. As an off-action, coat your skin in ice, gaining 3 armor. If hit with a melee attack, deal 1 ice damage to the attacker

steps.name: Air Affinity
steps.description: The winds lift you slightly above the ground. You do not trigger weight-based traps and gain +10ft movement speed.

steps.name: Stone Affinity
steps.description: As a half-action, summon 10 armor made of stone. It lasts for 1 minute or until broken, cannot use again until the armor is depleted or removed.

steps.name: Dual Affinity
steps.description: Once per rest, you may activate two elemental affinities at the same time as a single Action. Both effects trigger as if used normally

steps.name: Water Affinity
steps.description: As an action, merge with a body of water large enough to contain you. While merged, you are invisible and untouchable by physical means. If the liquid takes damage, you take half.

steps.name: Smoke Affinity
steps.description: As an action, exhale choking smoke at a target within reach. On a failed Survival check, they are blinded and coughing until the end of their next turn.

steps.name: Acid Affinity
steps.description: As an off-action, coat your body or weapon with corrosive magic. Your next attack or spell deals +2 additional acid damage

steps.name: Dual Affinity II
steps.description: You may use Dual Affinity twice per day. If you use more than twice before a Long Rest, take [[2d6]] psychic damage

mage.name: Dragon
mage.desc: You were blessed by a dragon or have a draconic bloodline. The power of Khalas, the god-dragon, compels you. You feel the need to travel to the dragon island at least once in your life.

steps.name: Dragon Spellcaster
steps.description: Strength is your Spellcasting check. Once per day, after casting a spell that deals damage, you may roar and deal [[1d6]] extra damage of your Dragon type (choose fire, ice, lightning, or acid) to all enemies within short range

steps.name: Scaleskin
steps.description: Gain +1 to all checks and +5 natural armor. This armor is permanent and can be healed or repaired like normal armor.

steps.name: Territorial Fury
steps.description: Once per day, as an action, when you sense Nature-origin magic nearby, you may enter a draconic rage for 1 minute. While raging, gain +2 Strength and enemies using Nature-origin spells within short range have disadvantage on Spellcasting checks against you. This rage ends early if you take the Charmed condition.

steps.name: Dragon’s Breath
steps.description: Choose a dragon type from the known dragon types. You gain a breath weapon of that type, usable as an action. It affects all creatures in a cone within reach range and deals [[1d6]] damage of your chosen type.

steps.name: Scaled Companion
steps.description: As an action, for 1 hour summon a small dragonkin companion (PL 4) resembling a pseudo dragon, drakeling, or wyrmling of your dragon type. It flies, speaks your language, and shares your elemental affinity. The companion can deliver touch spells, scout, or attack with [[1d4]] elemental damage.

steps.name: Scaleskin II
steps.description: Increase Scaleskin to +2 to all checks and +10 natural armor.

steps.name: Dragon’s Breath II
steps.description: Your breath weapon now deals [[2d6]] damage and pushes affected creatures 5 feet away on a failed Physical check.

steps.name: Scaled Companion II
steps.description: The companion becomes PL 6, your breath attack, and remains summoned indefinitely unless slain. They return after a Long Rest

steps.name: Dragon’s Breath III
steps.description: Once per long rest, you may empower your breath weapon: increase the range to medium and double the damage dice. Additionally, enemies that fail their check gain a Corpus condition of your choice

steps.name: Scaleskin III
steps.description: You grow dragon wings. You can fly at your movement speed while not wearing Hefty armor

steps.name: Draconic Ascendance
steps.description: Once per long rest, become a true dragon for 1 minute. You are Giant sized, gain +50 armor, flight is not impeded by armor or additional creatures, and deal +[[2d6]] damage with spells. After you become Stunned and Exhausted for 1 minute, this cannot be removed by any means

mage.name: Celestial
mage.desc: You were blessed by angels or gods, and your power radiates from you even when you're not casting spells. There is a glow about you, and good-aligned creatures say you smell like fresh food and a hug from a lost love. Often, creatures begin to cry around you without explanation

steps.name: Celestial Spellcaster
steps.description: Spirit is your Spellcasting check. When you Stress Push a failed spell, choose an ally within reach. They gain a Divine Shield that negates the next source of damage within 1 minute.

steps.name: Divine Shield
steps.description: As an action once per day, grant a creature within reach a shimmering shield of light. The shield negates the next instance of damage and fades after 1 minute if unused.

steps.name: Lightbringer
steps.description: Summon a weapon of radiant light that lasts for 1 minute. The weapon takes the form of any melee weapon and can be wielded by you or an ally. It uses Agility, Spirit, Strength, or your Spellcasting check for attacks and deals [[2d6]] Solar damage

steps.name: Radiance
steps.description: As an off-action, deal [[1d6]] Solar damage to creatures you choose in reach range

steps.name: Solar Walk
steps.description: You step into a ray of light and become intangible until the end of your next turn
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Radiance II
steps.description: You emit a soft glow in reach range at all times if you choose. Radiance and your Celestial spells deal an additional +2 Solar damage

steps.name: Solar Walk II
steps.description: While intangible from Solar Walk, you can deal half damage to non-intangible creatures with your physical attacks.

steps.name: Radiance III
steps.description: You understand divine patterns. You may cast Celestial spells silently or without gestures, Vozian origin spells and features cannot stop your Spellcasting

steps.name: Solar Walk III
steps.description: When you are intangible from solar walk you can see invisible creatures and illusions

steps.name: Radiance IV
steps.description: Immune to Solar damage and immune to Charm. Your healing spells remove 1 Cognition condition on a success++ if the target has any.

steps.name: Clarion Call
steps.description: You can cast the Clarion Call spell once per day without the use of Spell Points

mage.name: Blinkjack
mage.desc: Blinkjacks are arcane hustlers who weave chaos magic into every sleight, shuffle, and sudden step. Masters of misdirection, they vanish mid-sentence, reappear with a grin, and leave behind illusions, traps, or a blur of afterimages. Their spells are stored in marked cards, hidden sleeves, or swirling decks that burst with unpredictable energy. A Blinkjack doesn't just cast magic—they gamble with it, bending the odds with flair, charm, and precision. Whether dodging blades, flipping spells across space, or swapping places with an unsuspecting foe, Blinkjacks always keep the last card hidden until it counts

steps.name: Blink Trick
steps.description: As an action, teleport to a visible space within short range. Before or after, make a Spellcasting check. On a Success++, gain Advantage on your next attack this turn or give an adjacent enemy the confused condition until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Blink Trick: Split Image
steps.description: You leave behind a semi-real illusion (PL 2) when you teleport. It lasts until hit or the start of your next turn and draws enemy focus

steps.name: Blink Trick: Sleight Cast
steps.description: You may cast a Whisper Intent spell as part of Blink Trick. If the check fails, the spell fizzles but the teleport still occurs

steps.name: Blink Trick: Reversal
steps.description: If attacked before your next turn, you may Off-Action teleport back to the location you Blinked from. If you appeared adjacent to an enemy, you may instead switch places with them.

steps.name: Blink Trick: Flashjack
steps.description: Once per long rest, Blink Trick can teleport you twice on the same turn. Each teleport can trigger its effects separately.

steps.name: Deckload
steps.description: You carry an enchanted deck. Once per day, draw a random magical card (roll 1d6) for a wild Blinkjack effect, such as teleporting randomly, confusing enemies, stealing SP, or gaining temporary buffs

steps.name: Displacement Gambit
steps.description: As an action, make a Spellcasting Check. On success, swap a creature’s location with another creature or object within short range. If the swap fails, the target is Pinned until end of their next turn and you take the Confused condition

steps.name: Handsnare
steps.description: When a creature casts a spell or uses a magical item within reach, make a Spellcasting check as an Off-Action. On success, steal [[1d4]] Spell Points from the target

steps.name: Card Trick
steps.description: As an action, throw a charged card at a target within short range. Make a Spellcasting check. On a hit, deal [[1d6]] fire damage and choose: teleport to the target or explode the card to deal [[2]] splash damage to adjacent targets.

steps.name: Spatial Slip
steps.description: When you take damage, you may teleport a short distance as an Off-Action. If you do, reduce the damage by [[1d6]]

steps.name: Blink Strike
steps.description: When you teleport adjacent to a creature, your first melee attack against them this turn gains +2 to hit and deals +2 additional damage

mage.name: Glimrunner
mage.desc: Glimrunners are charm-laced couriers of the feywild’s black market, slipping between planes with trick bags, illusion veils, and silvered lies. Masters of misdirection, they stash contraband in glamoured satchels, vanish into vine-choked paths, and swap faces like playing cards. Whether fleeing a noble’s guards or slipping a cursed ring across borders, a Glimrunner always has one more escape in their pocket

steps.name: Trickpack
steps.description:
You carry a glamour-charmed satchel. You may store one item inside that cannot be detected by any means. Once per turn, an ally or yourself may reach into the satchel and retrieve one of the following random items:
1. Banana Peel: A creature stepping on it must pass an Agility check or fall Prone.
2. Alarm Clock: Emits a loud clang at a set time, alerting or distracting creatures in reach range.
3. Potion of Water: Can be used to quench flames, trigger water-based effects, or hydrate.
4. Throwing Sand: Blinds one adjacent creature until the start of their next turn on a successful Agility check.
5. Fey Cigarette: Grants +2 Influence for 1 minute, but gain Stealth Disadvantage.
6. Paper Mask: Grants a fake identity (Disguise) for 1 minute or until removed

steps.name: Trickpack: Bottled Surprise
steps.description: If you store a potion in the Trickpack, it replicates over time. Once per day, a creature may draw out a potion and make a Luck check, on a success the potion is duplicated

steps.name: Trickpack: Delivery Trick
steps.description: When an ally interacts with your pack, they may choose to gain a single-use glamour disguise, a fake ID, or a forged document. These vanish after 1 minute or when inspected magically

steps.name: Trickpack: Fey Junk Drawer
steps.description:
Add three new randomized items to the draw table:
1. Rust Marble: When placed on metal, causes light corrosion. Weaken a weapon or structure, reducing its effectiveness or integrity.
2. Spectacle Stone: Holding it to your eye allows you to detect magic, illusions, or invisible creatures in reach range until the end of your next turn.
3. Heartseed Charm: A dried seed that warms when near strong emotion. Grants +2 to checks involving empathy, Influence, or Intellect for 1 minute.
4. Scorch Rock: A hot coal-like pebble. Can ignite dry material or deal [[1d4]] Fire damage if pressed to a creature’s skin

steps.name: Trickpack: Getaway
steps.description: Once per day as an action the Tripack and whoever is holding it becomes invisible and Intangible until the end of your next turn.

steps.name: Trickpack: Hidden Edge
steps.description: If you store a weapon in the Trickpack, it gains the Concealed trait and deals +2 Nature damage the first time it’s drawn in combat.

steps.name: Trickpack: Rootrunner
steps.description: Once per day, you may command your Trickpack to transform into a living, fey-grown getaway mount or vehicle. It sprouts mossy wheels, bark plating, and thorn reins, or takes the form of an oversized forest creature. It has short-range flight or wall-climbing and can phase into overgrowth as an action, vanishing from pursuit. The Trickpack cannot be used for other effects while in this form and reforms at your side after 1 hour or when dismissed. May only be activated in natural terrain or when near a feyline.

steps.name: Trickpack: Satchel Toss
steps.description: As an action, you may throw your Trickpack at an enemy within short range. On a hit, the target becomes Confused and takes -2 to all checks until the end of their next turn. The pack teleports back to your hand immediately after.

steps.name: Trickpack: Tagalong
steps.description: As an action teleport to your Tripack no matter where it is. You arrive wearing the pack.

steps.name: Trickpack: Whistle Recall
steps.description: As an Off-Action, you may teleport your Trickpack to your hand from any distance, even across planes, as long as it hasn't been destroyed or sealed.

steps.name: Accomplice
steps.description: You gain a loyal fey creature companion PL3. It has a mischievous mind, small form (like a beaver, armadillo, or weasel), and instinctive understanding of your smuggling routes. If defeated, it reforms after a long rest at a hidden glade, shady speakeasy, or pocket realm of your choosing.

mage.name: Chrysoracle
mage.desc: Chrysoracles are desert-born mages who commune with insect kind, binding spells into scarabs and carving power into bone and chitin. With plague-touched swarms and relics drawn from sunken tombs, they command a blend of crystal magic, hivecraft, and coursework. Whether cloaked in beetle-shell armor or erupting from beneath the sand, a Chrysoracle is never truly alone

steps.name: Swarm
steps.description: You command a living swarm of insects of your choice (scarabs, locusts, beetles, moths, etc). The swarm is PL2 and has Flight equal to half your movement. It may move up to medium range from you. Once per round, the swarm may attack a creature in reach, dealing [[1 + PL]] Piercing damage. The swarm cannot carry objects or interact with complex tools, and disperses if reduced to 0 HP, reforming after a long rest.

steps.name: Chitin Shell
steps.description: Once per day, encase yourself in hardened beetle shell. Gain +20 Armor and immunity to Slashing and Impact damage for 1 minute. Your movement speed is halved during this time.

steps.name: Dunewalker Anklet
steps.description: Grants immunity to terrain penalties from sand, ash, or gravel. Once per rest, you may teleport to any creature standing on desert terrain within medium range.

steps.name: Locust Totem
steps.description: Once per day, summon a cloud of illusory locusts. All creatures within reach range must pass a Mental check or become Confused until they can no longer see you.

steps.name: Scarab Mirror
steps.description: Once per day, you may reflect a single-target spell back at its caster. Make a Spellcasting check; if your result exceeds theirs, the spell is reflected. On failure, you take the full effect of the spell and double damage.

steps.name: Swarm: Armored
steps.description: Increase your Swarm's PL by +1. Once per long rest, you may call your swarm to shield you or an ally. Until the end of your next turn, the target gains +10 armor
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Swarm: Elite
steps.description: Increase your swarm’s PL by +1. One insect in your swarm becomes an Elite with equal PL and a larger form. The Elite acts independently and gains all your swarm’s abilities.

steps.name: Swarm: Heavy Hive
steps.description: Increase your swarm’s PL by +1. Your swarm can now lift or carry medium or smaller objects. It can slowly retrieve weapons, drop potions, carry armor, or manipulate switches. Creatures may resist being carried with a Physical check.

steps.name: Swarm: Hive Weapon
steps.description: Increase your swarm’s PL by +1. You may bind the swarm to a melee or ranged weapon you wield. While fused, the weapon gains +2 to hit and deals +4 Toxic damage. The swarm cannot attack independently during this time.

steps.name: Swarm: Impaler
steps.description: Increase your swarm’s PL by +1. Your swarm burrows beneath a creature and erupts in a pillar of chitinous spikes. The target takes [[1d6]] Piercing damage and is Pinned until the end of their next turn. If already Pinned, they are Slowed instead.

steps.name: Swarm: Plague-Touched
steps.description: Increase your swarm’s PL by +1. Its attacks deal an additional [[1d4]] Toxic damage and impose -2 to the target’s next check until the end of their turn.

mage.name: Callshot
mage.desc: Like a cowboy with creature cards. Summons beasts or spirits like pulling guns—duel-style, one after another.

steps.name: Chain Lash
steps.description: You conjure a spectral chain and lash a creature within reach range. On a hit, deal [[1d6]] Vozian damage

steps.name: Chain Lash: Embercoil
steps.description: Your chain becomes searing hot. On a hit, deal an additional [[1d4]] Fire damage. If the creature is Flammable or wearing easily ignited clothing they take the damage again at the start of their next turn

steps.name: Chain Lash: Piercing Hook
steps.description: The chain now embeds. On a Success+ with Chain Lash, the target is Pinned until the end of their next turn

steps.name: Chain Lash: Chainwalk
steps.description: The chain pulls them to you. On a Success+ with Chain Lash, the target is pulled towards you 5ft, if they are already next to you they become prone on a failed strength check

steps.name: Chain Lash: Hellwrangler
steps.description: Your Chain Lash now has Short Range and deals an additional +2 damage

steps.name: Chain Lash: Pinpoint
steps.description: If the target is Pinned, your Chain Lash deals +[[1d6]] damage and ignores Immunity to Vozian damage.

steps.name: Chain Lash: Overcoil
steps.description: Once per turn, If the target is Pinned, you may make a second Chain Lash attack on them with +2 to hit. On hit, the target is Prone until the end of their next turn

steps.name: Ricochet
steps.description: Once per day, when you cast a single-target spell and miss, you may redirect it to a new target within short range. Reroll the check at disadvantage

steps.name: Trigger Finger
steps.description: You may cast any single-target spell as an Off-Action if the target is Pinned and Prone

steps.name: Six-Second Surge
steps.description: If you deal damage with a spell and kill a creature with it, you regain 1 Spell Point. This can trigger once per round

steps.name: Smoke Sigil
steps.description: When you cast a spell, you may leave behind a drifting, ghostly sigil in the air. As an Off-Action within 1 minute, you may detonate it, forcing all creatures adjacent to it to pass a Mental check or become Blind

mage.name: Moonshiver
mage.desc: The Moonshiver does not just throw fireballs. They dim the lights, strike a chord, and pour something strong. Masters of elemental charm and cocktail magic, Moonshivers conjure hidden lounges in the spaces between moments. These mystic speakeasies pulse with mood and melody, shielding allies and disarming enemies with subtle enchantments. Fluent in Etheros and laced with fire, frost, and smoke, their magic blends charm and danger in equal measure. Whether soothing tension or unleashing a corrupted void demon with a jazz flourish, the Moonshiver always casts with style

steps.name: Lounge
steps.description: Once per day, conjure a pocket-sized elemental speakeasy in short range. The lounge appears as a swirling mirage of light, shadow, and music. It lasts 1 minute and can hold up to 6 creatures. While inside, allies gain +2 to non-combat checks and recover 1 SP at the end of each of their turns. When the lounge ends, all creatures are ejected in a burst of smoke and light and become Confused until the end of their next turn.

steps.name: Lounge: Smokespout
steps.description: The lounge fills with dense elemental mist. While inside, allies gain immunity to Fire and Ice damage. Once per visit, one creature may become Invisible until the end of their next turn.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Lounge: Moodlocked
steps.description: You may set the emotional tone of your lounge (joy, sorrow, thrill, chill). Creatures who do not match the chosen mood take –2 to all checks while inside.

steps.name: Lounge: Bartender
steps.description: A PL6 elemental Host of your choosing now greets guests. Once per visit, it may serve a magical cocktail that grants +2 to the next Spellcasting check or restores [[1d6]] HP.

steps.name: Lounge: Triple Pour
steps.description: You may now summon the lounge up to 3 times per long rest. Each instance lasts 1 hour.

steps.name: Tongue of Etheros
steps.description: You speak the true elemental language. You may communicate directly with wild or feral elemental creatures. When you make an Influence check to command, persuade, or calm them, you roll with Advantage. This includes summoned elementals not under your control

steps.name: Elemental Binding
steps.description: When you summon an elemental creature, it is automatically bound to your will and does not require a check. Your summoned elementals also gain +10 Armor

steps.name: Flashboil
steps.description: Your elemental spells Ignore immunity

steps.name: Voidtwist
steps.description: Once per long rest, you may corrupt an Elemental summoned by you into a Void Demon. Its PL increases by [[1d6]] and its damage type becomes Psychic. The creature becomes hostile to all creatures and remains active for 1 minute. It has advantage on attacks against you, aware you are the one who twisted its nature.

steps.name: Lingering Mood
steps.description: When a creature is Charmed by you, the effect lingers even after it ends. Until the end of the scene, they take –2 to all attacks against you and hesitate before engaging. This does not prevent combat, but does delay it

steps.name: Jazzmire Pulse
steps.description: You release a pulse of shimmering air, scent, and ambient magic. All creatures within reach must pass a Mental check or be Charmed until the end of their next turn. If they are already Charmed, they become Exposed
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

mage.name: Dreamweaver
mage.desc: Dreamweavers are mystics who draw power from the boundary between waking life and the realm of dreams. To them, sleep is not a weakness but a gateway, a conduit through which they shape illusions, summon entities born of fear and fantasy, and weave mental bonds between themselves and others. A Dreamweaver can influence the thoughts of enemies by dragging them into foggy half-real nightmares or protect allies with dream-wrought shields and tethers of shared thought. They are just as dangerous while unconscious as they are awake, using slumber to cast spells, blur reality, and bind others in a web of unreality. Wherever the Dreamweaver walks, the line between mind and magic grows thin, and sleep becomes a battlefield of its own

steps.name: Drowse
steps.description: Target one creature in short range. If the target is an ally, they gain +5 Armor. If the target is an enemy, they must pass a Mental check or become Slowed until the end of their next turn.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Drowse: Deepening
steps.description: When you use Drowse on a creature that is already Slowed, they must pass a Mental check or become Pinned until the end of their next turn.

steps.name: Drowse: Weighted
steps.description: When you use Drowse on a creature that is already Pinned, they become Constrained. They cannot take Off-Actions and their movement is halved.

steps.name: Drowse: Sleep Spiral
steps.description: When you use Drowse on a creature that is already Constrained, they must pass a Mental check or fall Unconscious until the end of their next turn or until they take damage.

steps.name: Drowse: Dreambind
steps.description: When you use Drowse on an enemy and they fail their check, you may immediately target a second enemy within reach range of that target with Drowse.

steps.name: Drowse: Oneiric Link
steps.description: When you use Drowse on an ally, you may form a dream tether between you and them. Until the end of your next turn, you share your Spell Points, and if they would gain a Cognition condition, you may choose to gain it instead.

steps.name: Drowse: Mindfog
steps.description: When you use Drowse on an enemy, they take [[1d6]] Psychic damage if they fail their Mental check

steps.name: Nightmare
steps.description: Summon a PL5 Nightmare shaped by your intent. It be it a hound of shadow, a crawling hand, or a towering masked figure. When summoned, choose 1 creature, it remains until the target is subdues, surrendered, or dies. The Nightmare considers the target hostile and will relentlessly pursue and attack them. It cannot be Charmed or distracted, and cannot speak or be reasoned with

steps.name: Shadow Mind
steps.description: Once per day, when a creature takes the confused condition create a PL3 dream duplication of them that lasts for 1 minute and is under your control

steps.name: Hauntfog
steps.description: Once per day as an action, create a swarm of illusory insects, fog, or creeping shadows in a medium range area. Enemies inside must pass a Mental check or become Confused, while confused in this way they must move at least half their movement on their turn

steps.name: Weaver message
steps.description: Once per day, you may send a short, dream-wrapped message to a willing sleeping creature anywhere in the world. The creature will remember the message clearly upon waking. If they know and trust you, they may send a brief reply within the dream

mage.name: Rotmaiden
mage.desc: The Rotmaiden draws strength from the damp, rotting corners of the world. Swamps, sewers, alleys, and buried ruins are her domain, places where the living forget and the dead are never truly gone. Her magic is rooted in shroomcraft and decay, shaping fungus, mold, and sludge into tools of control and contagion. She does not strike with speed or precision but spreads slowly, steadily, and without mercy. Mushrooms bloom in her footprints, spores hang thick in the air around her, and even metal begins to rust in her presence. Where the Rotmaiden walks, cities wither, stone softens, and flesh remembers it must one day rot

steps.name: Bloom
steps.description: As an action release a bloom of spores that deals [[1d6]] nature damage to enemies and heals allies for +1. This marks affect creatures with harmless rot

steps.name: Bloom: Corpsebloom
steps.description: When a creature dies within short range of you, you may use an off-action to release your Bloom from that corpse
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Bloom: Dense
steps.description: Enemies damaged by Bloom must make a Survival check or gain the Blind condition
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Bloom: Harsh
steps.description: Enemies damaged by Bloom must make a Survival check or gain the Coughing condition
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Bloom: Psychotropic
steps.description: Enemies damaged by Bloom must make a Survival check or gain the Confused condition

steps.name: Bloom: Sustaining Rot
steps.description: When a creature dies that's been marked by your Bloom, gain 1 spell point

steps.name: Choking Puff
steps.description: When a creature within short range gains the Coughing condition, you may use your Off-Action to release spores. That creature takes [[1d6]] Nature damage

steps.name: Fungal Armor
steps.description: As an Off-Action, cause mushrooms to sprout across your body, granting +5 Armor for 1 minute. While active, you are immune to Disease.

steps.name: Rotsense
steps.description: You can detect rot, mold, and decay within long range, even through walls and solid surfaces. This includes spoiled food, structural weakness, infected creatures, and those marked by your Bloom.

steps.name: Scarlet Crown
steps.description: As an action, your head blossoms into a fungal crown, forming a horrific visage of the Rot. All creatures within reach range must make a Mental check or gain the Fear condition until the end of their next turn.

steps.name: Sporelings
steps.description: Once per day as an action, summon a swarm of fungal sporelings (PL2) for 1 minute. They cling to nearby targets, dealing [[1d4]] Toxic damage each round and counting as Difficult Terrain.

mage.name: Tattooist
mage.desc: The Tattooist is a living spellcrafter who binds magic into ink and skin. Through steady hand and arcane focus, they inscribe enduring effects into allies or themselves, weaving passive magic into permanent marks. Each tattoo holds meaning and power like defensive wards, delayed bursts of energy, reactive enchantments, and symbols that shift with intent. Tattooists don't cast in haste; they prepare, they mark, and they empower. Their art becomes legacy, their magic, memory.

steps.name: Ritual Ink
steps.description: During a Long Rest, you may inscribe a magical tattoo on a willing creature that has skin. The tattoo is tied to a specific attribute (e.g., Strength, Agility, Spirit, etc.) and grants +1 to that check. This tattoo is permanent and cannot be removed or changed. A creature may only have one tattoo per check. Creatures without skin may choose an alternative cultural mark (e.g., carved rune plate, crystal embedding, branded crest, fungal bloom), designed collaboratively with the narrator. These marks follow the same rules as tattoos and function identically.

steps.name: Inkreader
steps.description: You can read the history of any magical mark, rune, or scar left by magic. You learn who made it, how old it is, and what it does. Once per day, you may steal a minor benefit from it for one check.

steps.name: Ritual Ink: Anchored
steps.description: The tattoos you create persist through resurrection or transformation. Even if the body changes, the magic and its benefit remain

steps.name: Ritual Ink: Bonded
steps.description: When you tattoo a creature, you form a magical link. Once per day, if they are within medium range, you may use your Off-Action to give them Advantage on one check

steps.name: Ritual Ink: Emberbrand
steps.description: This can be applied as Ritual Ink during a long rest. As an Off-action when hit with a melee attack, deal [[1d6]] fire damage

steps.name: Ritual Ink: Eye of Pain
