steps.description: This tattoo can be applied using Ritual Ink during a Long Rest. As an action, the bearer targets a creature they can see. The target takes [[1d6]] Psychic damage and must pass a Spirit check or become Slowed until the end of their next turn

steps.name: Ritual Ink: Glyph of Return
steps.description: This tattoo can be applied using Ritual Ink during a Long Rest. Once per Long Rest, when the bearer is reduced to 0 Wounds, they instead remain at 1 Wound and teleport up to reach range in any direction.

steps.name: Ritual Ink: Howling Sigil
steps.description: This tattoo can be applied using Ritual Ink during a Long Rest. The bearer may let loose a magical howl as an action. Enemies in short range must pass a Mental check or take -1 to all checks until the end of their next turn. Usable once per day

steps.name: Ritual Ink: Shade Ink
steps.description: This tattoo can be applied using Ritual Ink during a Long Rest. While not in direct light, the bearer gains +2 to Stealth checks. Once per day as an action, they may become Invisible until the end of their next turn

steps.name: Ritual Ink: Smaller Design
steps.description: You may inscribe two tattoos during the same Long Rest. They can be applied to different creatures and affect different attributes

steps.name: Ritual Ink: Wardlines
steps.description: Tattoos you apply grant the bearer +3 wounds per tattoo. This can be imbued retroactively

mage.name: Vaulthexer
mage.desc: Vaulthexers are criminal casters who specialize in breaching what others want locked. They dismantle wards, crack arcane locks, and corrupt protective enchantments with sigils that hum like bad wiring. Not content to stop at doors, a skilled Vaulthexer can break bonds, shatter glyphs, and even overload a weapon or piece of armor with disruptive force. Their art is one of entry and ruin. They do not ask permission—they carve their way through.

steps.name: Cracked
steps.description: As an action cause a Mundane weapon to break until the end of your next turn.

steps.name: Cracked: Lockbreak
steps.description: Cracked can target mundane locks, opening them on a Spellcasting check

steps.name: Cracked: Overload
steps.description: You may now use Cracked on constructs, vehicles, or tech-bound creatures. On a successful Spellcasting check, they become Stunned until the end of your next turn and suffer -2 to all checks. If the target is a vehicle, one system (movement, steering, or weaponry) fails temporarily.

steps.name: Cracked: Shatter
steps.description: Once per day, when you use Crack Sigil on a weapon, you may cause it to shatter completely, destroying the item and dealing [[1d6]] piercing damage to the wielder

steps.name: Hexstitch
steps.description: You may inscribe a temporary glyph on a flat surface. As a bonus action, you may teleport back to that surface from anywhere within medium range

steps.name: Polarity Reverse
steps.description: When interacting with a magical construct, golem, or arcane door, you may attempt a hidden override. On a successful Spellcasting check, you gain control for 1 minute or until your command is resisted

steps.name: Sneakstich
steps.description: As an action become intangible until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Trapstitch
steps.description: You may inscribe a minor glyph trap on an unattended object or container. The next creature to touch it takes [[1d6]] Lightning damage and suffers the Deaf condition. You may maintain one Trapstitch at a time.

steps.name: Sever
steps.description: As an action with a contested spellcasting check, target a magical effect, summoned creature, ongoing spell, or magical item aura within short range. You sever the arcane tether, suppressing the effect for up to 1 minute. If targeting a creature benefiting from a magical buff or item, the buff is suppressed for the same duration

steps.name: Patchcord
steps.description: As an Off-Action, choose one ally within short range. Until the end of your next turn, that ally may use your Spellcasting attribute instead of their own for any one check, including spellcasting, tech use, or mental resistance.

steps.name: Vaultbreaker
steps.description: Once per day, you may construct or summon a PL10 Vaultbreaker, a slow, rune-powered siege device. It can hold up to 10 creatures and is Giant size. It can target a wall, vehicle, seal, or magical barrier within reach as an action but too slow to attack most creatures. Each hit deals [[10]] Impact damage, bypasses non-magical hardness, and forces Spellcasting checks from magical barriers or glyphs to remain intact.

mage.name: Ghostgrifter
mage.desc: Ghostgrifters are sly manipulators of the veil between life and death. They move like whispers, vanish with flair, and cheat fate with uncanny ease. While others fear the dead, Ghostgrifters bargain with them, mimic them, or wear them like costumes. They treat the afterlife like a con—slipping through walls, dodging blades, and leaving behind hollow echoes and false promises. Whether conjuring a second shadow or vanishing mid-blink, a Ghostgrifter never plays fair—and never plays the same trick twice.

steps.name: Spectral
steps.description: As an action become intangible until the end of your next turn. Your attacks while intangible deal 1 damage
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Spectral: Passthrough
steps.description: When you become Intangible, you may choose one creature you pass through immediately within reach. They must pass a Spirit check or become Slowed until the end of their next turn

steps.name: Spectral: Ghostmark
steps.description: When you pass through a creature while intangible allies have +2 to hit and damage on that creature

steps.name: Spectral: Unseen
steps.description: When you become intangible, become Invisible until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Spectral: Comfort
steps.description: You can maintain intangible with your Spectral feature for 1 minute.

steps.name: Spectral: Ghostflash
steps.description: Your attacks while intangible deal Half Damage

steps.name: Spectral: Slipfear
steps.description: When you pass through a creature while intangible deal [[1d4]] psychic damage

steps.name: Spectral: Strider
steps.description: While Intangible, you may move vertically or upside-down along walls and ceilings as if walking on level ground. You ignore terrain hazards

steps.name: Whispering
steps.description: You bind a ghost to a creature by touching them or leaving an item behind. Until the end of your next turn, the ghost whispers false memories or private thoughts to that target, imposing -2 to Mental checks checks to the target

steps.name: Copycat
steps.description: Once per day, you can split your soul, leaving a faint, flickering version of yourself behind. This ghost can walk, talk, and mimic you, but cannot fight. It lasts 1 hour and can distract, scout, or bluff. If an enemy targets it with a spell or weapon, the illusion vanishes and explodes with [[1d6]] Psychic damage in short range.

steps.name: Tethered Bones
steps.description: Choose a single broken object, suit of armor, puppet, scarecrow, or corpse. It becomes a PL2 animated servant for 1 day, glowing faintly with spectral threads. It can follow simple commands (e.g., “stand here,” “follow that person,” “retrieve that key”) and can be stationed as a trap, lookout, or mimic. While active, it can send you one-word telepathic warnings such as “Intruder,” “Fire,” or “Help,” no matter the distance. You may only have one Tethered Bones active at a time

mage.name: Chainbinder
mage.desc: Cowboy executioner turned arcane warden. Uses glowing chains to seal, bind, or lash. Anchors spells to terrain or enemies.

steps.name: Chaincard Summon
steps.description: As an action, summon a Chaincard creature at a point within Short Range. This creature is a bound spirit, beast, or construct with PL6 and often performs one unique action immediately. It remains until the end of your next turn, allowing one additional action before vanishing. Only one Chaincard can be active at a time. With this ability, you summon a Dreamsea Pirate Monkey named Darren, wielding a rusted cutlass and a grudge.
steps.duration: Until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Chaincard: Duel Card
steps.description: You can have 2 Chancards active at one time, your Chaincards are PL8

steps.name: Chaincard: Binding
steps.description: Your Chaincards remain for 1 minute

steps.name: Ember Hound
steps.description: You may summon Ember Hound, a glassy skeletal beast belching fire. On summon, it bites a creature within reach for [[1d6]] Fire damage. If the target is Flammable, they take the same damage again at the start of their next turn. When Ember Hound fades, it bursts in flame dealing [[1d4]] Fire in reach range

steps.name: Mireborn Fawn
steps.description: You may summon Mireborn Fawn, a rotting deer with lilies blooming from its spine. On arrival, it gazes at a target within medium range. That creature must pass a Spirit check or takes the Fear condtion. While present, allies in reach gain +1 to Spirit checks. When it fades, the ground becomes Difficult Terrain within reach

steps.name: Loamhook
steps.description: You may summon Loamhook, a bestial sludge of roots and iron. It hurls a barbed hook at a target in short range; on hit, drag the creature 5 ft toward it and deal [[1d4]] Impact. When Loamhook fades, it spills root-grime on the ground, turning the area into difficult terrain

steps.name: Sir Clatterveil
steps.description: You may summon Sir Clatterveil, a porcelain knight whose sword floats beside him. When summoned gain +5 armor until the end of your next turn

steps.name: Whisperforge Engine
steps.description: You may summon the Whisperforge Engine, a rattling spellsteel spine. It vents compressed soul-smoke Stunning one creature in reach on a failed Survival check when summoned. While active, it ignores all terrain and conditions. When it vanishes, it detonates in a blast of ghostfire and gears, dealing [[1d6]] to all creatures in reach

steps.name: Jaw Lantern
steps.description: You may summon the Jaw Lantern, a floating ribcage with a flickering skull. While active, it glows dimly, revealing invisible creatures and illusions nearby

steps.name: Shacklecrow
steps.description: You may summon the Shacklecrow, a rotten scarecrow lashed with burial wrappings and stitched from bird bones and funerary twine. Its skull clicks sideways as it snaps a binding gesture toward one enemy in reach. The target must pass a Strength check or become Pinned until the end of their next turn

steps.name: Shatterhorn
steps.description: You may summon Shatterhorn, an elemental bull made from stone and ore plates. Upon summoning, it charges short range in a line, dealing [[1d6]] Impact damage to the first creature struck and knocking them Prone

mage.name: Slimespeaker
mage.desc: Ooze-bonded outcast. Casts from a slime familiar that reshapes, eats spells, or fuses with weapons. Urban alley survivor.

steps.name: Oozebound
steps.description: You are bonded to a living ooze symbiote that coats or resides within your body. This ooze grants you +10 Wounds and serves as a focus for your spells. The ooze cannot be removed and shifts to shield, weaponize, or slither as needed

steps.name: Oozebound: Toxic Avenger
steps.description: You gain Immunity to Toxic damage and cannot be poisoned. You can safely eat, breathe, or swim through toxic sludge or rotting matter without harm

steps.name: Oozebound: Reflex Slap
steps.description: At the end of your turn, if any enemy is within reach range, your ooze lashes out at one of them for [[1d4]] Toxic damage. This happens automatically unless suppressed.

steps.name: Oozebound: Climbgrip
steps.description: You may move along walls and ceilings as if they were level ground. Your ooze sticks you to the surface, allowing slow but steady movement. You ignore terrain penalties while climbing

steps.name: Oozebound: Acid Touch
steps.description: You may choose for your melee or unarmed attacks to deal Acid damage instead of their normal type

steps.name: Oozebound: Gutplasm
steps.description: As an action once per day, you may vomit a slime clone of yourself into an adjacent space. This clone is a PL3 ooze that lasts 1 minute, mimics your movement (no spells), and explodes on death for [[1d4]] Acid to all adjacent enemies

steps.name: Oozebound: Vent
steps.description: Once per day, when Injured, your ooze vents toxic pressure. All creatures within short range must pass a Survival check or become Slowed and take [[1d4]] Toxic damage

steps.name: Oozebound: Acidproof
steps.description: You are now completely immune to Acid damage and corrosive effects. Your equipment cannot be dissolved or degraded while worn

steps.name: Sewer Sense
steps.description: You always know the nearest exit, tunnel, or crawlspace within medium range while underground or in urban terrain. You gain +2 to checks to escape, hide, or track others in cities or sewers

steps.name: Gutterborn
steps.description: You have Advantage on Mental checks when dealing with criminals, scavengers, or outcasts. Once during a Long Rest in a city, you may ask around for a local “nobody” for a favor or rumor

steps.name: Unclean Immunity
steps.description: You are immune to common diseases and gain +2 to resist magical diseases, parasites, and poisons. You can eat spoiled food and drink bad water without consequence.
